loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for five years. She requested a loan to buy more carrots, cabbages, and eggplants to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to purchase carrots, cabbages, and eggplants to sell

loans.name: Nawaf Group

texts.en: This group is called Nawaf. It consists of four members who are ladies and operate different businesses. They are hard-working, enterprising women who do not give up easily. They live in Taiz, Yemen. Shafa is 47 years old, married, and has six children. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy, and courteous. She has been selling incense and perfume, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. She has been involved in this business for three years, and her primary customers are local residents. She is turning to AMB to request a loan of 70,000 YER because she has orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers. She would like to buy incense and perfumes, which will increase her profit and enable her to offer a good quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is 50 years old and married with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper. He works in a local electronic shop and sells mobile telephones. He has worked in this field for 30 years and has a monthly income is 140AZN. People's demand for technologies such as mobile telephones is very high since they use it when they need to make a call or send messages, while teenagers use them to access the internet, listen to music or talk to their friends. Unfortunately, Rashid’s monthly income is not enough for him to cover his family’s needs, such as paying their utilities bills and for his son’s education. Therefore, he has applied for a 2,000AZN loan in order to sell other kinds of technologies and to vary his stock in order to increase his income. This is Rashid's third loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to sell other kinds of technologies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a green grocery store in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for three years now and it has been profitable. She is 33 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children.

Mary will be using the loan to buy more stocks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions to sell through her business. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Mary's future hopes are to see her children finish school and to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, such as soap, pepper, rice, and red oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a huge quantity of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Veysal

texts.en:
Veysal is 29-year-old pensioner. He is a widower, and brings up a son and two daughters alone. He has worked as a butcher for nine years (slaughters animals, removes their skins, butchers and sells their meat). His monthly income is 100 AZN.

Azerbaijan cuisine is very rich and full of different kinds of meat dishes. All these recipes need to be prepared carefully. All proportions, amount of ingredients, and even their carving must be done properly. That’s why many housewives or restaurant chiefs of local small restaurants go to Veysal when they need to cut a meat of cow or chicken. 

Veysal does his work at homem and this interferes with his little children studing. Beside that, his monthly income isn’t enough to bring up his children. 

He applied for 1000 AZN to build a small butcher shop and increase his income. 

He hopes that this will help him to make his children’s lives better, and provide them a good education.

loans.use: to build a small butcher shop

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 29-year-old, married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and one son in a small, simple house. Mahmoud is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income of the family. Mahmoud has a problem in his back and he can't work. He needs to have an urgent surgery, but he does not have enough money. 

Mahmoud took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for the surgery on his back. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to treat his back and get back to work, as soon as possible. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for surgery on his back.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in the photo. Nadia is a 53 years old, divorced woman from Jenin City. She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son works in a small store where he sells cosmetics and bags. It is a good business that earns a good income, but he still needs some money to improve it. Therefore, Nadia requested a USD 1,500 loan from FATEN to help her son buy more products for his cosmetics store to sell. By investing this loan in the business, the store sales should increase and in turn the family's income.

loans.use: to help her son buy more products for his cosmetics store.

loans.name: Matia Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Sanjulata belongs to a small village of a district that is located in the coastal area of Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Sanjulata.

She is 41 years old and alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture. She has been in business for years, and things have gone well for her because of the hard work she does. Sanjulata is responsible and persevering, and sells her goods to customers who request them. Her aim is to continue working to get ahead.

Sanjulata is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

All the members of this Matia Mangala SHG group are women. The other members are involved in sales of vegetables, food and drink; agricultural services; fruit and vegetable cultivation, and raising small animals.

Sanjulata is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cropland.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Jamuna and her husband Dilip, live with their two children (one son and one daughter) in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw) in Maynaguri. Their daughter is in class IX (grade 9), and their son is in class VIII (grade 8) respectively. Both Jamuna and her husband are illiterate and only know how to sign their names.

Jamuna is a housewife who looks after her family. Her husband is a van-puller, the only income earner in the family. Though he himself is the owner of the van, still his income is not enough because the van charges are too little in their remote area. 

Jamuna cannot determine what to do sometimes when she becomes unable to cover household expenses along with her children’s education expenses. As both of the children are in secondary classes, their educational expenses are high. For these reasons Jamuna is taking the loan From BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay the school fees, tuition fees, and private tuition fees for her daughter, Jaya, and also to purchase educational equipment, uniforms, etc. for her daughter’s schooling. 

Jamuna is very much ambitious and is always trying to make her daughter Jaya well educated to establish her as a good citizen with a good education. Jamuna and Jaya (in the photo) are immensely gratified by BJS and Kiva because without their support, she and her daughter would not be able to go forward.

loans.use: to pay school fees and tuition fees, and to purchase educational equipment, uniforms, etc. for her daughter’s schooling.

loans.name: Aqil

texts.en:
Aqil is a 42-year-old, married man with two sons. His wife is a housekeeper. He earns money selling different kinds of daily products. His shop is in one of the rooms of his house, on the first floor. He made this condition himself, in order to earn money somehow and his monthly income is AZN 120.

Local people attend Aqil’s small market every day. They buy bread, water, sugar, salt, etc. They have high demand for daily products because they use them in their everyday life. 

Unfortunately, the conditions of Aqil’s shop are very bad. There is dampness in the house and this makes for danger in his shop because he needs to keep products fresh and safe. 

Aqil applied for a loan in the amount of AZN 1,500 in order to repair his shop and renew his assortment of items to sell.

loans.use: to repair his shop and renew his assortment of items to sell.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi is a rural housewife from the village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Fatik, and four children (two sons and two daughters). Both Madhabi and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Two of her children are getting education and read in grade 9 and grade 12. Their two sons work as labourers for daily wages. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).

Madhabi's husband is a carpenter. He buys wood from the wholesalers and makes small wooden furniture like tables, chairs, etc. and sells it in the local market. But due to the growing prices of wood, his business is not going well. So, it has become impossible for him to cover all the expenses of his family, especially the educational expenses of their children.

Madhabi's daughter, Swapna, is now studying in grade 12. She is very meritorious.  If she could get private tuition or coaching, she could do much better on her final examination.

So, Madhabi seeks this loan from BJS to support her daughter's education. This loan will help her to pay the tuition fees and to purchase educational equipment like books, notebooks, pens, pencils etc., and to pay private coaching fees for her daughter's education.

Madhabi and her daughter, Swapna (in the photo), both are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to pay private tuition fees and school fees, and to purchase necessary educational articles for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 35 years old; she is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs, and has been in the business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more milk, andazi, and sodas to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more milk, andazi, and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 28-years-old. She is married with four children. She sells various merchandise. That’s why she is requesting the loan to add more like biscuits, rice and salts for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, rice and salts for sale.

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en:
Rovshan, age 36, is a tailor. He sews and repairs clothing items to earn an income. He has been engaged in this field for the past 10 years and his monthly income is 180 AZN. He and his wife, who is a homemaker, have a son and a daughter. 
 
Rovshan believes that clothing is one of the most important things in people's lives, a thing that represents them. It must therefore be well-made and clean. When something happens to people’s clothes, they are brought to him for repair. When people need new clothes made, they visit Rovshan and he makes beautiful clothing for them from textiles.

At present, Rovshan’s income is not enough to cover his family’s everyday needs. He has therefore applied for a loan in the amount of 2000 AZN. He will use his loan funds to expand his business and increase his income. 

This is his second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to order more textiles and expand his tailoring business

loans.name: Mira Ambika Shg Group

texts.en:
The "Mira Ambika Shg" group consists of nine members from a small village of Jajpur district, Odisha, India, with Tikili selected as the Kiva representative. Tikili has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative; in the photo she is standing with her hand raised. 

Tikili is 35 years old and has been a farmer for ten years. Tikili works as a farmer to provide a standard life for her two children. The community and other farmers know Tikili as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Tikili described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of the People's Forum and the other farmers in her group.	

Tikili will use her Kiva loan portion to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.

She, along with her group members want to say "Thank you" to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer for her cropland.

loans.name: Rabson

texts.en: Rabson is a twenty-eight year old married male with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been dealing in an agriculture business for eight years alongside a timber business for additional income.  He started this business for personal development after vowing to alleviate poverty from his family.  He hopes to buy more land for commercial farming, though seasonal changes and bad debtors challenge his business. Rabson is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for his fields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, aged 26, owns a bar where she sells beer and soda as well as mineral water. With this loan, she would like to buy more beer for resale. The resulting profits will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en: Violette is 37-years-old. She is married with three children; two of them go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to add more new items as a matter of expanding the business through reinvesting.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Baba Dhabaleswar Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is named "Baba Dhabaleswar Shg" and is in a small village of Odisha, India. This small village is very far from the capital, and is in its growth stage. All of the members of the group want to help their families and also their community. All the group members are women.

All of the members work in rural activities, such as raising farmyard animals, vegetable cultivation, etc. Sunamani, the lady standing sixth from the right with her hand raised, is one of the members. She is requesting this loan to buy balanced feed to continue raising her animals. She hopes to continue fighting for her family and to improve their lifestyle.

All the group members are very excited, and they are very grateful to Kiva's lenders for this kind of help and support.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her farmyard animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 25 years old and married. She has had a general store for the past six years. With the requested loan, Amina would like to buy more rice, sugar, beans and cooking oil to sell. She will reinvest any profits from the business back into the store.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell.

loans.name: Alizada

texts.en:
Alizada is a 45-year-old pensioner. He is married and has two sons. His wife is a housekeeper. Alizada has worked as a house builder for 20 years.  He has gained good experience in this field and his monthly income is 140 AZN.

The region that Alizada lives and works in is new. Many families build their new houses or businessmen build offices and markets. These people need a builder’s services and they make different requirements to Alizada’s building team.

Alizada wants to do his job properly because he knows that his job is very serious and he is responsible. He applied for 700 AZN in order to buy new building tools and protective clothing. He wants to increase his income because it’s not enough for him to cover his family’s demands.

loans.use: to buy new building tools and protective clothing

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance, age 26, prepares and sells porridge to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past eight years. She uses her income to help her husband, who works as a driver, to support the family.

Esperance has requested a loan in the amount of 600,000 RWF. With her loan funds, she will buy flour and other ingredients for making and selling porridge. 

The expected increase in profits will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients for making and selling porridge

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 36 years old. He is married, with four children. He sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, Jean Pierre would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. Jean Pierre is very happy with his business and the sky is the limit.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PAN DE AZUCAR DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Clotilde tiene 28 años,es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ropas para bebes,la socia vende chompas,pantalones,casacas en tre otras ropas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,casacas.pantalones y chompas para bebes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a member of the Communal Bank "Señor de Pan de Azucar de Calca", which is located in the District of Calca, Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Clotilde has a business in which she sells clothes for babies. She sells sweaters, pants, jackets, and other articles of clothing. Clotilde works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothes.

Clotilde is requesting a loan in order to buy shirts, jackets, pants, and sweaters for babies. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jackets, pants, and sweaters for babies.

loans.name: Faride

texts.en: Faride is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She sells a variety of items, which she has been doing for six years. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy more charcoal, salt, and bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to add more items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, salt, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 28-years-old. She has two children. With the loan, she wants to buy more sugar, maize, flour and breads for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy more items for better expansion of the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, maize, flour and breads for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale to use in his role as a Community Knowledge Worker

loans.name: Jhoan Sebastian

texts.es:
El estudiante Jhoan Sebastian que actualmente es un estudiante activo de la institución de campo alto vinculado al programa de cocina comenta que durante el primer semestre de estudios en la institución fue como toda una aventura, el junto a los compañeros de clase están satisfechos con el trabajo realizado en el semestre. Cada uno de los profesores enseñó a la manera ahí fue donde sebastian aprendió que la cocina es de amor e interés,  que lleva diferentes variedades modos  y estilos, eso depende del cocinero, pero aun así todos llevan similares cualidades como creativo y amor al trabajo. 
Él se dio cuenta durante todo el semestre que definitivamente la carrera es bastante extensa pero con esfuerzo y dedicación puede lograr muchas cosas en un programa tan interesante como este. 
Desde muy pequeño empezó a llamarle la atención todo lo relacionado con este tema y poco a poco empezó a practicar en casa, preparando lo básico pero al entrar allí abrió la mente y la creatividad, le entrego empeño y amor a pesar de el horario diurno, hacia todo para cumplir con los estudios en el horario nocturno y así poder culminar la carrera como quiere. 
Ahora es el momento donde sebastian se siente ansioso por volver a los estudios y que el segundo semestre al que entra sea de más nuevas experiencias y de mucho conocimiento en la rama gastronómica. Día a día se aprenden nuevas cosas y la mejor forma de enamorarse del mundo es a través de la variedad de comida que hay. Conocer y aprender son muchos de los placeres de la vida pero que más placer es hacer, crear y realizar lo que le gusta, no importa el sitio no importa la hora pero siempre se aprende así sea en camino de casa al trabajo a la universidad o institución donde estudie y sebastian sabe que le espera un largo camino que afrontara con algúno que otro problema, pero por la forma de considerar la vida por medio de la gastronomía es tan interesante como la carrera que con el tiempo mostrara al mundo y sabrá qué campo alto es un paso para una gran huella en la vida por que no solo tuvo un buen profesor y un buen conocimiento también encontró las puertas de un nuevo mundo que se abren para un mejor futuro, el subsidio que le ofrece kiva es muy bueno, ya que se podria economizar algo dde plata alpagar las mensualidades de la carrea, ya que entre menos gastos tenga puede terminar con mas amor y esfuerzo la carrera
texts.en:
Jhoan Sebastian is currently a student at a CampoAlto institute doing a cookery course. He says that his first term of studies was a great adventure. He and his co-students are satisfied with the work they carried out during the term. Each teacher taught in his own way, but Sebastian learnt that cookery is a matter of love and of interest; that there are a variety of styles and modes, and that this depends on the chef, but that they all share the qualities of creativity and love for the work. He realised during the term that the course is definitely quite extensive, but that with a programme as interesting as this one, he could achieve a lot through effort and dedication. He began to be struck as a young child by everything related to cookery and slowly began to practise at home, preparing basic things. However, when he went to the institute, it opened his mind and opened up his creativity. He devoted determination and love to it despite his daily work and he did everything he could to carry out his studies at night and complete the course as he wanted to do.

Now Sebastian feels anxious to return to his studies, because the second term he is about to enter will be packed with new experiences and a great deal of gastronomical know-how. They learn new things daily and it is the best way of falling in love with the world through the variety of food that exists. To know and learn are two of the pleasures of life, but more than pleasure is the doing, the creating and the realisation of what one enjoys, no matter the place or the hour. He is always learning on the way from home to work, to the university or to the institute where he studies, and Sebastian knows that the way ahead is filled with one problem or another. Yet because he considers the gastronomy course so interesting, over time he will show the world and he will know that CampoAlto is one step towards a great track in his life, because not only did he have a good teacher and receive good know-how, but he also found the doors to a new world that is opening towards a better future.

The loan that Kiva is offering is very good, and he will be able to save some money after paying back his repayments for the course, and with reduced costs he will be able to complete his training with more love and effort.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en: Leonille is aged 31. She is a mother of four children. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk to prepare tea and breads for use in her canteen. She has a plan to use the profits to expand her business in the future through the savings that will be obtained from the profits of the business.

loans.use: To buy more tea, bread and milk for sale.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 29-years-old. She is married with two children. Dative owns a bar and has been in this business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and sodas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more beer and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace is 35-years-old. She is married to a house builder. She sells rice, soaps, cooking oil and sugar and she needs more loans to buy extra similar items for sale. She plans to use the profits to add more items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy such items as rice, fish, pepper, oil, and meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Odinakhon

texts.ru: Одинахон 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Одинахон - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Одинахон занимается полеводством, точнее тепличным бизнесом и животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Одинахон, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1,45 ГА земельной доли. На этих земельных долях расположены теплицы, а в теплицах ежегодно выращивает ранние огурцы, помидоры и капусту для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Одинахон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян огурцов, помидоров, а также минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Одинахон планирует вложить в строительство дополнительной теплицы во дворе дома, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en:
Odinakhon is 47 years old, is married, and is raising three children together with her husband. She has a high school-level eduction, and her main source of income is farming -- more specifically, the greenhouse business and animal husbandry, which she started 18 years ago with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Odinakhon now has one dairy cow and 1.45 hectares of land. There are greenhouses on her land, in which she grows early cucumbers, tomatoes, and cabbage for household consumption and for sale.

Odinakhon's monthly income is 17,000 KGS. In order to grow her business, Odinakhon is requesting a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners to buy cucumber and tomato seeds, as well as mineral fertilizers to prepare the soil. Odinakhon plans to use the resulting income to build an additional greenhouse in her courtyard, and wants to save enough money to pay for her son's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to buy cucumber and tomato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced food to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale for use in her role as a Community Knowledge Worker

loans.name: Ingrid Paola

texts.es:
Ella es Ingrid Paola su edad es de 16 años, los aspectos a nivel laborara es que esta persona se pueda desempeñar nivel laborara  de forma eficaz para que se pueda desempeñar y que ella aprenda nuevas cosas laborando en una empresa. 
Los aspectos a nivel familiar es que ella pueda ofrecerle a la familia  una muy buena estabilidad  económica y que ella comparta  momentos importantes en la vida de ellos. 
Ella no estudia esta carrera  por interés económico, ella escogió esta cerrera  porque así ella puede aprender y pueda superarse a sí misma.
Ella entro a primer semestre y se intereso por el convenio con kiva ya que le permite pagar una mensualidad más económica y se podría economizar el dinero para algunos gastos que ella pueda necesitar.
texts.en:
This is Ingrid Paola, age 16. One aspect of her life that she is developing is to doing an effective job at self-improvement and learning new things that will help her acquire employment at a company.

With regards to her family, she wants to provide them with better financial stability and be able to share important moments in life with them.

Ingrid is not studying for a degree because of financial reasons. She chose this path because she wants to learn and excel on a personal level. Ingrid is starting her first semester and became interested in participating with Kiva because it would be easier for her to handle her monthly payments. She would be able to save the money for some of her other necessary expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en: Valerie is 25-years-old. She is married with two children. She has sold fruits and vegetables for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy eggplant, yellow bananas and tree tomatoes. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is a 51-year-old woman. She is married to Azijur, aged 55 years and a green-grocer by profession. Nilima is a housewife and studied up to grade 8. Her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name. They are raising three school-going children (two sons and one daughter). They read in grade 10 and 8 only. They live in their own house in a remote village, Altagram, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Nilima's husband started his shop of selling green vegetables from his little savings ten years back. He has been running the business ever since, gaining respect from his clients. But of late, he has been facing a financial crisis because of the growing educational expenses of their children. He is unable to maintain both the family expenses and his children's educational expenses.

Riju, the younger son of Nilima, is a meritorious student. But Nilima cannot provide him sufficient help to support his education.

So, Nilima has applied a loan from BJS to purchase education equipment like books, pens, pencils, etc., and to pay for private coaching fees for their son's education, so that their son does not face any difficulty in receiving an education.

Nilima and Riju (in the photo) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for this education loan.

loans.use: to purchase educational equipment and to pay school fees and private tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir is a 20-year-old student. He studies at the second course at Ganjha State University. He is a very responsible student and he studies well.

Education is an important part of a person's life. People can't work properly and efficiently, if they don't have education. Even if people have skills, they need to know theory and have a diploma which will make sure that this person is able to work in his or her chosen field. 

Every morning, Zahir drives from his own town to the university, which is very far from his house. He applied for a loan of AZN 2,000 in order to cover his annual educational expenses. He is planning to graduate well and become a highly-qualified lawyer. This is Zahir's third loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to cover his annual educational expenses.

loans.name: Esperanza Para Vivir 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Mayra is the coordinator of her group Esperanza Para Vivir (Hope For Life) 1 & 2. The group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, and known for its tobacco and beef production. The group members are dedicated to selling clothes, food, shoes and jewelry.

Mayra is a single woman without children who lives in a simple house with her parent's family. Besides helping her parents financially, she is dedicated to working hard to save money and grow her business.

Mayra has been running her business around five years. She started taking loans with Esperanza International because she needed capital to increase her sales and inventory. She is excited to receive her eighth loan, from which she will invest to buy various products like cosmetics, clothes and shoes.

Mayra will reinvest her profits in her business, she is dreaming to have a general store and provide all her community's needs. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy different products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, which is called Fe y Amor (Faith and Love) 1 & 2. Her group is located in Santiago, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business. 

Maria is excited to receive her eleventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She has been running her business for about seven years. She started selling groceries in a small stall, and now she is running a 'colmado' (a small food market). 

This loan will be used to buy such goods as flour, sugar, eggs, rice, and beans. She will use the expected profits to increase her savings and reinvest in her business. 

She is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy such goods as flour, sugar, eggs, rice, and beans for her food market business

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.ru: Азизчон уроженец района Носири Хусрав. Ему 25 лет. Он начинающий бизнесмен. Он хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Азизчон умеет обращаться с животными и считает, что его бизнес получит успех. У него имеется коровник и на деньги от кредита он купит бычков со скотного рынка района Шахритус и после длительного откорма продаст с наценкой. Азизчон верит и надеется, что ему помогут, и он начнет бизнес. Даход он снова вложит в бизнес и выгоду потратит на улучшение жизненных условий.
texts.en:
Azizjon is 25 years old and is a native of the Nosiri Khusrav district. He is a beginner businessman and wants to start a business in animal husbandry. Azizjon is good with animals and thinks that his business will be successful.

Azizjon already has a cowshed, and plans to use this loan to buy bull calves at the cattle market in Shahritus district, fatten them, and sell them at a higher price. Azizjon believes and hopes that he will receive assistance and will be able to start his business. He plans to re-invest his income in the business and use the profit to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start a buying and selling business

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.fr: Eugenie est une femme de 29 ans, célibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 allant à l'école. elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant produits cosmétiques, mèches et greffes afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Eugenie is a 29-year old woman, single and the mother of three. Two of her children are in school. She owns a beauty salon in  a local neighborhood and has been managing it for three years. She is seeking this loan in order to replenish her merchandise stock by buying cosmetic products, braided hair extensions and  hairpieces  so as to meet her growing customer demand and increase her sales volume. The resulting  earnings will be reinvested in her business and used to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en: Ankhbayar is 25 years old. He lives with his parents and four brothers in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a geologist at a mining company for almost two years. Using his previous loan, he renovated his parents' old apartment. Now, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay his tuition fees. He is studying for a master's degree at university. If he succeeds in this degree, a lot of opportunities will open up for him. Ankhbayar is a young, energetic and hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor, tiene la edad  de 64 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes foliares para aplicarle en esta época de verano y así que el cultivo se mantenga en un buen estado y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de mejoramiento de las condiciones del suelo como lo son terrazas a curva de nivel  y así en la época de lluvias evitar lo más que se pueda la erosión del suelo y de esta manera mantener la capa de fertilidad del suelo y de ante mano aprovechar mejor los nutrientes naturales de la tierra, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Víctor is 64 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children, who are his main priority. Víctor intends to use this loan for buying foliar fertilizers that he can apply during the summer season. By applying these to his crops, he will keep them in good condition. He will also pay laborers to improve the condition of his land. Víctor will have them build curved terraces that will help prevent soil erosion during the rainy season. This will maintain the fertility and preserve the natural nutrients in the soil. He will also take advantage of the weather and other conditions that favor the cultivation of coffee.

By making these improvements to his crops, Víctor hopes to earn a bit more profit so that he can improve his family's living conditions. This will also allow him to invest a little more into his farmland and also accomplish a few other goals.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. Víctor has not received any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy foliar fertilizers for his crops and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional fish, meat, and fufu to sell.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 40-year-old hardworking businessman trading in local brew. He works six hours per day, all week. Denis is the father of two children and he hopes to give his children all the best in life. The reason he started his business in 1994 was to earn income which he would use to cater for the family's needs. The business is located in Kichwamba in Bunyaruguru, and his clients are mainly people from Katunguru and Kichwamba counties. 

Denis would like to use the money (One million Five Hundred Thousand shillings only) to buy more jerry cans of local brew, which he hopes to sell at a profit, which will him help him to expand his business. 
To get more income, Denis also does some coffee farming. Denis' main challenge are the people who never pay their debts and this lessens his business profits. Despite the challenges faced in the business, Denis is hopeful that he will expand his business, especially after getting support in the form of a loan and financial education from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy stock of local brew

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, peppers, and Vita.

loans.name: Iltifat

texts.en:
Iltifat is 56-year-old pensioner. He is married and has a son and two daughters. Iltifat earns money selling carpets and earns a monthly income of 200 AZN.

Weaving carpets is an ancient skill in Azerbaijan. There is no carpet that looks like another one. All of them are unique. People weave them in different sizes with different amazing pictures and beautiful patterns. 

People buy carpets not only to cover the floor. Almost every family has a carpet that members use as a wall hanging. This hanging means that the family is respected. 

Iltifat's pension and income from carpet selling isn't enough to cover his family's expenses. He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy new goods for his shop like pillows, coverlets, and blankets. He wants to widen his shop's assortment of items and increase his income. 

This is his fourth loan, and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to widen his shop's assortment of pillows, coverlets, and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase oil, bouillon cubes, rice, coal, and soap

loans.name: Eriab

texts.en:
Eriab is a third-time borrower with UGAFODE Micro-finance Ltd, applying for a tuition fees loan of Ugx 1,200,000. He is a single father of two children that he has always taken care of using income from a water tank at his home. He sells water to all the people in his neighborhood and it is this that has enabled him to meet his loan installments, pay house rent and also take care of his sons.

Eriab has always worked hard to educate his children up to university level where they are now. His major challenge is meeting the tuition fees for his two sons at university on time, yet he is aging.  
Because of this, he has always applied for tuition loans every semester to meet his sons’ university tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his sons

loans.name: Jhahangir

texts.en:
Jhahangir is 43 years old and married with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper. 

He works as a builder and places bricks and mixes cement at a construction site. He has worked in this field for 23 years and has gained good experience. His monthly income is 250 AZN.

Working as builder at a construction site is very hard, consuming work and needs a lot of strength. Local people know that Jhahangir is a very responsible man and does his work properly. They hire him when they need to build or repair a house or other kinds of low-rise buildings.
 
Jhahangir's income isn't enough to cover his family's expenses. His tools are old, and he can't do his work as efficiently as before. 

He applied for a 2,000 AZN loan in order to buy new construction tools for his job. He knows that if he does his job well, he will be paid more than before and will be able to increase  his income.

loans.use: to buy new construction tools

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE COPACABANA, el banco está ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Estela  tiene 46 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es casada, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a enseñar  a niños de jardín,, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para apoyar a sus hijas en su negocio de venta de refrigerios como aceite, pan, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the Communal Bank "Virgen de Copacabana", which is located in Cusco Province in the Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, married, and has four chidlren. Estela divides her time between her daily activities and her job as a kindergarten teacher. She enjoys her job and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Estela wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can support her daughters' snack business by buying oil, bread, rice, and other supplies. Estela appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy oil, bread, rice, and other supplies for her daughters' snack business.

loans.name: Sasubasuli Shg Group

texts.en:
From a small village in Jajepur district, Odisha, India, nine women stepped out and formed a self-help group named "Sasubasuli SHG" to earn some money from different activities to support their families. All the group members are engaged in different business activities like paddy cultivation, vegetable cultivation, etc.

Laxmipriya, age 33, is a married lady with one daughter. The lady standing with her hand raised is Laxmipriya. To earn her living, she has been planting rice and farming for 12 years. Her farming earns an income of 3,500 INR per month.

Now, she is the group leader of this group. They are seeking their first loan with People's Forum (Kiva’s partner) for 135,000 INR. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her rice will provide a good yield for her to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Suniti

texts.en:
Suniti is 44 years old and studied up to class X (grade 10). Her husband has completed class IX (grade 9). They have three children who are studying in different classes.
 
Her husband has been engaged in a small business for many years and she, being a housewife, looks after her family. She is caring very much for her children as well as for their education. One of her children, Pinki, is a student in class X (grade 10) and she is Suniti’s only daughter. For this reason, Suniti is very much concerned about her daughter’s education, which is why she always pays attention to whether Pinki is facing any problems in school or not getting proper tuition for her secondary class. Suniti knows if her daughter cannot pass the school’s examination, she will be not eligible for the Madhyamik examination (grade 10 examinations). Then there would be a year's loss and Suniti would have to spend money to continue her daughter’s studies again. Due to these problems, she needs financial help and, as soon as she heard about BJS’ funding, she applied for a loan to pay her daughter’s school fees, tuition fees etc. and to give financial support to her education. Both she and her husband dream about their children's further education and about leading a happy life with their children.

Suniti and her daughter Pinki (in the photo) are thankful to Kiva and BJS equally for this financial support.

loans.use: To pay school and tuition fees for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Sabeya

texts.en:
Sabeya is a woman of 47 years from the remote village, Altagram, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Yadul, aged 50 years. Both are illiterate and can only sign their names. Together they are raising one daughter who is a student in grade 9. They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).

Sabeya's husband has been associated with agricultural activities for many years.  His earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational activities of their daughter.  They are facing a financial crisis and are not able to pay her school fees and other expenses.

Sabeya is illiterate, but she wants to provide her daughter higher education. Her daughter, Lakhi Parveen, aims to be a teacher in the future. She is in grade 9 and very much serious about her studies. She will appear for the Madhyamik Examination (State Board Examination) after two years, but she needs the guidance of private tutors to reach to her goal.

Sabeya has applied for a loan from BJS for her daughter's uninterrupted education. The loan will help her to purchase necessary educational articles and to pay school fees and private tuition fees for her daughter.

Sabeya and her daughter (in the photo) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan and give them their hearty thanks.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and school fees, and to purchase necessary articles for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a married woman who is 23 years old. She is from the small town of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She attended school up to grade 4.   Her family consists of her husband Nur and three children (one daughter and two sons). Rashida's husband is 31 years old, illiterate, and can only sign his name.  Two of their children are getting an education and read in grade 5 and grade 1, respectively. The third one is below the school-going age.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made).

Rashida's husband is a cycle-van puller by profession.  He carries loads and people on his van. This is the main source of income for the family.  Rashida is a housewife.  She does her household work and looks after her children and husband. But the income of her husband is too low to run the family smoothly. They need to purchase one more cycle-van to rent to customers. In addition, their old van needs some repairing. But due to a lack of money, they are unable to do so.

So Rashida has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a cycle-van and make a good profit from it. They hope this will help them to fulfill their dreams such as giving their children a higher education and purchasing an auto-rickshaw with the profit.

She is very much thankful to BJS as well as to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for business purposes.

loans.name: El Guano 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of the El Guano 2, 3 & 4 group, in honor of their community name. This group is comprised of 15 micro-entrepreneurs located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris. Here, she makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Margarita is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza International Dominican Republic. This is after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. This businesswoman runs a fried food stall where she sells fried chicken, beef, pork, fried dough, and plantains. This is a popular business in the Dominican Republic, especially for breakfast and dinner. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing meat, flour, cooking oil, butter, and other goods.

Margarita said that her most difficult challenge has been raising and educating her children. She is helping her long term partner to provide as much as they can to their family. She will use the profits to reinvest and to save for any needs in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, cooking oil, and butter.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is 49 years old.  She is married to Subodh. They have two sons.  Pramila is a homemaker and is illiterate. She can only sign her name.  Her husband is also uneducated.  None of their sons is a student. They are associated with a small business.  They have a small kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Pramila's husband is a farmer and earns a living by farming green vegetables like chili, cabbages and different vegetables in different seasons on their plot of land.  She and her husband work hard and always grow high quality products that they sell in the local market to make their livelihood.  She needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. She thought of cultivating beans on their land, which is a vegetable that is in demand in West Bengal and used in many Indian dishes.

Pramila heard that BJS gives loans to rural women for their businesses.  She has taken a loan from them to purchase high quality bean seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation.

Her dream is to improve the family's finances and to secure her children's career with the profit generated from this business.

She also aspires to purchase a tractor to use on their farmland.

She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bancha Rani

texts.en:
Bancha Rani is a married woman. She is 54 years old and a housewife who is illiterate.  The poor economic condition of her parents did not allow her to have an elementary education. She is married to Boloram, 61, who is a priest. He is also illiterate. Their only son is engaged in a small business. They are from the small village of Palpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri and live in their own house.

Bancha Rani's husband works as a priest at a local temple.  He earns very little. In order to make money to support the family, Bancha Rani raises livestock. She started one year ago, with the purchase of one cow. The monthly income from the sale of milk is very little.  Her son also helps her financially.  But despite all these efforts, they are unable to give financial sustenance to their family. Now, they want to grow their business, but they lack of capital.

Bancha Rani has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase a cow.  She wants to start a milk products business (milk, butter, paneer, curd etc.).  She will sell the products in the local market in order to generate more profit. She plans to invest the loan profits in her business and she intends to purchase a car for their own use.

Her full thanks go to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to supply milk and dairy products

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is a married woman of only 25 years. She is from the remote village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife and is uneducated, and can only sign her name. Her husband, Narayan, aged 33 years, is engaged in agriculture. He is also illiterate. They have two sons who are receiving education and read in grade 7 and grade 6. They live in their own house.

Anjana's husband's agribusiness is the only source of income for the family. It is hardly possible for him to maintain the educational costs of her sons with his small income, after managing all the household expenses. 

Her younger son, Tapan, is in grade 6. He is a very meritorious student. He aims to be a doctor in the future. He is very studious and attentive to his lessons. He has been scoring good marks in the examination without the help of any private tutor. But now, he needs the help of a private tutor. Moreover, Anjana cannot afford the expenses of the education equipment and tuition fees any more.

Anjana, therefore, has asked for a loan from BJS to support her son's education, so that their son does not face any difficulty in receiving education. This loan will help her to pay her son's private tuition fees and school fees, and to purchase education equipment like pens, pencils, books, geometry box, school uniform, etc.

Anjana and her son (in the photo) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for this education loan.

loans.use: to pay private tuition fees and to purchase education equipment for her son’s education.

loans.name: Los Girasoles  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Los Girasoles está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida por su belleza natural y por su arquitectura que es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su fuente de ingresos es la crianza de animales, la agricultura y el comercio. Su gente es amable, gentil y su orgullo es mantener la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, este grupo se ha conformado porque todas tienen una meta en común la cual es mejorar su situación económica y entregarles un mejor futuro para sus hijos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Maclovia, se encuentra realizando su crédito a lado de sus amigas y vecinas del grupo de crédito Las Girasoles, ella al igual que todas las integrantes se han organizado y es el primer crédito que realizan, están con la motivación de crecer en su sus negocios y brindar a sus familias un mejor porvenir.
La Señora Maclovia  tiene 49 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Maclovia es profesional de la costura desde hace 15 años, tiene un local propio donde tiene su taller, ella se dedica a la elaboración y arreglos de todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Su crédito es para iniciar con otra fuente de ingresos, va a comprar pollos y cuyes para la cría. Su meta es aprender computación.
texts.en:
The "Los Girasoles" loan group is made up of seven women who live in the Valle parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for its natural beauty, and for its mixture of old and modern architecture. The people here make a living raising animals, in farming, and running businesses. The people are friendly and kind, and they are proud of keeping up the town's cultures and traditions. This group came together because all the members have a common goal: to improve their financial situation and to give their children a better future.

One member of this group is Maclovia. She is applying for a loan alongside her friends and neighbours in the "Los Girasoles" loan group. Like the other members of the group, Maclovia is organised and this is their first loan. They are motivated to grow with their business and to give their families a better future.

Maclovia is 49 years old and a widow. She has three children - now all adults -, two of whom are married and live independently. Maclovia's single daughter work to cover her own expenses. Maclovia owns the house where she lives.

Maclovia has been a professional dressmaker for 15 years. She has her own premises with a workshop, where she makes a fixes all sorts of clothing items. This loan will be used to generate another source of income: she will buy chickens and guinea pigs to raise. Maclovia's goal is to learn IT skills.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.es: ILUMINADA  tiene la edad de 70 años, es viuda. Ella  quiere  asistir su cafetal va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para lograr mayor cosecha quiere crecer y también desea que su finca sea muy productiva.  Es el segundo préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ha realizado otros préstamos en una Cooperativa, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella   tiene el deseo de tener mejor calidad de vida al aumentar sus ganacias.
texts.en: Iluminada is 70 years old and a widow.  She wants to buy supplies and fertilizer for her coffee crops to have a better harvest and to grow her farm and make it more productive.  This will be her second loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has gotten other loans through a cooperative, but FUDECOSUR provided her a loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.  She wants to have a better quality of life and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Lerida Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Lerida una señora de 42 años, se encuentra en unión libre muchos años con su esposo, de quienes fruto de este amor tienen 6 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya mayores de edad y dos viven en casa, ellos están estudiando en una escuela fiscal cerca a su domicilio.
Su esposo por ahora está trabajando en una finca como jornalero, él no cuenta con un trabajo fijo, a veces también trabaja como albañil; es por ello que Lerida quiere ayudarle para sacar a delante a  su familia, ella es una señora muy trabajadora, en las tardes ella se pone su coche afueras de una tienda cerca de su casa y vende salchipapas y hamburguesas,  y por las mañanas elabora pan y sale a recorrer en su barrio. Esto le ha permito poder llevar un ingreso a su hogar y darle la educación y alimentación a sus hijos, también poco a poco han podido construir su humilde casa.
Lerida ya lleva trabajando con Fundación Alternativa ya tres créditos y se siente muy agradecida ya que con esto ha podido mejorar su negocio. Está muy feliz porque con este dinero podrá comprar papas, aceite, salchichas, harina, mantequilla y todo lo necesario para realizar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lerida lives in Santo Domingo.  She is 42 years old, single, and has been in a common law marriage for many years.  She and her husband have six children, four of them adults and two who live at home and attend the local school.

Her husband is working as a laborer on a farm but doesn’t have steady work.  Sometimes he also works as a mason.  Lerida wants to help get the family ahead, and is a hardworking woman and sets up her cart in front of a store near her home and sells salchipapas and hamburgers.  In the mornings she makes bread to sell in the neighborhood.  This has provided her an income to bring home and provide food and an education to her children.  They have also been able to build their humble home little by little.

Lerida has been working with Fundación Alternativa and has had three loans in the past.  She is very grateful that she has been able to improve her business.  She is very happy because the money will allow her to buy potatoes, cooking oil, sausages, flour, butter, and everything she needs to make her products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gunobala

texts.en:
Gunobala is a 46-year-old housewife from the small village of Raipara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Naren, who is 51 years old and has a primary education, whereas Gunobala is illiterate and can sign her name only. They have two sons who do some odd jobs. They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).

Gunobala 's husband has a business of selling firewood. He collects firewood from his village and neighbouring villages. He sells it to their neighbours. In rural areas, firewood is used as fuel, so this is a lucrative business. This business is the main source to create income for maintaining the family’s expenses. 

Now that the prices of essential commodities are growing rapidly, it is hardly possible for him to maintain all the costs of the four-member family. So, they are thinking to expand the existing business by purchasing more firewood.

Gunobala requires a loan. She heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase more wood for resale. She hopes that the extra resulting income will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for their support.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for expanding their existing business.

loans.name: Bacwa

texts.en: Bacwa is a Ugandan man, aged 38, living in Kagadi. He is married with 4 children, 3 of whom attend school. He sells produce to earn a daily income and also earns from a retail shop serving the rural people. His dream is to grow his business to the level of serving the people in the capital city, and to look after his children like any loving father. Bacwa intends to use the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Navruzsho

texts.ru:
Наврузшо 39 лет. Он фермер из села района Джиликуль. Наврузшо на своем земельном участке занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Его жена портниха и она у себя дома принимает заказы на пошив женских платьев.
Наврузшо решил одновременно заняться куплей и продажей овец и баранов. По его словам это прибыльный бизнес со стабильным доходом. Начальный капитал Наврузшо составляет 160 долларов США. Он имеет сарай для содержания скота и корм для скота. Кредит ему нужен для приобретения четырех голов овец и баранов. Он ожидает финансовой поддержки.
texts.en: Navruzsho is 39 years old.  He is a farmer from a village in the Jilikul district.  Navruzsho is involved in growing agricultural crops in his land plot.  His wife is a seamstress and accepts orders to sew women's dresses at home.  Navruzsho decided to concurrently get involved in reselling sheep.  According to him, this is a profitable business with a stable income.  Navruzsho's initial capital amounts to 160 US dollars.  He has a barn for keeping livestock and livestock feed.  He needs this loan to buy four ewes and rams.  He is awaiting financial support.

loans.use: to buy four ewes and rams

loans.name: La Buena Vecina 1 Group

texts.en:
Andrea is one of the members of the group La Buena Vecina, made up of five micro-business owners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. This is Andrea's ninth loan from Esperanza International, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step towards business growth. She has had her beauty salon business for around five years. She started the business with her own resources.

Andrea is planning to invest her new loan towards purchasing hair and beauty products, a hair dryer and other beauty salon supplies. She is going to use her earnings to continue saving and increasing her inventory. She is dreaming of having a large beauty salon with all services and an improved business in order to provide her children a better and safer life. 

Andrea is a single mother with two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children alone. She loves to watch television and to be with her children.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products, a hair dryer, etc.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 42 года. Он живет в одном из гостеприимных и доброжелательных районов Республики Таджикистан на районе Фархор. Сафарали имеет среднее специальное образование, но он предпочел выбрать другую профессию. Он любит животных, ему нравится проводить время с животными. Он работал у брата, помогал ему в его бизнесе животноводства, но сейчас решил начать самостоятельно разводить скотов. Ему будет помогать его супруга и сын. Но для начала данного бизнеса ему не хватает денег, поэтому он обратился за кредитом с надеждой на помощь.
texts.en: Safarali is 42 years old.  He lives in one of the most welcoming and kind districts of the Tajilistan Republic, in the Farkhor district.  Safarali has a secondary education, but decided to choose another profession.  He loves animals and spending time with them.  He worked with his brother and helped him with his animal husbandry business, but now decided to breed livestock independently.  His wife and son will help him.  He does not have enough money to start this business and this is why he requested this loan, hoping to get help.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to start his animal husbandry business

loans.name: Oyishamo

texts.ru: Ойишамо живет в городке Куляб. У нее большая семья. Чтобы прокормить ее Ойишамо старается всеми силами. Уже несколько лет она занимается продажей канцелярских товаров. В торговле и перевозки товаров ей помогают ее братья. Сейчас доходность от продажи падает. Потому, что необходимо все время обновлять различность товаров. Чтобы привести товар и увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара, необходимы средства, которых у Ойишамо не хватает. Она решилась обратиться за кредитом, чтобы спасти свою деятельность и восстановить источник дохода.
texts.en: Oyishamo lives in the city of Kulob.  She has a large family.  Oyishamo tries very hard to support her family.  She has been involved in selling office supplies for several years.  Her brothers help her with the sales and merchandise transportation.  The profits from the sales are now dropping.  This is why she always has to update the merchandise selection.  Oyishamo needs money to bring merchandise and expand the goods selection, but she does not have enough.  She decided to request this loan to save her business and reinstate her source of income.

loans.use: to buy office supplies for resale in order to save her business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is 30 years old. He is married with two children. He has been selling salt, biscuits and juice for the past ten years. With this loan, he wants to buy more items for resale such as bread, cooking oil and soda. He plans to use the profits from the business to reinvest in it, and to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more bread, cooking oil and soda for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en: Marthe is a widow who owns a restaurant; she has been selling cooked food for the past 12 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more rice, corn flour and beans for use in the restaurant. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, corn flour and beans for use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Zaña, cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, que ha permitido el riego de cultivos, su población de se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su hija se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, gallinas y patos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Eulalia ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 63 years old and lives with her daughter in Zaña district near the valley of the Jequetepeque River. The location allows for crop irrigation. Her town works in the business of agriculture, trade and ranching. The town is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Along with her daughter, she works in raising and selling small animals such as pigs, hens and ducks. Her business is located on the backside of her home. 

Eulalia has applied for a loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles with Edpyme Alternativa to buy animal feed. This way she will be able to offer better prices to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Rabeya

texts.en:
Rabeya is a rural housewife from the remote village of Kholaigram in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 30 and uneducated.  Her family consists of her husband and two school-going children (one son and one daughter). They are in grade 9 and grade 8, respectively.  Her husband Azijul, 38, is engaged in an agribusiness. They live in their own house.

Rabeya's husband's income, however, is not enough to cover the everyday needs of the family. He works hard on his farmland, grows different vegetables like beans, chili, cabbages, cauliflower etc, and sells the agricultural produce in the local market. Yet, he can hardly meet the family's expenses.

In order to earn more profit from this agribusiness, they want to start potato cultivation on their farmland.  Rabeya heard about BJS and has taken a loan to help her husband to buy potato seeds and good quality fertilizers.

They hope this new business will provide them earn an additional profit, which will help them to meet the household expenses of their family and at the same time, help them to provide a better education to their children.

They aspire to purchase a tractor in the future with their profits.

They sincerely appreciate the support of their lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them the loan.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and good quality fertilizers

loans.name: Javlon

texts.ru:
Чавлон замужняя женщина в возрасте 41 года. Ее муж и старший сын находятся за пределами страны и занимаются там столярным делом. Младший сын и дочь живут вместе с Чавлон в районе Пяндж и учатся в школе. 
Чавлон энергичная и деятельная женщина. Она знает профессию портнихи и только начинает свой швейный бизнес. Чавлон умеет кроить и шить национальные женские платья. До этого дня она шила только для себя, но теперь хочет открыть свое дело и зарабатывать таким путем. Чавлон будет принимать заказы у себя дома, но ее машинка устарела. Она просит кредит для покупки новой модернизированной швейной машинки, чтобы предоставлять свои услуги.
texts.en: Javlon is a married, 41 year-old woman.  Her husband and oldest son are abroad and involved in carpentry there.  Her youngest son and daughter live with Javlon in the Pyandj district and attend a school.  Javlon is an energetic and active woman.  She knows the seamstress profession and is just starting her sewing business.  Javlon can cut and sew national women's dresses.  Previously, she sewed for herself, but now wants to open her own business and earn a living.  Javlon will accept orders at home, but her sewing machine has gotten old.  She is requesting this loan to buy a new, modern sewing machine in order to provide her service.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine in order to start her own sewing business

loans.name: Qurbonali

texts.ru:
Этого мужчину на фотографии зовут Курбонали. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Курбонали как ответственный мужчина считает, что он должен обеспечить свою семью жильем, едой, образованием и здоровьем.
  Курбонали начитает новый бизнес, чтобы обосновать источник дохода и найти определенное место работы. Он хочет заняться животноводством. Курбонали хочет на деньги от кредита купить телят и разводить их в коровнике рядом с домом. Он может зарабатывать и быть рядом с женой и ребенком, к чему он очень рад. Курбонали просит кредит для купли телят и для начала нового бизнеса.
texts.en: The name of the man on this photograph is Qurbonali.  He is 28 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Qurbonali, as a responsible man, thinks that he has to provide his family with housing, food, education and health.  Qurbonali is starting a new business in order to establish a source of income and find a set place of work.  He wants to get involved in animal husbandry.  Qurbonali wants to use the money from the loan to buy calves and raise them in a cowshed near his home.  He will be able to earn a living and be close to his wife and child, and he is very happy with this.  Qurbonali is requesting this loan to buy calves and start a new business.

loans.use: to buy calves and start a new business

loans.name: Daliya

texts.en:
Daliya is a 26-year-old woman who is married and, together with her husband, is raising only one daughter.  Dalia attended school up to grade 7. Due to her parents' poor economic conditions, she could not study any further. Her husband Mridul is engaged in selling fertilizers.  He is 30 years old and educated up to grade 9.  Their daughter is still a child. They live in Sotsongopara in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (a house made of bamboo, straw and mud).

Daliya's husband is very much dedicated and committed to enhance his business and to make a handsome amount of profit from it. So, he works hard on his farmland from dawn to dusk, but is unable to earn sufficient profit to run the family well.

Daliya and her husband have decided to start a milk supply business.  So, Dalia has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow.  She will start a milk supply business in her area, selling from door to door. From this activity, she will be able to contribute a small share to her family's household expenditures.

She also desires to admit her child into a good school. In the future, she wants to purchase more cows and have a cowherd and a cowshed at her house with the income generated from her business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Marjorie Marisol

texts.es:
La Señora Marjorie vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que está rodeada de montañas por su geografía accidentada, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Marjorie tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 19, 16, 14, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente, dos están en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora en una mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Marjorie se dedica desde hace algún tiempo a la preparación y venta de comida para ayudar a solventar los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia, este trabajo le da la oportunidad de ser su propio jefe, estar con su familia y más que todo le gusta el arte culinario. El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar  víveres y utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad y compañerismo de sus integrantes.
texts.en:
Marjorie lives in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is a city surrounded by mountains and rugged terrain. It has many places to enjoy nature, and was classified as a World Heritage Site in December 1999. Her people still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Marjorie is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage and has five children, ages 19, 16, 14, 12, and 8. Her oldest son works and helps her financially. Two attend high school and the youngest two attend a small local school. Her husband works as a mechanic and they all live in a rented house. Marjorie has worked for some time in the preparation and sale of food in order to help cover their living expenses, and to continue moving the family forward. This work gives her the opportunity to be her own boss, be with her family, and do what she enjoys most - culinary arts. 

She invested the money from her previous loan in the purchase of food. With her new loan, she will buy food and kitchen utensils. 

Her credit union likes the solidarity and camaraderie of the members.
