loans.use: to buy food and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, iron and overlock machine

loans.name: Shushila

texts.en:
Shushila is a 49-year-old woman who is married and illiterate. She only knows how to sign her name. Her husband Shyamal is a 57-year-old man who is involved in cultivation.  Together they are raising two daughters who are students.  One is in grade 9 and the other is in college. They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made house) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Shushila is a housewife.  Her husband is extensively engaged in agriculture.  He grows different kinds of vegetables on his own farmland like cabbage, tomatoes, cucumber, beans etc. and sells them in the local market.  The income from this business is spent on household expenses as well as for the educational expenses of their children. In order to continue his agricultural business in a sustainable way and to earn more profit, they have decided to cultivate potatoes on their land. Shushila has taken a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start their business. She is hopeful that this new business will provide more profit to overcome their financial hurdles and to give them a better lifestyle.

Shushila wishes to upgrade their house to a pacca house (concrete made) and she is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds to start potato cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the shop roof, buy a mannequin and make a glass façade for his shop

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
The self-help group "Maa Tarini Shg" is made up of 11 women who fight each day to improve their families' financial stability. They are friendly, kind people who still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages. These women live in a small village in Odisha, India. 
 
One of the members of this group is acting as the KIVA representative. She is Mitarani, the lady in the picture standing with a raised hand. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. One goes to school and the younger one is at home. Mitarani's husband works as a day laborer. The house they live in is their own.
 
This member learned to work in the fields from her parents at a young age. It is now her way of life. Agriculture provides her income. In addition to planting vegetables, Mitarani has a greenhouse for tomatoes. At the moment, it is working out well. She also earns a living raising animals like goats and milk cows . Her work gives her the opportunity to be at home to take care of her family.
 
Mitarani is taking this loan because she wants to keep investing in her business. The profit she earns is a great help in meeting her family's expenses. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for her greenhouse. Mitarani's goal is to help her children have decent careers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
This is Presentacion, 63, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Presentacion operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers dresses and gowns. Clothing like uniforms and such, usually in seasonal demand, is available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.
 
Presentacion hopes that her business will last longer and dreams of having a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 58, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, an employee, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosita has an apartment that she rents. It is rented on a monthly basis. She also sells different vegetables. She earns a minimum of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan for the repair and maintenance of the room she rents. 

Rosita dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a mini grocery store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her apartment.

loans.name: Idalides

texts.es:
Ella es idalides,  quiere estudiar para tener una mejor oportunidad laboral mente y un mejor crecimiento como persona y así tener un mejor desempeño ante cualquier entidad, Para así cumplir con todas las metas y sueños trazados.
Ella quiere obtener este titulo para sentirse mejor por que así puede ayudar a muchas personas y es una meta que quiere cumplir hace mucho tiempo, por motivos económicos no ha podido realizar ya que lo había intentado desde que termino el bachiller como no pudo por ese lado estudio auxiliar de droguería.
Con los estudios que pueda obtener quiere darle un mejor futuro a la hija que es el motor principal en la vida con el amor de toda la familia y con el apoyo de todos ella esta segura de salir adelante por que cuenta con mucho amor.
Ella necesita ese grano de arena por que con la ayuda que le ofrecen ella puede realizar los estudios ya que en otras ocasiones no ha podido, por que no cuenta con el dinero para pagar las mensualidades y que ahora cuenta con esta oportunidad tan grande como lo es kiva que no puede dejarla pasar.
texts.en:
She wants to achieve this degree to feel better about herself because with it she will be able to help many people. This is a goal that she has wanted to accomplish for a long time but due to economic reasons she has not been able to achieve it yet. She has tried to reach her goal since she finished high school and for this reason she studied to be a drugstore assistant.

With the studies that she can obtain she wants to give a better future to her daughter who is the driving force in her life. With the love of all the family and the help of all, her daughter is assured to get ahead because she is much loved.

She needs this assistance because with the help that it offers she can finish her studies while in other occasions she could not because she did not have the money to pay the monthly payments. Now with this great opportunity from Kiva she cannot let it pass her by.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, iron, table, and fabric and to renovate their workplace.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEGNA est constitué de  5 femmes (dont 4 mariées et 1 célibataire) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  tubercules à l’image de BAKORO qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1000 kg de pommes de terre avec les grossistes  de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Badegna Group is made of 5 women (of whom four are married and one is single) who, on average, are 29 years old and have three children. They live in large traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship and business ties. To reinforce their financial capacity in order to better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their fifth loan. The four previous loans were all properly paid back. This group of women sells tubers, like Bakoro who is the first woman standing in the photo from the right to the left. With her loan, she expects to buy 1000 kilograms of potatoes with the wholesalers in Sikasso. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA which will be invested in the businesses and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase tubers

loans.name: Lina Alexandra

texts.es:
Ella se llama lina, piensa que  estudiar para las personas es muy gratificante y que abre las puertas en muchos aspectos ,para tener  un cambio de vida tanto para uno como para la descendencia  por esta razón deben  tomar la decisión y tener claro el perfil que es para tener claridad en que carrera se puede inclinar.
En lo personal  piensa que el técnico auxiliar contable es una carrera la cual permite practicarla en varios campos,  aparte que la pueden aplicar en la  vida cotidiana.
Para poder realizar los sueños ella sabe que hay que tener dedicación y dinero,  pero que  gracias a la ayuda y convenio con kiva  que la institución le ofrece es mas fácil para poderlo terminar.
texts.en:
Her name is Lina.  She thinks that studying is very gratifying for people and that it opens doors in many ways.  It does so for a change of life as much as for their offspring.  For this reason, they should make the decision.  They should have a clear profile in order to have clarity at to what career they are inclined to have.

Personally, she thinks that being an assistant accounting technician is a career that will allow her to practice it in various fields, aside from the fact that you are able to apply it to daily life.

In order to fulfill her dreams, she knows that you have to have dedication and money.  However, thanks to the help and agreement with Kiva that the institution is offering her, it is much easier to be able to complete her studies.

loans.use: to pay to enroll for a semester.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BADEGNA est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de LALA qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The Badegna group is made up of 4 women, all of whom are married, and who on average are 24 years old and have two children. They live in large traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better run their business, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are on their third loan. The previous two loans were paid back properly. This group of women sells vegetables and spices to make sauces, like Lala, who is the first woman standing in the photo from the left to the right. With her loan, she expects to buy various kinds of vegetables and spices for sauces with the wholesalers in Bougouni. She makes her sales at the market and from her home, at retail, for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested in the businesses and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to make sauces

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Libertad en Progreso está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia Victoria del Portete en Cuenca, este lugar goza de una belleza natural y grandes praderas propicias para la crianza de ganado, su clima es frió, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas amables y gentiles que luchan todos los días para mejorar su estabilidad económica y su meta es brindarles más oportunidades a sus hijos, su fuete de ingresos son la crianza de animales, la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Lorena, es socia del grupo de crédito Libertad en Progreso desde hace 6 años, en todo este tiempo ha alimentado la amistad y compañerismo con todas las mujeres del grupo al mismo tiempo que ha crecido poco a poco en su negocio.
La Señora Lorena tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión matrimonial ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 8, 4 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y dos  estudian en una escuela del sector, su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Lorena pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes, pollos y ganado del cual vende la leche. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The "Libertad en Progreso" loan group has ten members - all women - who live in the Victoria del Portete parish of Cuenca. This is an area that enjoys much natural beauty, and many large, lush meadows to raise cattle. The climate is cold; the architecture is a mixture of the old and new. The people here, like the members of "Libertad en Progreso", are kind and friendly. They fight every day to improve their financial stability and their goal is to give their children more opportunities. The people her in Victoria del Portete makes a living raising animals, in farming, or working in the city. They also continue to keep the culture and traditions of their towns.

One member of this group is Lorena - she has been a member for six years and, during this time, she has nourished friendships and bonds with all the women in the group. At the same she has grown, little by little, along with her business.

Lorena is 33 years old. She is married and has four children with her husband. They are aged fourteen, eight, four and three years old each. The oldest is in high school, the next two attend a local primary school. Lorena's husband is a building. The family owns the house where they live.

Lorena spends most of her time at home taking care of the household chores. In order to support the family financially, she works raising and selling guinea pigs, chickens and cattle, whose milk she sells. This loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs and building materials, in order to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and building materials.

loans.name: Leidy Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella es leidy tatiana, nació el 18 de abril, ella no vive con el padre, pero vive con el   padrastro que es como si lo fuera, tiene un hermano menor llamado Cristian Camilo, el cual tiene 9 años y entra a cursar cuarto grado de primaria,  Tatiana termino el estudio en el colegio Distrital Delia Zapata Olivella 

Ella cuando estaba cursando décimo año trabajo con la señora Clara  mientras la  hija estaba de viaje ayudando  con el computador ya que ella no lo manejaba muy bien y tenía inicios deuna enfermedad. 

A ella le emociono el día del nacimiento del hermano Cristian, pues ella desde hace mucho tiempo quería un  hermano.
 
Entro a campo alto a estudiar por que le  comentaron que es una institución buena, la cual se esta volviendo muy reconocida en el sector salud, y escogió, administrativo en salud ya que le gusta la salud pero en el sector administrativo. 
Ella necesita el convenio ya que los semestres pasados  por ser recién salida del colegio estaba pagando una mensualidad mas económica, el cual era un apoyo en el estudio   durante todo el semestre .
Ahora que ella entra  a tercer semestre del técnico auxiliar y se acabo el convenio y tiene que empezar a pagar la cuota mensual,  la cual es una suma bastante alta a lo que estaba pagando  y la madre en estos momentos no tiene un trabajo fijo.
texts.en:
This is Leidy Tatiana whose birthday is April 18th. She does not live with her father. She lives with her stepfather, but it is as though he were her father. She has a younger brother called Cristian Camilo, who is nine years old and who is in the fourth grade of primary school. She was very excited the day her brother Cristian was born as she had wanted a brother for a long time.

Tatiana finished her studies at the Delia Zapata Olivella district school. When she was in the tenth grade she worked with Señora Clara while her daughter was away, helping with the computer as she could not maneuver easily in the early stage of an illness.

She came to CampoAlto in order to pursue her studies because, as they say, it is a good institution, which is becoming well known in the health sector, and she chose health administration as she enjoys the administration sector.

She needs a loan since in the past semesters, having just finished school, she was paying a lower monthly payment, which was a help for her studies throughout the whole semester. Now that she is entering her third semester  of technical assistant studies and the agreement is over, she has to begin paying the monthly fee, which is a fairly high amount compared to what she was paying, and her mother does not have a steady job at the moment.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is engaged in the farming business. She has been cultivating her rice field for over six years. According to her, having this kind of business requires laborious work and patience. Virginia keeps believing that someday, she will be able to lift her living condition out of poverty through her farming business. 

Currently, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to be used in buying fertilizers and insecticides. She knows that supplying her crops with complete farm inputs will enable her to gain better yields and income. She hopes to use the said amount of loan to make her dreams possible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, suits, blouses, tops, etc. - also to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie, 38 years old, is married and lives in Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor. She earns a living through fishing.

Amie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. She is now applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 to fund boat machine repairs. Amie deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To fund boat machine repairs.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: Ella es adriana, nació el 10 de septiembre  en Bogotá,  desde el momento de nacida hasta los 7 años de edad vivió con la madre en la casa de los papas, entro a estudiar desde los 2 años en las alejandritas hasta que termino de cursar transición  a los 6 años la madre formo un hogar con otro hombre yéndose a vivir a Ibagué Tolima y teniendo dos hijos más,  a los 7 años de edad los abuelos se dieron cuenta que no era el mejor ambiente para ella y se hicieron cargo llevándola a vivir a Tibana Boyacá y estudiar en el colegio de pueblo, en segundo y tercer grado participo en olimpiadas matemáticas ocupando los primeros lugares a nivel departamental, estudio hasta cuarto grado, a los 10 años, de edad volvieron a Bogotá ya que les toco dejar la finca por motivos de salud  y entro a cursar quinto de primaria al san Vicente Ferrer institución privada al terminar quinto ingreso al colegio distrital Juan lozano a terminar los estudios medios, hoy en día cursa undécimo grado y  entro a estudiar ingles por las tardes para mejorar los niveles académicos, aparte de eso desea salir no solo con un bachillerato si no con un técnico, por esa razón quiere ingresar a campo alto y estudiar mecánica  automotriz por que le gustan los carros, son la pasión quiere aprender como son por fuera cómo y por dentro en qué forma han progresado día a día avanzado con el paso del tiempo e imaginar lo que en un futuro lograran avanzar,  esta carrera espera ella que le ayude a lograr los sueños que son entrar a la universidad nacional a estudiar ingeniería mecánica y poder entrar a una marca de autos no como mecánica si no algo mas importante ir subiendo escalones poco a poco hasta llegar a el objetivo,  por esta razón es que está buscando la ayuda de kiva para pagar los estudios superiores .
texts.en:
This is Adriana.  She was born on 10 September in Bogotá.  From birth until the age of 7 she lived with her mother in her parents' house.  She started going to school when she was 2, and attended Las Alejandritas Preschool until she was ready for elementary school.  When Adriana was 6 her mother started a home with another man in Ibagué Tolima and had two more children.

When Adriana was 7, her grandparents realized it wasn't the best environment for her and assumed the responsibility of taking her to Tibana Boyacá to live and go to school in the town.  In second and third grades she participated in the math olympics and took first place in the department.  Adriana studied up to fourth grade there, until she was 10, when they returned to Bogotá from the farm for health reasons.  She started the fifth year of elementary school in San Vicente Ferrer, a private school, and finished her intermediate studies in the district school, Juan Lozano.

Currently Adriana's in 11th grade and has started studying English in the afternoon so she can improve her academic status.  She also wants to get a technical degree in addition to her diploma, so she wants to study automotive mechanics at Campo Alto because cars are her passion.  She wants to learn about them inside and out, how they have progressed through time and how they might be in the future.

Adriana hopes this program will help her realize her dream of getting into the national university to study mechanical engineering.  She wants to work with cars, not as a mechanic but as something more important.

Adriana's going to move up little by little until she reaches her goal.  This is why she needs Kiva's help to pay for her advanced studies.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for a semester

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
El es jhon jairo, se considera una persona con muchas capacidades y con ganas de salir adelante para hacerlo, debe proponerse metas y estudiar en campo alto es una de ellas en el programa que se matriculo  ENSAMBLE Y REPARACIÓN DE HARDWARE , se decidió a estudiar este programa, primero porque le gusta y segundo porque es una excelente fuente de empleo y porque no,  colocar un negocio propio, le gusta porque le llama la atención sistemas y  todo sobre la tecnología y que mejor que empezar con este programa ya que le va ampliar los conocimientos  y además le va abrir muchas puertas para así  mas adelante realizar la carrera profesional que es ingeniería de sistemas,  sabe que es un buen comienzo con el apoyo que ustedes CAMPO ALTO Y KIVA les brinda a muchas personas que tiene dificultades económicas para pagar el semestre, con ayuda de estas dos entidades él sabe que puede lograr lo que se propone. 
Si ustedes le otorgan este subsidio él lo  recibirá con mucha gratitud y dará lo mejor de sí mismo.
texts.en:
This is Jhon Jairo and he is a considered a person with many skills and with big dreams to get ahead.  He studies in an Assembly and Hardware Repair program.  He studies in this program because he likes the field and also because it offers an excellent source of employment. One day he wants to open his own business. 

He enjoys learning about systems and about technology.  Since starting this program he has already learned a lot and when he finishes, many doors will open to him.  He will be able to make a professional career in engineering systems.  

He knows this is a good start with the support that Campo Alto and Kiva provide to the many people with economic difficulties.  With the help of these two organizations, he will be able to pay for a semester of school and will be able to achieve his goals.  He wants the lenders to know that he is very grateful for the help and will work hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Carlos Osmin

texts.es:
Carlos, solicita capital para pagar el arrendamiento de las tierras y compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, insecticida, plaguicidas y semilla, lo que le ayudara a preparar las tierras para la próxima siembra.
El crédito anterior le dio como resultado una producción abundante, granos de calidad y mejores ingresos los que ha utilizado para cancelar sus deudas y sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting capital so that he can pay the rent on his farmland and to buy farming supplies such as compost, insecticides, fungicides, and seeds. These items will help him to prepare the land for the next planting season.

His previous loan helped him to achieve abundant production, quality output, and more income that was used to pay off his debts and help his family move forward.

loans.use: to pay the rent on his farmland and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 60 years of age and a resident of Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor, Philippines. She is a widow with 3 children who are adults. She has a small fishing business from which to earn a living. Marcosa has faced many business challenges, but she realizes that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Marcosa works hard in selling her catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy her fish. Marcosa welcomes the idea of using her savings to expand the business. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional fishing equipment such as fish nets.  She feels assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Marcosa smiles at the thought of seeing her children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment such as fish nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime, condiments, meat, and other items like these.

loans.name: Linda Raquel

texts.es:
Linda, vive en una casa familiar, disfruta la dicha de ser madre de dos hijos de 10 y 11 años de edad, para poder tener los recursos que le ayuden a cubrir las necesidades de su familia se dedica a atender un chalet en una escuela, su mayor dificultad es cuando finaliza la época escolar.
Utilizara el capital para comprar golosinas, embutidos, carnes, pan, bebidas entre otra clase de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, espera aumentar sus ventas y tener un negocio más rentable para cancelar sus deudas y dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia,
Sueña con tener una tienda con productos que cubran la demanda de sus clientes para sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión.
texts.en:
Linda lives with her family. She is the mother of two children that are 10 and 11 years old.  In order to be able to have the resources that cover the family's necessities, she works in a school and her most difficult time of the year is when the school year is over.

She will use this loan to buy candies, sausages, meats, bread, beverages, and other similar merchandise to sell to her customers.  She wants to increase her sales and to have a more profitable business so that she can pay off debt and provide a better lifestyle for her family.

She dreams to have a store with products that meet the demand of her customers and to make the most of the loan.

loans.use: to buy candies, sausages, meats, bread, beverages, and other similar merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maricella

texts.es:
Ella es maricella, quiere contar porque le gusta el programa de salud oral, que fue el que escogió para ingresar a estudiar, ella piensa que a través  de este programa puede llegar a capacitarse mejor para el futuro y para que el futuro de los hijos sea aun mejor que este. 

Tiene una visión de ella misma en dos años y se ve como teniendo la visión de que va a poder  brindar un apoyo en el campo de la odontología como asistente y luego poder seguir estudiando.

Si ella tiene el convenio con kiva. Sería una ayuda oportuna, ya que   puede  ella ingresar sin pagar un valor alto en cada mensualidad ya que la capacidad económica no le alcanza, pero ella  desea es poder estudiar y tener una carrera profesional más adelante.
texts.en:
This is Maricella. She wants to present her story because she enjoys the Dental Health Program, which is the field of study that she chose to pursue. She believes this program will provide her with the best training for the future and for the future of her children.

Maricella sees herself in two years becoming an assistant in the field of dentistry. Later on she would like to continue her studies.

By obtaining a Kiva loan, Maricella will receive assistance at an opportune time. She can enroll without having to pay a high monthly tuition since her financial situation will not allow her. Maricella wants to study and eventually earn a professional degree.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to pay the treatment expenses for his lungs

loans.name: Rema

texts.en: Rema is 45 years old and engaged in buying and selling bottles. According to her, she buys empty bottles on a house to house basis, and cleans them for resale to make a profit. These bottles are usually purchased by vinegar and fish paste manufacturers. Having this kind of business is a great help in covering her household expenses. She is aiming to buy more empty bottles but her capital is not sufficient. So, she is asking for additional capital of 4,000 PHP to buy more bottles in order to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more bottles

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Adi is a 23-year-old single young man from Tulkarm city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. He works as an employee in a store selling shoes, but he earns a very low income. He would like to start his own business selling birds. It is a good business and provides a good income, but he needs some money to get started with this project. 

Adi has taken a loan from FATEN which will help him to buy a collection of birds and cages to start his own business. This loan will help him to be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a collection of birds and cages to start his own business

loans.name: Manuel Israel

texts.es:
Manuel, solicita un  nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, pan, detergentes, bebidas, golosinas y granos básicos, pues hoy cuenta con más clientes y tiene  mayor demanda de los diferentes productos que ofrece.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a contar con el efectivo suficiente para efectuar la compra de productos para su tienda, lo que le ayudo a aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía y cancelar sus deudas. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable y gozando de un  mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is requesting a new loan in order to buy oil, bread, detergents, beverages, snack foods, and basic grains. Today he has more customers and greater demand for the various products he offers.

His previous loan enabled him to pay cash for a sufficient inventory of products for his store. This helped him to increase his sales, improve his financial situation, and repay his debts. His family is healthy and enjoying a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy oil, bread, detergents, beverages, snack foods, and basic grains.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en: Kelly and her husband have been operating their farming business for the past eight years. Every day they visit their farm to maintain the good quality of their crops. Kelly hopes to improve her crop production for the future of her children. In order to realize her dreams, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for their farm. With hard work, initiative and determination she will be able to attain success in life as well as her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides for her farming business

loans.name: Al-Sadaf Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Sadaf and it consists of three ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. Elteham is 38 years old; she is a married woman who has three children. She started her business on a small scale selling clothes and perfumes two years ago. Over time, her income has increased and she is now able to cover the cost of her children's expenses. She has to expand her business activities, so she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER (her share of the group loan) to buy clothes and perfumes for resale. This will enable her to earn larger profits by catering to a large number of clients.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes for resale.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is aged 41 years old and married. She is a mother of five children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for twenty-three years and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to support the family.

Thim has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan. She is going to use her portion to pay the land fee to grow rice. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay the land fee to grow rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Mom is a 47-year-old widow. The main source of the family’s income is growing cassava. To supplement the family’s income, she also works as a hairdresser in the local area. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day to support her family.

Mom is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her cassava timely so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Srong

texts.en:
Srong, 23, lives in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and she is married with three children. The family’s main sources of income are farming rice and growing cassava. To add more income, she works as a paid worker. She can earn about $12 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Srong has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan. She will use her loan to pay for plowing the field and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to get more crops from her agribusiness so as to fulfill her dream of having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to pay for plowing the field

loans.name: Sila's Group

texts.en:
From a rural village in the Dambae district of Cambodia, Sila is aged 50 and married with seven children.  She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living through growing cassava. Having engaged in this business for six years, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day.

Sila is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and use a portion of it to spend on buying household supplies. She hopes to earn more income so as to fulfill her dream of building a bigger house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn is 41 years old and married. She lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham Province and she has three children. To make a living, she has been planting cassava for five years. This activity earns about 31,000 KHR per day.

This is her first cycle with VisionFund and she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Norn is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees associated with harvesting cassava. She hopes to harvest more crops so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to pay for labor fee for harvesting cassava.

loans.name: Noun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Noun is a 26-year-old mother of two children. Rice farming and watermelon planting has been the only source of her family’s income for six years. To increase her income, she raises pigs. The current business earns her about 43,000 KHR per day.

Noun has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid previous loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more piglets to raise. She will also use a portion to spend on buying fertilizer and seeds for her agribusiness. She hopes to timely growing her rice in order to extend her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bernadine

texts.en: Bernadine is a 43-year-old woman who is married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children.  She is helping her husband to operate their farming business and has been doing so for over ten years.  She earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest.  She now wants to experience a better profit than previous yields. So, she is requesting additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to keep her farmland productive.  She will use her loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticides, as sustenance to their business. She hopes that someday they can improve their income and probably lift their living conditions out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Samang's Group

texts.en:
Samang, 19, is married with one baby daughter and resides in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She and her husband have been farming rice and working as paid workers. The current business earns her about 32,000 KHR per day. 

Samang has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Samang wants to use her portion to pay for rice harvesting. She hopes to harvest rice  in a timely way to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for rice harvesting

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 57, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a pensioner, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Lolita sells different products in her store, mostly ladies' accessories. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy different products such as soap, perfume, wallets and other ladies' accessories.

Lolita dreams that her business will grow bigger and she hopes to maintain a good relationship with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products such as soap, perfume, wallets and other ladies' accessories to sell

loans.name: Chenda's Group

texts.en:
Chenda is 31 years old and married with two children in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for six years. Her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 24,000 per day and can save about KHR 11,000 each day for their future needs.

Chenda is in her second cycle with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Chenda is going to use a portion to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for her family to use.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb is aged 45 years and married with eight children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice while her husband works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR 39,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 28,000 each day for future needs.

Chreb has been with VisionFund for five cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Chreb, who is the leader, will use her portion to pay labor fees for harvesting rice. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for harvesting rice

loans.name: Bum

texts.en:
Bum, 50, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She is a married mother of four children. Her family’s income is from farming rice. She has been in this business for twenty-three years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about $18 per day and manage to save about $8 per day for future needs.
 
Bum has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Bum is now applying for a loan. Bum is going to use her loan to pay labor fees. She hopes to make more crops from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to pay labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Vilma Guadalupe

texts.es:
Vilma, es una madre soltera que lucha día con día para salir a delante junto a sus tres hijos, para poder hacerlo se dedica a elaborar diferentes tipos de antojitos tales como tostadas, enchiladas, yuca, etc., esta actividad la realiza todos los días.
Invertirá en la compra de aceite, yuca, plátanos, tomates, condimentos entre otros ingredientes necesarios para elaborar la venta, espera aumentar la producción y tener buenas ganancias.
Sueña con tener los recursos económicos para aumentar  la diversificación de productos para tener más clientes y dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is a single mother who works day by day so that she and her three children can advance. To be able to do this, she makes and sells different types of snacks, such as tostadas, enchiladas, yucca, etc. She does this work every day.

She will invest in the purchase of oil, yucca, bananas, tomatoes, and condiments, among other ingredients that she needs to make the dishes that she sells. She hopes to increase her production and have good earnings.

She dreams of having the economic resources to increase the diversity of her products in order to have more customers and give her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil, yucca, bananas, tomatoes, and condiments, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es: Doña Daisy, mujer humilde trabajadora, alquila un pequeño local en donde realiza su actividad de costura, cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo. Doña Daisy solicita el  crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando telas variadas, hilos, aceites y dos maquinas de coser ya que las que tiene no estan rindiendo en su totalidad.
texts.en: Doña Daisy, a modest, hard-working woman, rents a small shop where she does sewing work. She has economic support from her husband. Doña Daisy is applying for the loan to invest in her business by buying various fabrics, threads, oils, and two sewing machines, since the ones she has are not performing fully.

loans.use: to buy various fabrics, thread, oils, and two sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an overlock machine and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Diego Johan

texts.es:
El es diego, un joven trabajador, buen estudiante y guerrero en la vida, en su infancia vivió con toda la familia  unida, lo cual para él fue toda una alegría, al crecer todos se empezaron a marchar y para el no fue fácil, pero lo hizo muy fuerte.
Desde allí decidió buscar grandes cosas para la vida, como estudiar mucho y trabajar muy duro para poder pagar el estudio, para él, el estudio es fundamental en la vida, puesto que los padres siempre lo aconsejan que el que estudia y se prepara bien llega  a ser un gran ser humano en la vida. 
Entonces empezó a trabajar muy duro y a estudiar, pero no se imagino las cosas tan maravillosas que se encontraba día a día en las clases, ya que puede tener el privilegio de estudiar esta cerrera, que es un gran regalo que le ha dado la vida en la cual quiere dar todo lo mejor que puede hacer para poder culminar, el beneficio con kiva sería bueno ya que  no tiene los  recursos suficientes para cubrir  las cuotas, el  busca de una o mil maneras para poder lograr el sueño que comenzó, el no quiere dejar el sueño a un lado por fatal de recursos económicos, puesto que ganas de estudiar es un don maravilloso que le sobra y le da la vida en el día a día. 

El espera ser cada día mejor, tener la oportunidad de ser profesional en el futuro y darle una mejor vida a los padres, los cuales para él, son el tesoro más grande en la vida y por los cuales lucha para demostrarles que el esfuerzo que hace un  ser humano se va a ver reflejado en los esfuerzos y proponiendo  nuevas metas por delante.
texts.en:
This is Diego, a young worker, good student, and fighter in life. In his childhood, he lived with his whole family, united, which for him was total happiness. As he grew up, everyone began to move, and this was not easy for him, but he was strong.

From there he decided to seek great things in life, such as studying a lot and working very hard to be able to pay for his education. For him, education is fundamental in life, since his parents always advised him to study and prepare himself well to become a great human being in life. 

Then he began to work very hard and to study, but he didn't imagine the marvelous things that he found day after day in his classes, since he is able to have the privilege to take this course of study, which is a great gift that he has been given in life, in which he wants to give all the best that he can to be able to finish. The advantage with Kiva will be good, since he doesn't have sufficient resources to cover the bills. He is seeking a thousand ways to be able to achieve the dream that he began. He does not want to abandon his dream due to lack of economic resources, since the desire to study is a marvelous gift, which he has plenty of, and it gives him life on a day to day basis.

He hopes to be better every day, to have the opportunity to become a professional in the future, and to give a better life to his parents, who for him are the greatest treasure in life and for whom he strives to show them that the effort that a human being makes is going to be reflected in the efforts and proposal of new future goals.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees

loans.name: Azizullo

texts.ru: Этого 25-летнего молодого человека зовут Азизулло. Он родом из района Дж.Руми. Азизулло холост и живет с родителями. Его отец работает учителем в сельской школе, а также занимается земледелием в свободное от работы время. Азизулло помогает отцу в его работе по земле. Однако сейчас он хочет открыть свой бизнес и выбрал для этого сферу животноводство. Азизулло просит кредит в размере 1050 долларов США, чтобы приобрести двух голов крупнорогатого скота. Он уже запасся кормом и теперь ждет финансовой поддержки для открытия бизнеса.
texts.en: This is Azizullo, a 25-year-old native of the J. Rumy district of Tajikistan.  He is single and still lives with his parents.  His father is a teacher at a rural school and, in his spare time, he is also involved in agriculture.  Azizullo helps his father with the farm work.  He is also planning to start his own business, and has decided to get involved in animal husbandry.  He is taking a loan of $1,050 to buy two head of cattle.  He has already stocked up on animal feed and he is now waiting for financial support to start his business.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 35 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her elder son has been working on an electrician’s shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans and washing machines. Additionally, her son troubleshoots the underground electrical supply and has been learning and troubleshooting the electrical goods as well. 

When Shakeela realized that her son had become an expert and could run the electrician’s shop activity alone, she decided to open a new shop for her son. Her son wants to buy new inventory to set up his shop, but does not have enough cash in hand to buy electrical goods. Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her son can be empowered to buy his desired inventories. Shakeela thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods to set up a newly opened shop.

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
Empieza una historia de vida en la cual  una mujer llamada maria camila  está decidida  a seguir el camino y luchar por los propósitos, uno de ellos es seguir estudiando una carrera por la cual ella se sienta identificada, ella después de muchas opciones escogió estudiar estética en una institución llamada campo alto que para ella es una gran felicidad tener un buen apoyo y un buen ingreso. 

ya teniendo claro los objetivos que va ella a trazar y por lo tanto ser una gran profesional para más tarde poder surgir y tener el propio negocio o  tal vez  hasta la propia academia. Por lo tanto espera que kiva como entidad y tenga en cuenta el subsidio otorgado  para realizar dichos objetivos y cumplir todas las metas.
texts.en:
This is the story of a woman named Maria Camila who has decided to stay the course and fight for her goals, one of which is to continue studying a career that she identifies with. After many options she chose to study esthetics in an institution called Campoalto, which for her is a great joy having good support and good income. 

She already has her objectives outlined clearly, and will therefore be a great professional so that later she may open up her own business or maybe her own school. As such she hopes that the Kiva organization considers this grant for realizing these objectives and achieving all her goals.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of enrollment.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is age 24, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking and honest lady. She owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband is doing a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time, her beauty products are going to run out, and she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Samina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair color, seizers, and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her businesses. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is age 45, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile shop for many years and generating income for his family. He troubleshoots the mobiles and sells mobile accessories, such as chargers, bodies, data cables, etc., and provides recharge facilities for different networks. 

Nowadays, demand for accessories and recharge is increasing, and sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into the business because he has spent all his income on household expenses. 

Therefore, Khursheed requested a loan for her son so he can be empowered to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facilities. 

Khursheed thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy mobile accessories for a mobile shop.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 39 years old, she is single, and she is a resident of Bolos, Siquijor, Philippines. She has one child who is of school age. Starting with a capital of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings, and she enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last year and has taken out three loans. 
Now she is applying for 27,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, shampoos, and soft drinks. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her child finish school.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, shampoos, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 41 years old and lives in Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married.
Rosita has a sari-sari store and earns PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy soft drinks, bread, toothpaste, soap, and other items for her store.
Rosita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her type of business and make it into big business someday.

loans.use: to pay for bread, soft drinks, toothpaste, soap, and other items

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 34, living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband provides polishing services for newly constructed floors. He polishes floors made of concrete and marble. For this purpose, he uses a floor polishing machine; he has been providing this service for many years. A few days ago, his polishing machine broke down due to a fluctuation in electricity. For this is reason, he wants to buy a new machine, but he does not have enough cash in hand.
Therefore, Nusrat is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a new polishing machine and continue his services.

loans.use: to buy a floor polishing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and drink, such as soft drinks, cold meats, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Diego  Alejandro

texts.es: El es diego Alejandro, se encuentra estudiando farmacia en el instituto campo alto, ha  tomado la decisión de inscribirse al convenio con Kiva ya que a la mamá   le toca responder por la hermana y por el. Ya que es madre cabeza de hogar, desde hace 10 años y puesto que en el momento la situación  es un poco dura ya que la mamá responde por los transportes y utilería de la hermana aparte de alimentación para la hermana y para el y corre con los gastos de servicios en la casa. A querido terminar los estudios y cumplir con las metas a futuro por medio del programa kiva, actual mente también a entrado a terminar el grado Once en el instituto Campo Alto y poder tener un trabajo estable y para poder colaborar a la mamá y terminar los estudios.
texts.en:
This is Diego Alejandro.  His is studying pharmaceutics in the Campo Alto School.  He lives with his mother who has to look after him and his sister.  He has decided to register with Kiva because his mother, who has been head of the household for the last ten years, is finding it difficult to pay for transport costs, maintenance and food for her children and also to take care of the household expenses.

He wants to finish his studies and achieve his aims with the help of Kiva.  At the moment he is finishing his eleventh grade at Campo Alto School and he wishes to finish his studies and find a steady job and be able to help his mother.

loans.use: to pay a semester of his studies.

loans.name: Maritza Carolina

texts.es:
Maritza, es casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 14 y 19 años de edad, para colaborar en cubrir los gastos familiares desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender papas fritas, panes, tostadas, lo aprendió en su familia, su horario es de 9:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., la ayudan sus hijos.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar un coche para hacer papas, así como también invertirá una parte en ingredientes como plátanos, papas, embutidos, pan, etc., le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, mejor el servicio, espera tener más ganancias.
Anhela a crecer en su negocio para dar a sus hijos una mejor educación académica y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is married and lives with her husband and children aged 14 and 19.  To help with the family expenses, she has been selling potato chips and sandwiches for 15 years.  She learnt the trade from her family.  She starts at nine o’clock in the morning and finishes at seven in the evening.  Her children help her at work.

She will use the loan to buy a food cart so she can make chips.  She will also buy some ingredients such as bananas, potatoes, cold meats and bread, etc.  This will help her to strengthen her business and improve her service, which she hopes will bring her more profit.

She hopes to grow her business to be able to give her children a better education so that they can be professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy a food cart to make chips and to buy some ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, eggs and other ingredients to make her desserts.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para pagar el mantenimiento del molino de nixtamal que posee, pues al tener un buen estado su equipo de trabajo podrá seguir atendiendo bien  a sus clientes.
Elizabeth utilizo la inversión anterior para comprar piezas nuevas para el molino, lo que le ha ayudado a mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, su economía ha mejorado y su familia se encuentra muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
Elizabeth feels the need to ask for a new loan to pay for the maintenance of her corn mill.  It is important to her to keep the machine in a good condition so that she can keep providing her customers with a quality service.

Elizabeth used the last loan to invest in new parts for the mill.  This helped her to improve her service and generate more income.  Her family are now healthy and well.

loans.use: to pay maintenance on a corn mill.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 40 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependents. 

Ofelia earns a living from her store with groceries and other consumable products for retail sale. She earns no less than PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to buy additional groceries and other consumable products for retail sale. 

Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Ofelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Lemuy Group

texts.es: Andrea, quien aparece de las segundas de derecha a izquierda, con un polerón morado y de lentes, es socia del Banco Comunal Lemuy, ubicado en Castro. Los socios de este Banco Comunal tiene variado negocios tales como cosecha y venta de ajo, desabolladora y pintura de vehículos, artesanía en lana, venta de productos por catalogo gasfitería y soldadura, entre otros; Andrea tiene una librería y confitería en donde además tiene anillado, plastificado, y fotocopia. Su negocio lo tiene hace 5 años, comenzó ya que su marido quedó cesante y ella encontró un trabajo de medio día en donde le pagaban poco, y ahorraba un poco de ese dinero, con ese dinero que ahorró pudo empezar a comprar pequeñas cosas para empezar a levantar su negocio. Hace poco nuevamente su marido quedó sin trabajo así que deberá nuevamente enfocarse en  ayudar a su familia con el dinero que gana, pero como desafío tiene el colocar una máquina para sacar fotografías tamaño carnet, ya que en la isla que vive no existe esa máquina. El dinero que esta solicitando es para comprar, espirales mica y productos para su librería y confitería. Sabe que le irá muy bien ya que ha podido darles tranquilidad a las personas que viven junto con ella, ya que su negocio es el único que hay cerca en donde pueden sacar fotocopias. Está  muy contenta y agradecida con la ayuda que le ha otorgado Fondo Esperanza.
texts.en:
Andrea, who appears second from the right in a purple sweatshirt and glasses, is a member of the communal bank Lemuy, located in Castro. The members of this communal bank have various businesses such as harvesting and selling garlic, dent removal and painting for vehicles, wool handcrafts, selling plumbing and welding supplies by catalog, and others. 

Andrea has a bookstore and sweetshop where she also has binding, laminating and photocopying services. She has had her business for five years, she started it when her husband lost his job and she found a half-day job that didn't pay much. She saved a little from this money and with that saved money she could start buying little things to start setting up the business. Recently her husband has again found himself out of work, so she must again focus on helping her family with the money she makes. But she faces a challenge of trying to get a machine for printing passport-sized photos, since on the island where she lives there is no such machine.

The money she is requesting is to buy spiral binding, laminate, and products for her bookstore and sweetshop. She knows that it will work out well for her since she has been able to give peace to the people who live with her, becasue her business is the only one nearby to get photocopies. She is very happy and grateful for the help that Fondo Esperanza has given her.

loans.use: to buy laminate, spiral binding, and bookstore and sweetshop products

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es:
Wendy es una persona inteligente, humilde y visionaria, desde pequeña se ha caracterizado por ser  perseverante y muy disciplinada con los estudios, dedicada de lleno en ellos desde los inicios, pasando por los estudios de básica primaria hasta los estudios de básica secundaria, siempre ha mostrado un comportamiento responsable y propio por dar lo mejor de sí, con el fin de obtener los mejores resultados en persecución de los planes y metas de vida.
El interés por la rama de la medicina la  podríamos asociar  al  gran sentido humano, la posibilidad de ayudar dignamente  y humanitaria mente a las personas, despierta en ella un gran sentimiento de satisfacción,  por lo que ve en la medicina una opción no solo de vida en búsqueda de una estabilidad económica, social e intelectual sino además una satisfacción  personal basada en la ayuda a la sociedad.
En Campo alto, ella ve la posibilidad de ingresar a estudiar la carrera técnica de auxiliar de enfermería en busca de crear unas fuertes y  buenas bases académicas en pro de los fundamentos que rigen la ciencia de la medicina. Actualmente, en un país con tan evidentes  falencias en los servicios de salud, el crecimiento y la demanda de personal altamente calificado y capacitado  ha suscitado un gran incremento en la oferta de instituciones educativas que ofrecen carreras técnicas,  tecnológicas y profesionales  en la medicina que buscan solventar los altos costos de acceso que se presentan en otras instituciones ofreciendo programas económicamente de fácil acceso. 
Wendy  al ser una persona luchadora y con un gran sentido de superación, que ve en Campo alto, una opción muy clara de ingresar a la educación superior, una educación de buena calidad y de fácil acceso económico, que pueda satisfacer las metas, necesidades, retos y sueños. O por lo menos, un camino donde empezar a forjarlos de manera que las bases de estos sean sólidas y fuertes. 
Además ella tiene muy buenas referencias de dicha institución de la que afirman la calidad de la formación de los estudiantes no solo en el ámbito profesional sino también en la formación ética y social de los mismos, ella también le ofrecieron el convenio con kiva en campo alto ya que le pareció una ayuda económica grande para la familia y para ella misma.
texts.en:
Wendy is an intelligent, humble person who is a visionary. Since she was little, she has been described as persevering and very disciplined in her studies. She was totally dedicated to them from the start, going through elementary school and secondary school, she always showed responsible behavior, suitable for giving the best of herself in order to obtain the best results when pursuing her plans and life goals.  

We can associate her interest in medicine with her big sense of humanity and the possibility of helping people in a dignified and humane way. This awakens in her a great feeling of satisfaction, and she sees medicine as an option not just for seeking financial, social and intellectual stability, but personal satisfaction from helping society. 

In Campo Alto, she sees the possibility of studying the technical major of assistant nurse, seeking new and stronger academic bases in favor of the basics that govern the science of medicine. Right now, in a country which such an evident lack of health services, the growth and demand of highly qualified and trained personnel has caused a great increase in the supply of educational institutions that offer technical and professional medical majors that seek to pay for the high costs of access that exist in other institutions by offering programs that are financially easily accessible.  
 
Wendy is a fighter who really wants to get ahead. She goes to Campo Alto, a very clear option for getting higher education, and a high quality education with easy financial access to meet her goals, needs, challenges and dreams. Or at least, be a road where she can start to meet them with a strong and solid base. In addition, she has good references from the institution who affirm the quality of the training, not only in the professional area, but in ethically and socially. They also offered her the Kiva contract in Campo Alto and it seemed like a great financial help for her and her family.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment for a semester.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agripina ella es soltera y tiene 51 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de cabinas de internet, negocio de restaurant, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de ropa.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of communal bank “Llapanchispac”, from the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco, Cusco department.

Agripina, one of the members, is 51 years old, single, and has two children. She has a restaurant and prepares different dishes such as chicken and fries, soups and meat stews, and works from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has had this business for seven years and does well. Her dream is to expand her business.

Agripina is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

The remaining members provide internet access, have restaurants and grocery stores, and sell clothes.

Agripina wants to thank all those who share her dream through this system and promises to pay all the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant, such as chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is from Bolos, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is 46 years old, and married with six children who are in school and adults.  

In 2013, Lucia applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of a member in good standing, and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Lucia is asking for financial assistance of Php 10,000 to purchase additional equipment for charcoal making. 

Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for charcoal making.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 51 years old and lives in Culo, Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with five children.

Emelia has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to buy five cases of soft drinks, bread, toothpaste, etc..

Emelia has been a member of PMPC for two years. 

In the future, Emelia hopes to improves her business and make it into big business someday.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks, bread, toothpaste, etc..

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 61 years old and lives in Villalin, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

For income, Mirasol is engaging in a coconut and copra buying and selling business. She earns an approximate amount of PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase coconuts and copra to sell to big copra traders.  

Mirasol has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts and copra

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 57 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Ma. Luisa has been engaged in farming activity, particularly rice production, for 32 years.  She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of fertilizer, chemical sprays, and to pay for labor for the care of rice production.  

Ma. Luisa has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Ma. Luisa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of fertilizer and chemical sprays, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Remie Heart

texts.en:
Remie Heart joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2013, and she appreciates the programs, services, and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing, and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. This loan is intended to purchase addditional ingredients and spices for her food vending activity.

Remie Heart dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: To purchase addditional ingredients and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to look after her crops.

loans.name: Marybel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DE COPACABANA, el banco está ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maribel  tiene 36 años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de salchipapas y pollipapas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, papás entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower, Marybel, is a member of the "Virgen de Copacabana" communal bank, located in the Cusco province of the Cusco department.

Marybel is 36 years old and, as well as carrying out her daily activities, has a business selling meals, such as a sausages and chips, and chicken and chips. Marybel has had the business for quite some time and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. This borrower wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Marybel is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, chips and more.

Marybel is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as oil, chips and more.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Bagacay, Larena, Siquijor. She is 50 years old and is married with 4 children who are in school. 

In 2013, Wilma applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Wilma asked for financial assistance of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour and sugar. Through this, she hopes to increase her income, which will help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for her financial needs from PMPC. She is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour and sugar.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz, age 64, is happy tending her little store. She is married with 1 child who is an adult. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Luz runs the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Luz believes that, with PMPC's support, she will sustain and beat the competition.  

Luz has reached her 1st year being a member to PMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles and beverages for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles and beverages.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 24 years old. She is very responsible with her household obligations and has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and four children. She is a housewife who is engaged in a hog-raising business.

Mary Ann wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 that will enable her to purchase feeds, piglets, and other items so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Fulgencia

texts.en: Fulgencia has been a member of PMPC since January 2008. She is married and her children are already adults. Her grandchildren are living with her since her married children work away from her place. Fulgencia was a fulltime snack and vegetable vendor when she joined PMPC. Through snack and vegetable vending, she was able to finance her family and repay her previous loans. When her children married, she stopped selling. Now, she has a pineapple plantation with about one half hectare of pineapple plants. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for the plants for good fruit production. The income from this will help in renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase needed fertilizers for her pineapple plantation.

location.town: Dipolog - Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been running a small dairy farm along with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for the production of milk to sell in her locality. She counts on a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Kousar has gradually improved her business with the support of BRAC Pakistan. She applied for a loan which, with the contribution of savings, is to buy an additional buffalo to produce more milk to sell. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has been showing excellent repayment behavior so far. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

Kousar thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for her dairy farm.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 30. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods.
