He provides services to his clients for the maintenance of electric goods also. For the growth of his business and the desire to generate maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders, sockets, etc. to offer to his customers.
 
Razia hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Yenny Milena

texts.es: Ella es Yenny milena de Bogota, quiere  contarles que esta estudiando AIPI ( Atención integral a al primera infancia)  porque le gusta trabajar con niños y quiere lograr las metas por ella y por la  familia, ademas quiere  lograr trabajos con niños que requieran de los conocimientos y apoyo,  tanto por los niños o el sitio donde trabaje como podrá ella  misma, ella agradece el apoyo que kiva le pueda dar  para lograr los sueños y poder tener una ayuda económica en la cuota mensual que tiene que pagar.
texts.en: This is Yenny Milena from Bogota.  She is studying Comprehensive Early Childhood Care because she likes working with children and wants to achieve her family goals.  She also wants to be able to work with children who need help in whatever way she can provide.  She is grateful to Kiva for whatever financial help they can provide toward the monthly fees she must pay.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City.

Leonila sells groceries and canned goods for a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP15,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to restock her store with canned goods, soft drinks, rice and other items.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for more than two years. In the future, Leonila hopes to have a supermarket or a bigger grocery store.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, soft drinks, rice and other items

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 30-year-old married father with three children. He has been selling clothes since nine years ago. In 2007, he started his own business. He was taught how to manage and was provided with the necessary experience from his father, who is an expert in this domain.

Eyad is a Palestinian refugee who was born and lives in Lebanon. He is a hard worker who is living and working in a Palestinian camp. Working in a camp is a big challenge, since any business is limited by the same number of customers. So he has to be creative to increase his income and develop his living.

For this reason, and through Eyad's previously acquired loans from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, he established an additional business which targets different types of customers. He opened an Internet cafe, and it is going on just fine.

Today, Eyad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He will use this to increase his business merchandise with a special released spring collection with special encouraging prices. This will attract more customers and develop his business.

Eyad hopes that he'll stay capable of expanding his businesses, increasing his income, and developing his family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to purchase a spring collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina is 47 years old and lives in Cangmohao, Siquijor, Siquijor. In order to help the family, she sells a variety of goods. Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store.  In 2013, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with a good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 7,000 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store.  This is because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs. She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future.  She also plans to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, noodles, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is a 20-year-old, single Iraqi man. He lives with his parents. Muhamed started his business approximately eight years ago to generate income to cover his family and his personal expenses.  

Muhamed will use this loan to renovate his workplace and buy more grocery products. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide a good life for his family.

The story of Muhamed and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Elsy Marisol

texts.es:
Elsy, es madre de un niño de tres años de edad, ella tiene 34 años y su esposo 32 años, es casada, hace 10 años empezó a trabajar con su mamá en un chalet en la escuela de la localidad donde reside, donde vende comida, golosinas, bebidas entre otros.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar bebidas, pan, carnes, embutidos, golosinas y frutas, de esa manera contara con lo necesario para surtir bien el inventario del negocio, espera sacar el mayor provecho de la inversión.
Sueña con mejorar la economía para dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida y cancelar las deudas.
texts.en:
Elsy has a three year old son.  She is 34 years old, and her husband is 32.  She is married.  Ten years ago she started to work with her mother at a stand in the school that is located in the area where she lives.  She sells food, candy, and drinks, among others.

She will use the loan to buy drinks, bread, meat, sausages, candy, and fruit.  This way she will have what she needs to stock her business well with inventory.  She hopes to get the best advantage from this investment.

She dreams of improving her finances in order to give her family a better lifestyle and to pay her debts.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, meat, sausages, candy, and fruit.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 23-year-old single man who has worked as a barber since 2008. He was only 15 years old when he started working in this domain to support his parents and their living conditions. He learned how to be barber through a college he attended to make his career more efficient and creative.

Husein is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a Renault Rapid car that will help him a lot in developing his living through starting an additional income business that has to do with fulfilling barber needs in the region.

This additional business will provide him with a good income and will develop his social relationships in the region, which will improve his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To buy a Renault Rapid car to start an additional business to fulfill barber needs in the region

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products such as fish, pork, charcoal and different ingredients for grilling. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of products such as fish, pork, charcoal and different ingredients for grilling.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, con 54 años de edad, se ha dedicado por muchos años a vender mercancía por encargo y productos por catálogos, de manera alterna, administra la tienda de una institución educativa; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido luchar incansablemente, siempre buscando la manera de salir adelante, esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito para comprar una vitrina y otros activos que debe cambiar, además comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas, dulces, productos de panadería, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y tendrá más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a los estudiantes, mejorando así las ventas y los ingresos.
Carmen manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir un local propio ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para montar su negocio y lograr que sea mucho más rentable y que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 54 years old, and for many years, she has worked selling merchandise by order and products through catalogs.  She also runs the store for an educational institute that allows her to complement her income so that she can get her children ahead.  Her tenacity and perseverance have helped her to fight tirelessly to always find a way to get ahead.  This has led her to seek a loan to purchase  a display case and other items that she needs to change, and also purchase merchandise in bulk (snacks, soda, candy, pastries, and others).  This will help her to continue with her work and offer more variety to the students, increasing her sales and her earnings.

Carmen says that her greatest desire is to have her own retail space in the center of the city where she can open a business and make it very profitable, guaranteeing financial stability so that she may provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a display case and other items that she needs to change, and also purchase merchandise in bulk (snacks, soda, candy, pastries, and others).

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is 46 years of age and married. She lives with her husband and is blessed with four children. She is buying and selling bottles as a source of income. With this occupation, she is in need of additional capital to purchase more bottles to clean. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more bottles. She hopes to create higher sales through her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy more bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like potatoes, rice, cooking oil, and meat, among others

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is married with three children. She is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. Juvy is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Juvy has requested a loan to pay for the palay (rice) harvesting and to buy additional pig heads. She has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Juvy hopes to fulfill the every day financial needs of her family and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for the palay (rice) harvesting and to buy additional pig heads.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is married with three children. Elmer is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elmer is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. Elmer has been doing this for 10 years.

Elmer has requested a loan to pay for harvesting palay (rice). Elmer has been a member for one year. In the future, Elmer hopes to fulfill the financial needs of his family every day and to expand his farm.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting of palay (rice).

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
José, tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, su esposa tiene 55 años de edad, tienen tres hijos. Para cubrir los gastos familiares hace 10 años estableció un taller de mecánica, trabaja todos los días, lo apoyan sus hijos para atenderlo.
Invertirá en la compra de herramientas para el taller como por ejemplo, llaves, bujías,  sensores, retrovisores, etc., así contara con lo necesario para cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, espera aumentar la clientela, dar un buen servicio y mejorar su economía.
Sueña con fortalecer más el negocio y tener los recursos económicos para cumplir con los diferentes compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 61 years old and is married.  His wife is 55 years old, and they have three children together.  To cover the household expenses, he opened a mechanic shop ten years ago.  He works every day, and his children help him.

He will use the loan to purchase tools for his workshop such as: wrenches, spark plugs, sensors, mirrors, etc...  With this, he will have the necessary supplies to fulfill jobs for his customers.  He hopes to expand his customer base, provide good service and improve his finances.  He dreams of strengthening his business and having the financial resources to meet his different expenses.

loans.use: purchase tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, es una señora de 37 años, es casada, su esposo tiene 38 años y juntos disfrutan de sus cuatro hijos, los cuales están estudiando, por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, se dedica a vender comida lo cual lo hace de lunes a viernes, ya cuenta con tres años de experiencia.
Comprará bebidas, carnes, embutidos, verduras, especias, entre otros ingredientes para preparar los diferentes platillos que ofrece  a sus clientes, espera tener más clientes nuevos, mejores ventas y una economía más estable.
Sueña con crecer en su negocio y mejorar la economía para cancelar sin problemas las deudas, pero sobre todo ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 37 year old married woman.  Her husband is 38 years old, and together they have four children who are in school.  Due to the need to support her husband with the household expenses, she works selling food Monday through Friday.  She has been doing this for three years.  

With this loan, she will purchase beverages, meat, sausages, vegetables, spices, and other ingredients to prepare the different meals that she offers to her customers.  She hopes to gain new customers, improve her sales and stabilize her finances.  She dreams of expanding her business and improving their finances so that she can pay off her debts.  Above all else, she wants to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase beverages, meat, sausages, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has six children. 

Mercidita is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Mercidita has requested a loan to pay for harvesting and to purchase materials for house renovation. 

Mercidita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Mercidita hopes to meet the financial needs of her family every day and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and purchase materials for house renovation.

loans.name: Matty

texts.en:
Matty is single. He is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Matty is a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years.

Matty has requested loan to pay for harvesting of palay (rice) and to purchase additional pigs. 

Matty has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Matty hopes to meet the financial needs of his family and to expand his farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting of palay (rice) and to purchase additional pigs.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is married and has five children. He is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Alberto is a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years.

Alberto has requested a loan to pay for farming activities of harvesting, threshing and sacking. 

Alberto has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Alberto hopes to meet the financial needs of his family every day and to expand his farm.

loans.use: to pay for farming activities of harvesting, threshing and sacking.

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Esteria is married with 8 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela, Philippines.
She sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.
Esteria has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 39 years old, married and a resident of Relocation Olingan, Dipolog City, Philippines. She has two children and she sends her child to school.

She started her business with an amount of PHP 5,000. She opened a sari-sari (general) store and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum MPC. Aside from getting financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys benefits of the coop.

Now she is applying for PHP 7,000 to pay for stocks of canned goods, rice, soft drinks and other items for her store. In the future her dream is to have a mini mart with the help of God.

loans.use: To pay for stocks of canned goods, rice, soft drinks and other items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of 2,000 helps Nada to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en: Gilda is married with three children. She is 54 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines. Gilda sells a variety of products to earn a living and has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to restock her store with basic commodities. Gilda has been a member of PMPC for 10 months. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 70 years old and a widow, with four children. She is a farmer and she busies herself doing this type of work. She also enjoys her hog-raising, for additional income.  

Ariel has requested a loan to pay for harvesting palay, to buy four sacks of feed, and to purchase additional heads of pigs. 

Ariel has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. In the near future, Ariel hopes to mee the financial needs of her family every day and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting palay, to buy four sacks of feed, and to purchase additional heads of pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is single with no children. She is 42-years-old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Jennifer sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,900 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,500 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 36 years old. She is married, with three children. 

Juvy is a businesswoman and, at the same time, a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. Juvy has been doing this for five years. 

Recently, she has requested loan to restock her store with basic commodities and to purchase additional heads of pigs. 

Juvy has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. In the future, Juvy hopes to meet the financial needs of her family every day and to expand her farm and business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and to purchase additional heads of pigs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 48-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 7 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells ornaments, bags, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a stable environment and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power of clients. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ornaments, bags and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more stock of ornaments, bags and other items

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en:
Dioscoro is married and has five children. He is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Philippines.

Dioscoro  is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan to buy 20 sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for his coconut plantation.

Dioscoro has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, he hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of fertilizers and pesticides for his coconut plantation

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 46, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Sevillano and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. Rowena is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Rowena's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Rowena is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Rowena hopes to be more successful in business and in life and dreams to have a happy family.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kositante

texts.en:
Kositante is a 27-year-old Ugandan male who is married to Fausta with three children, ages 9, 6, and 4.  One attends school.

He is a business man who operates a retail shop and sells products like sugar, salt and cooking oil. He also does farming and trades in agricultural produce to supplement his business.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 to add to his retail shop so he can make more profits.

He dreams of expanding his business and acquiring more land to build a good family house. Kositante is a hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items for sell

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 39-year-old Ugandan who is married to Kate with four children, all of whom attend school.  He is the one who pays their tuition and provides their other necessities.

Jackson has a retail shop as his business where he sells general merchandise like sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil, but he also does farming and rides a motorcycle (boda boda) as an additional source of income.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to add to his shop to satisfy demands from the residents of the nearby town for the products which he sells.

His dream is to acquire more land for farming and also to educate all his children up to the university level.  He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

His main challenges include a poor road network that affects transportation, especially for his boda boda business.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, which will help Florence to generate higher profits. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to establish more branches.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Riem

texts.en:
Riem is 44 years old and a married mother of seven children. She works in the farming business, which is the sole source of her family’s income. Having been in rice cultivation for more than 20 years, she is able to make a proper income of KHR 20,000 per day. Even with the hardships, Riem hopes that she can provide her children with their basic needs and improve their living conditions through the farming business. 

Currently, she is asking for a loan to be used to build a safe latrine for her household. She knows that having a latrine will promote their health and increase the value of her home. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Riem is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for her household.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly, aged 63, is happy tending to her little store. She is married with four children. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family, along with the support that she also receives from her loving husband. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Shirly continues to run the store despite increasing competition from other stores. She believes that, as a family and with the support of the Paglaum MPC, they will sustain the business and beat competitors. 

Shirly is a MIGS member in a Cooperative. She has applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to pay for additional stock for her Sari-sari store, such as rice, canned goods, and other basic commodities. Expanding her inventory will mean higher income. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and, going forward, a good life for her children.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock for her Sari-sari store such as rice, canned goods and other basic commodities

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, se dedica a atender su taller de mecánica automotriz y también tiene venta de variedad de productos para vehículos, lo tiene desde hace 2 años, desde muy joven aprendió todo lo relacionado con el negocio, es casado, tiene dos hijos uno de ellos ya inicio sus estudios. Con dicho negocio genera los recursos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Comprará lubricantes, aceites, retrovisores, sensores, etc., lo necesario para tener productos para la venta y para cumplir con los encargos pendientes, espera que con dicha ayuda su negocio sea más rentable y tenga mejores ganancias para cubrir los gastos familiares, así como también las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
Anhela con tener su propio local para tener mejores ingresos y dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
José makes a living working at an auto-mechanic shop and also sells a variety of products for vehicles. He has had this business for two years. He has learned everything about this business since he was very young. José is married and has two children, one of whom just begun school. With his business he receives enough income to cover his household expenses. 

He will buy lubricant, oil, rearview windows, sensors, etc. These are needed to have for sales and fulfill orders that he currently has. He hopes that with this help his business will be more profitable and he will receive greater earnings for his family's expenses, and to pay back the debt he has taken on. 

He aspires to have his own locale in order to have greater earnings and offer better service.

loans.use: to buy lubricant, oil, rearview windows, and sensors.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 45 years old and she lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past 13 years, Asha has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, in which she sells charcoal. 

To help expand the business, Aisha has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and will help Aisha to generate greater profits. Aisha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
This is Ronald, 34, and a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Analiza, a housewife, and they have children. He and his wife manage their household while operating their business. At this time, Ronald is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ronald operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Ronald earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Ronald is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Ronald dreams that his business will grow and hopes to have a happy family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa, es una mujer dedicada a buscar el bienestar de su familia, está acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida y un hijo de tres años, para apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, se dedica a la elaboración de petates, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de tule por mayor y a un mejor precio, ya que es la materia prima y en este momento está lo cosecha de dicho producto, de esta manera contara con los recursos necesarios para trabajar por un tiempo sin ninguna limitante, espera aumentar la producción, cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes y tener más ganancias.
Su mayor anhelo es ver crecer a su hijo en un ambiente sano y con la oportunidad de una buena educación.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a woman dedicated to seeking the well-being of her family.  She is married, lives with her life partner, and has a three-year-old son.  In order to help with the household expenses, she earns a living making sleeping mats.  It is a job she learned from her family.

She is going to use the loan to purchase wholesale and better priced tule stalks, the raw material she uses, because right now is the harvest of said product.  This way she will have the necessary resources to work for a time without any limitation.  She hopes to increase production, fulfill her customers' orders, and have more profits.

Her greatest desire is to see her son grow up in a healthy environment and have the opportunity to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy wholesale tule stalks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 49-years-old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, David has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand the business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bedsheets, shirts and trousers, and will help David to generate greater profits and increasd stock. David hopes that in the future he will be able to have more stock.

loans.use: buy more bedsheets, shirts and trousers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Bua

texts.en:
Bua is 40 years old and lives in the town of Lira in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Bua has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which deals in tailoring. 

To help expand business, Bua has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials, and will help Bua to generate greater profits. Bua hopes that in the future he will be able to provide clients with what they want. 




"

loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 35 years old and she lives in the town of Bugembe, in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Peninah has been working hard to manage her drugstore, which sells drugs and pampers, condoms, and Always. 

To help expand the business, Peninah has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs, pampers, pads, condoms, and other items and will help Peninah to generate greater profits and stock new medications in the shop. Peninah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to add capital to the business.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs, pampers, pads, condoms, and other items to sell in her drugstore.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married with 6 children. She is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living, and she has done this for 35 years. Recently she has requested a loan to pay for harvesting and to restock her store with basic commodities. 
Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to be able to meet the everyday financial needs of her family, and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting and to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Maria Magdalena, 54, and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She’s married to William, a security guard, and she is a mother to her child. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, Maria Magdalena is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Maria Magdalena is a rice dealer. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by sacks or by the kilo. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,800 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, Maria Magdalena is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of rice for her business.

Maria Magdalena hopes that her business will grow bigger and she dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of rice needed in her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 30 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells soap, sugar, beans and other items. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soap, sugar, beans and other items, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and expand the business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to develop the business. 




"

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, beans and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, bread and milk to sell.

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima, age 33 and unmarried, works in an international TV station, where she is responsible for makeup. She has been employed in this work for the past two years. She is a hard worker, well known in her field, and her goal is achieve results as close as possible to perfection, hoping that one day she can establish her own beauty salon.
 
She is currently requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to make one of her dreams come true: she will invest her loan funds into paying for her engagement needs. She is excited about her engagement and awaits the big event anxiously. It will take place soon.
 
Her short-term business goal is to develop her career path.

loans.use: to pay for her engagement needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 37 years old and he lives in the town of Mayuge, in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Edward has been working hard to manage his salon business, which deals in salon services. 

To help expand the business, Edward has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chemicals and braids for the salon and it will help Edward to generate greater profits and increase his salon's stock. 

Edward hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have the biggest salon for bridal services, as well in the biggest salon in Iganga Mayuge.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals and braids for the salon.

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar Alexander tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil unión libre, vive con la esposa y su madre en la Ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Oscar Alexander  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas mensualmente. 
Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas en los cultivos. El sueño es tener su negocio propio para sustentar a su familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Alexander, 20, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his wife and his mother in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province.  He is a member of the communal bank "30 de Julio," which meets in Recinto Zapotal Nuevo in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group are farmers.

Oscar Alexander cultivates rice and corn.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies, including: organic and chemical fertilizers, urea, and liquid weed killer.  He makes his purchases each month in the city of Ventanas.

Oscar Alexander faces challenges such as the pests that affect his crops.  His dream is to have his own business to support his family.  In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar, salt, posho, rice, sodas, water, flour, sweets and other items. 

To help expand the business, Asha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, posho, rice, sodas, water, flour, sweets and other items, and will help her to generate greater profits and increase stock in the shop. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open another business with clothes and bags.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, posho, rice, sodas, water, flour, sweets and other items

loans.name: Glendy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glendy, se ha decidido por otro crédito para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca, ya que son la materia prima para continuar elaborando el pan que vende y para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior lo utilizo para tener la materia prima para aumentar su producción, sus ventas aumentaron, su economía es mejor, ha cancelado sus deudas y su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Glendy has decided to take another loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and butter, because these are the raw materials that she uses in her bakery business.  This way she can keep up with the demands of her customers.

Glendy used her previous loan to buy raw materials to expand her production.  Her sales increased, her finances improved, she has paid off her debts, and her family is enjoying a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, butter, etc.

loans.name: Samean

texts.en:
Samean is a rice farmer. She lives and farms in a remote area of Preah Sdach district in Prey Veng province. She and her husband earn enough of an income from cultivating rice once per year that they are generally able to support the family's basic daily needs. They have eight children, and they work hard to support them. Some of the children are old enough to help them during the farming season as well.
 
As the family home is located in the off-grid area of the province, Samean aims to invest in the purchase of a solar home system, which she intends to install on the roof of her house. After this initial investment, Samean will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she will use to support household appliances such as lights, television, and radio. In this way, everyone in her family can work or study even at night. As she does not currently have sufficient capital for this essential investment, she has requested a loan for this purpose.

She is very thankful to her lenders for helping her to make this investment in improving her family's living conditions, helping the environment, and reducng health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of solar home system to install on the top roof of her house.

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es:
José, es parte de una familia integrada por su esposa y su hijo, él tiene la responsabilidad de proveer a su familia de lo necesario para que vivan bien, se dedica a atender su tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, la atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.
Surtirá su inventario con la compra bebidas, pan, huevos, golosinas, granos básicos, etc., le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio, tener más clientes satisfechos, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía y cancelar sus deudas.
Aspira a tener la facilidad económica para mejorar la vivienda y cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
José's family is made up of himself, his wife and his son. He is the one responsible for providing his family with what they need to live well. He works in his shop where he sells the daily necessities. He works from 7am until 4pm.

He will increase his stock by buying drinks, bread, eggs, sweets, basic grains etc. This will help him to strengthen his business, have more satisfied customers, increase his sales, improve his finances and pay off his debts. 

He hopes one day to be able to afford to improve his home and change the family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, eggs, sweets, basic grains etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Jemilson

texts.en:
Jemilson is 26 years of age and he manages his motor parts and services shop in the market. He has been operating his business for four years and is able to earn PHP 10,000 a month. According to him, the generated income is not enough to purchase higher quality motor parts and accessories.

He is applying for a loan of PHP 35,000 as additional capital to be used in buying motor parts and to further enhance the service he offers through new tools. Jemilson is looking forward to the approval of his requested loan amount so he can satisfy his customer's demand and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy motor parts  and  further enhance his spare parts business

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is a male Ugandan, aged 28 years, married to Annet, and they have four children aged between 12 and 4.

Medard is a motorcycle taxi rider as his main source of income but he is also involved in the agricultural produce business and farming when it is the season. He does his businesses from a trading centre in Kibaale district.  

Medard has approached Ugafode for a loan to invest in produce since it is the season. He hopes to pay back after making profits from the business. His dream is to acquire more motorcycles and have all his children educated to university level since he himself did not study much.

His main challenges include the poor road network which makes him spend a lot on repairs and delays transportation of his produce. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is single without children. He is 25 years old and lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Philippines.

Jeffrey is a farmer and grows banana crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan to buy 30 sacks of fertilizer.

Jeffrey has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jeffrey hopes to put aside savings and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
El es jaime lara, quiere contar un poco de la vida de el, después de haber tenido la experiencia de una vida religiosa con las exigencias que esta conlleva,  Jaime alberto  enfrenta una decisión importante que debe guiar el rumbo de la vida, se ve enfrentado a los avatares de la vida común donde la necesidad económica no da tregua y tiene que aceptar emplearse cuanto antes para empezar a forjar un futuro próximo que le apremia.
Jaime debe buscar la manera de iniciar un nuevo camino, un camino que le lleve a la realización de las metas,  por eso habla con el hermana que también hacia poco inicio con esfuerzo una carrera corta para dar un giro a la vida laboral,  ella le hablo del instituto donde cursaba ya el segundo semestre de farmacia, y Jaime vio en esta opción una oportunidad para dar inicio a lo que buscaba por ello fue hasta el instituto y se matriculo en el primer semestre de farmacia, con el fin de formarse en un campo que toma auge en las actuales esferas del comercio y el servicio a una población urgida de lugares para encontrar el medicamento debidamente comercializado, es así como Jaime ve el futuro con una gran esperanza y pone en el corazón el deseo de prepararse como mejor pueda para ser un excelente farmacéutica, esta es la razón para que Jaime solicite el convenio kiva y haga de la experiencia en campo alto una oportunidad viable a el proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime Lara would like to tell a little about his life.  After having some experience with a religious life and its requirements, Jaime has an important life decision to make.  He is facing life’s financial needs and he needs to go to work to forge a rewarding future.

Jaime needs to find a new path where he can realize his goals, so he spoke to a sister who also recently began working toward a short career effort.  She spoke to him about the school where she was in her second semester of pharmacy studies and Jaime saw this as an opportunity to begin what he was looking for, so he started the first semester.  In order to join a field that is expanding in existing areas of trade and serving a population in urgent need of places to find the medicine properly marketed.  Jaime sees the future with great hope and he has the heart to prepare as best he can.  This is the reason for Jaime’s request to Kiva.  He wants to experience viable opportunity for his life’s plans.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir is a 24-year-old single man who lives with his father. He is a farmer who raises fruit trees in his private garden and sells fruit (apples, pears, peaches, cherries, etc.) at the local bazaar. He has worked in this field for four years and his monthly income is 150AZN.

People like eating fresh fruit every day. They buy fruit from Zakir because they know his produce is fresh and grown without pesticides. They know that fruit grown with pesticides is harmful to one's health. 

Zakir needs to expand his small business because his income doesn't cover his family’s demands. He applied for a loan of 800AZN to buy fruit tree seeds. This is his second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new fruit tree seeds

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.ru: Мухамадчон живет с родными на маленьком районе Кубадиён. Ему 42 года. Мухамадчон женат. Он занимается земледелием, но он очень хочет начать новую деятельность животноводства. Ему нравиться проводить время с животными и кормить, поить их. Мухамадчон планирует выращивать скотов. Но данный бизнес требует много средств и сил. Мухамадчон не жалеет сил и хочет скорее начать новую деятельность, но ему не хватает средств. Поэтому он просит помочь купить телят и начать бизнес.
texts.en: Muhamadjon is 42 and married and lives with his relatives in the small region of Qubadiyon. He works in agriculture, but really wants to start a new business in animal husbandry. He likes to spend time with animals and to feed and water them. Muhamadjon plans to raise cattle, but such a business requires a lot of capital and strength. He isn't short of strength and wants to get started as soon as possible, but he doesn't have enough starting capital. Therefore he is asking for help to purchase calves and start his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a business raising cattle

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор житель района Дж.Руми. Он мужчина средних лет, ему уже за 30. Абдусаттор мастер строитель. Он женат и имеет детей. Его жена сидит дома и зарабатывает у себя дома шитьем. Абдусаттор в настоящее время остался без заказа и решил начать такой бизнес, который приносил бы ему стабильный доход. Он планирует начать куплю и продажу крупнорогатого скота. У него во дворе имеются два дойных коров, молоко которых используется для нужд семьи. Абдусаттор обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести пару голов молодых бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Он верит и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Abdusattor is a resident of the J.Rumy district.  He is a middle-aged man; he is already over 30.  Abdusattor is a construction specialist.  He is married and has children.  His wife stays home and earns a living by sewing from home.  At the present time, Abdusattor was left without a work order and decided to start a business that will bring him a stable income.  He is planning to start reselling cattle.  He has two dairy cows in his yard, whose milk is used for family's consumption.  Abdusattor requested this loan to buy a pair of young bulls for fattening up and resale.  He believes in and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of young bulls for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy regional fruits, etc.

loans.name: Angel Humberto

texts.es:
Angel Humberto tiene 49 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus hijos en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y pecuarias.

Angel Humberto se dedica  a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, ranger, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las enfermedades de los cultivos. El sueño es mejorar en el negocio. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia y jugar boly.
texts.en:
Angel Humberto is 49 years old and has a partner. He lives with his partner and his children in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the “30 de Julio” communal bank, which is located in the rural town of Zapotal Nuevo, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas, where people work in agriculture and livestock.

Angel Humberto works in agriculture. He is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, Ranger herbicide, urea, manure, and liquid herbicide. He buys and sells products in the town of Ventanas. 

He faces challenges such as diseases in his crops. His dream is to improve his business. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his family and play volley ball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for planting rice.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is engaged in the farming business which serves as her family's main source of income. Mary Grace is 27 years old and married with one child. She aims to have a plentiful harvest this next crop season to satisfy the necessities of her family but she has insufficient capital.Thus,she is seeking  a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. She wishes to grow better crops through using this loan amount so she can further improve her living conditions and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and insecticides used for farming

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his drug shop, which operates in clinics and sells drugs. 

To help expand the business, Vincent has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs for his pharmacy, and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and enable him to meet his customers' demand. Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his existing pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs for the pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, propane gas, oil, fresh cheese and other ingredients.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, es madre de dos hijas de 12 y 16 años de edad, es casada, con el afán de contribuir con los gastos de su hogar instalo una tienda en su casa de habitación, en la que ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad a sus clientes, además vende antojitos (enchiladas, tostadas, yuca, etc.), sus actividades inician de 6:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., para ella no representa ninguna dificultad dicho negocio.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar pan, golosinas, bebidas, huevos, aceite, yuca, plátanos, maíz,  etc., lo que le servirá para mejorar la calidad y diversidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, espera aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio y mejorar la economía familiar.
Aspira a mejorar sus ingresos para ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, educación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Teresa is the mother of two daughters aged 12 and 16. With the urge to contribute to the household expenses she started a store in her house where she offers a variety of basic basket items to her customers. She also sells snacks like enchiladas, tostadas and yucca. She starts her work at 6 am and continues until 4 pm. For her the business is not difficult to operate. 

Teresa will use the loan to buy bread, sweets, eggs, oil, yucca, plantains, corn, etc. which will serve to improve the quality and variety of goods that she offers to her clients. She hopes to increase her profits and improve the family's finances. With more income she could give her family better food, education, health and clothing.

loans.use: to buy bread, sweets, drinks, oil, yucca, plantains, corn, etc.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is single and has one child. She started an electronic mobile loading business in her village almost two years ago. With her sister's financial help,  Arcelie has been able to build up her variety store and now is selling a variety of goods and rice in their village.

Arcelie is now aiming for the continuous growth of her business to sustain her family's needs. To realize her dreams, Arcelie is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy rice, drinks, breads and canned goods. She hopes that, through her requested loan, she can satisfy her customers' demand so that she can encourage more customers to buy her goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, drinks, breads and canned goods for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 21-year-old single man who has worked as a baker for two years. He has a bakery which he established in 2012, specialized in baking traditional Lebanese breakfast bread, Manakish (a folded dough with several different toppings to serve different customers' choices).

Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials that will increase his production and develop his business.

He is very anxious about this loan, hoping that through its additional income he'll be capable of developing his bakery and expanding his working zone.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials that will increase his production

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 30-year-old married father of one child. He has been painting houses for the past nine years. In 2007, Kassem established his own business and it is going well, especially after he improved it with a previously requested loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy newly released tools and new colors and types of paint.

Today Kasem'ss acquired YOUTH loan will be invested for the same reason and he will also buy a bedroom for his child. He hopes that his business keeps on developing to make sure that he can provide his family with the necessary living standards and the best education, for a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy newly released tools and new colors and types of paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a married man. He has one child who is 10 years old. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail shop where he sells basins, small water tanks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. 

Lawrence describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of basins, water tanks and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open more stores. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: buy more stock of basins, water tanks and other items

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala District of Uganda. She is married and has two children who do not currently attend school. For the past four years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which deals in chicken and eggs. 

To help expand the business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase feed, trays and more chicks, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and increase her income. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business further.

loans.use: to purchase feed, trays and more chicks

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 46-year-old married father of five children. He has been working in his grocery store since 1996. His business is going on just fine, and it is his family's only source for living; that's why he works hard to develop it as much as he can to attract new customers and reply to their different needs.

Khalil is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to expand his business merchandise with newly released special offer products that will attract new customers  and provide him with specially priced products.

He hopes that with his increase in income he can provide his family with a better living and make sure that his beloved children will have the best education he can provide.

loans.use: to expand his business merchandise with newly released special offer products

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 29-year-old married woman who has 6 children. She describes herself as determined. For the past 3 years, Jane has operated a retail shop where she sells groceries. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all kinds. Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be that some products are perishable. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other groceries. Her business goal is to own a grocery shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will economically sustain her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other groceries

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 50-year-old married woman who has four children. She describes herself as dynamic. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are middle class. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. This will enable her increase milk production. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria Isabel tiene 44 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo de 23 años de edad vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Victoria Isabel  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas mensualmente. 

El desafio al que se enfrenta son las plagas y la sequedad en los cultivos. El sueño es tener mejor calidad de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer quehaceres domésticos y caminar.
texts.en:
Victoria Isabel is 44 years old. She is single and has a 23 year old son. She lives with her son in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the 30 DE JULIO communal bank, located in the community of Zapotal Nuevo, in the Ventanas canton. The locals work in agriculture. 

Victoria Isabel works in agriculture, growing rice and corn. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea, manure and liquid weedkiller. She buys and sells her products in the city of Ventanas every month. 

She faces challenges such as pests and drought with the crops. Her dream is to have a better quality of life. In her free time, she likes to do housework and go walking.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as manure, fertilizers and urea.

loans.name: Hrant

texts.en:
Hrant is a taxi driver with 11 years of experience. He lives with his wife and 18-year-old daughter in Yerevan. The family isn't big but there are many costs to cover; therefore, Hrant works day and night to be able to sustain his family's living. As the only breadwinner in the family, Hrant feels very responsible for gathering a good income for his family. He drives a taxi using his own car and, unfortunately, because of overloaded work, the car is in not in working condition. 

Hrant has requested this loan to be able to repair the vehicle and continue his taxi driving business. Hrant has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Hrant as he will be able to continue his business and gather income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en:
John Baptist is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance, having borrowed four times from the same institution. He is a tea farmer in Nyakazinga –Mashonga in Kyamuhunga and he has done this work since 2008 when he started the business. He started the business with a purpose of having a steady source of income which his family would rely on for a living. 

John Baptist's clients are mainly tea traders in the same area and sometimes factories in the same locality. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings for buying fertilizers so that the fertility of the soils can be boosted and he can harvest much more. 

John Baptist is challenged by the competition from other farmers but he hopes that that will no longer be a challenge if he boosts the fertility of the soils, using the loan money, since his harvests will be high then.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Erick Joel

texts.es:
Erick, es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 1 y 2 años de edad, como un padre responsable es el encargado de proveer a su familia de los recursos necesarios para que tangan una vida sin alguna necesidad, para tener ingresos se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y pipían, lo aprendió de su padre, su horario es de 6:00 a.m.  hasta las 2:00 p.m., es apoyado por su esposa,.
Invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas y pagara el arrendamiento del terreno en el que realiza su siembra, espera tener una mejor producción y una cosecha libre de plagas, para tener que sus clientes queden satisfechos, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ganancias.
Aspira a mantenerse trabajando para tener los ingresos necesarios para cumplir con los diferentes compromisos económicos.
texts.en:
Erick is married and lives with his wife and two children aged 1 and 2 years old. As a responsible father in charge of providing for his family so that they don't go without, he grows basic grains and pipian (a squash). He learned this from his father. He works from 6 am until 2 pm. His wife helps him. 

The loan Erick is requesting is to buy agricultural inputs and pay the rent on the land where he plants. He hopes to have higher production and a crop free of infestation to keep his clients satisfied, increase his sales and make more profit. He hopes to continue working to be able to have the income to pay his various financial obligations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay the rent on the land he grows on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more brooms to expand her business.

loans.name: Ulukoy

texts.en:
Ulukoy was born in 1958. She is a smart and industrious woman. Ulukoy is married and has 4 children. She always works hard for the well being of her children. 

Ulukoy always wanted to give higher education to her children. Her son Khurshed is a student at the Medical University in Russia. He studies at the second course. He will be a therapist after graduating from the university. Ulukoy must to pay for her son’s education but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2550 USD to pay for tuition of her son at the Medical University. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education.

loans.name: Wernedes Adan

texts.es:
Wernedes, es casado tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la carpintería, sus labores inician de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., es un oficio que aprendió de su padre ya tiene 20 años realizándolo. Para obtener ingresos extras también se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar como batería de cocinas y planchas. Por el momento no ha tenido dificultades para realizar dicha actividad.
Comprará madera, lijas, barniz, clavos y pegamento, para tener los materiales necesarios para entregar a tiempo los pedidos pendientes, espera tener buenas ganancias con las cuales cancelara la deuda adquirida y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
Sueña con fortalecer su negocio para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
Wernedes is married and has two children.

He earns a living as a carpenter, starting at 7 a.m. and working until 4 p.m.  He learned the trade from his father and has been in this line of work for 20 years.  To earn extra income he also sells household articles such as pot-and-pan sets and irons.  Thus far he hasn't had any problems in this job.

Wernedes is going to buy wood, sandpaper, varnish, nails, and glue to have the materials he needs to fulfill his pending requests on time.  He hopes to earn good profits to pay back his debt and improve his family's lifestyle.

He dreams of strengthening his business so he can improve his finances.

loans.use: to buy wood, sandpaper, varnish, nails, and glue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, pepper, oil, Maggi cubes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Obed Adin

texts.es:
Obed, tiene 24 años, es casado, su esposa tiene 24 años, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, Se dedica a la peluquería desde hace 8 años, es un oficio que aprendió de su primo, pero lo hace de manera independiente, su horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m.
Invertirá en la compra productos para el cabello y muebles para la peluquería, de esa manera podrá dar un buen servicio y ofrecerá a sus clientes algunos productos para el cuidado del cabello, espera mejorar el inventario del negocio y con ello tener mejores ganancias.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y con una rentabilidad mayor para dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: Obed is 24 years old and is married. His wife is also 24 years old. They have a 3 year old daughter. He has worked cutting hair for the last 8 years. This is work he learned from a cousin, but he does it independently. His business is open from 7 am until 8 pm. He will invest the loan buying hair products and furniture for his shop. In this way he can provide good service and offer his clients some products to care for their hair. He hopes to increase his stock in his business and through that get more profit. His dream is to have a larger business with greater profit so that he can provide his family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy hair products and furniture for his hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Lucinda Maria

texts.es: Lucinda está muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibió de Kiva, ya que con el préstamo anterior,  logró comprar insumos con los cuales elaboró un mayor volumen de comidas  rápidas y compró refrescos  al por mayor y de contado, pues contó con mucha mayor liquidez, para comprar e impulsar su producción y ventas. Ella envía un mensaje de agradecimiento a los financiadores de Kiva por el apoyo recibido y espera acceder a un nuevo crédito, pues planea comprar artículos escolares,pues este tambien es un negocio de temporada y materias primas con las cuales elaborará nuevamente productos alimenticios, aprovechando que es la época de ventas  alta en productos educativos y tambien para vender las comidas rápidas, e impactar las ventas de esta unidad de negocios, haciendo de sus credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Lucinda is very grateful for the support that she has received from her previous loan with Kiva. She was able to purchase supplies that allowed her to produce a higher volume of fast food and to purchase soft drinks in bulk that allowed her to increase her output and sales. She sent a thank-you message to Kiva lenders for their support and hopes to receive a new loan so that she can plan to buy school supplies for her seasonal business and primary materials, with which she will once again source food products. She can take advantage of the high season for sales for school supplies and fast food, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and primary materials

loans.name: Elba Judith

texts.es:
Elba tiene 45 años de edad es soltera, vive con los familiares en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar.

Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla gruesa, abono, urea, insecticidas, herbicidas.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertir en los fertilizantes y poder progresar. El sueño es comprarse un terreno.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades y el mal clima.
En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con la familia.
texts.en:
Elba is 45 years old, she is single, and she lives with relatives in the Chimbo Canton, within the province of Bolívar. 

She works in agriculture, growing corn.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase seed in bulk, fertilizers, urea, insecticides, and herbicides.

With the help of the loan she will be able to invest in fertilizers, and make progress.  Her dream is to purchase a piece of land, and the challenges that she faces are diseases and bad weather.

In her free time she likes to get together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, soap, pepper, onion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Claudia Elvia

texts.es:
Claudia es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Tengo 27 años, soy casada desde hace tres y tengo tres hijos; dos estudian la primera y un bebé. Superación y tenacidad son palabras que me describen. El crédito que solicito es para acondicionar un local y poder rentarlo. Como auxiliar educativa sé la importancia del estudio, por esto mis logros han sido superarme academicamente, mis retos, terminar mi casa y poder titularme.
texts.en:
Claudia is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

"I am 27 years old and have been married for three years. I have three children, two of whom are in elementary school and the other one is still a baby. A desire to improve and tenacity are words that I would use to describe myself.

The loan I am requesting will be used to remodel a space that I can rent out. As a teaching assistant, I know the importance of studying. For this reason, my achievements have been to succeed academically. My challenges include finishing my house and obtaining my degree."

loans.use: to remodel a space that can be rented out.

loans.name: Maria Alondra

texts.es:
Maria es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Mi nombre es María, soy una guerrera,  tengo 47 años, soy casada desde hace 23 años, mi esposo se llama Mario  y tiene un negocio muy rentable de  venta de jugos y licuados en el mercado, es dueño del local. Tengo 4 hijos de 12, 14, 21 y 22 años, todos dependen de nosotros. Me dedico a atender una estética desde hace 20 años y desde hace 3 inicie con la venta de ropa. Pido este préstamo para mejorar mi vivienda, en específico construir más cuartos y acondicionarlos.  Soy una persona puntual y responsable en mis pagos y cuento con el apoyo económico  de mi esposo. Mis logros son la construcción de mi casa y la educación de mis hijos, mi mayor reto es que concluyan sus estudios y  que obtengan más oportunidades de las que yo he  soñado.
texts.en:
Maria is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

My name is Maria. I'm a warrior, am 47 years old, and I have been married for 23 years. My husband's name is Mario, and he has a very profitable business selling juices and smoothies on the market. He is the owner. I have 4 children aged 12, 14, 21 and 22, all dependent on us. I am dedicated to serving aesthetics for 20 years and for 3 years have been selling clothes. I seek a loan to improve my home, specifically building new rooms in my house. I am a punctual and responsible person in my payments, and I count on the financial support of my husband. My accomplishments are building my house and the education of my children, and my biggest challenge is to complete their studies and obtain more opportunities than I dreamed.

loans.use: to add on more rooms to her home

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: At Cupcake Stiletto, culinary meets fashion. The journey began while Alicia was a student at the New York University School of Law living in the West Village where she fell in love with fashion.  During her study breaks, she would purchase her favorite sweet, a vanilla cupcake, and walk the streets of SoHo.  During her walk, she was captivated by how people transcended fashion trends by inserting their own personal styles.  Each person's style expressed a different voice.   After graduating from NYU Law, Alicia worked as a Corporate Securities Associate for a Top 100 law firm. When Alici's schedule allowed, she would do what she loved to do so much in law school, take strolls in the city, eating my favorite vanilla cupcake, and shop for my other favorite, shoes. On one of these occasions, she had an “Ah-Ha” moment: "Why can’t a girl buy two of her favorite things-cupcakes and shoes-from one place at the same time?" A sweet idea was born, Cupcake Stiletto. Inspired by Alicia's lifelong passion for baking taught by her father and her love for fashion, indie designers and shoes, she created the concept of a ‘Shoecakery,’ a retail establishment that sells cupcakes and shoes.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of a kiosk at the local mall

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора уроженка городка Турсунзаде. Она замужем. Ей 21 год. У нее среднее специальная образование, она зубной врач. Уже 5 лет она работает дантистом. Ей нравится ее работа. Нигора хочет для стоматологии приобрести оборудование. Но достаточной суммы денег у нее нет. По этой причине она простит Вас помочь ей купить оборудование для стоматологии. Помогите ей.
texts.en: Nigora was  born in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is married. She is 21 years old. She has finished a technical college and works as a dentist.
