She has been working as a dentist for 16 years. She enjoys her work. Nigora would like to buy dental equipment for her office, but lacks the necessary funds. This is why she is asking you for help in buying dental equipment. Please help her out.

loans.use: to buy dental equipment.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   DANAYA est constitué de  4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de SINSI qui est la 2ème femme debout  dans la photo de la  droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 9000 kg de mil  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of four married women. On the average, they are 38 years old, with five children. They live in traditional extended families in Massablacoura, a neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. They know each other as neighbors and friends as well as through their work. 
They have been collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to  bolster their financing capacity and better manage their businesses and are now on their 5th loan. The four prior loans have been duly reimbursed. The group members sell cereals, which is the case of Sinsi, for example. She is second one standing from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 9000 kg [approx 20,000 lbs] of millet from Bougouni wholesalers. She sells at the market and out of her come, retail, for cash and in credit, to a mixed clientele.  
She plans to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 West African francs, one part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest, and the other part for her savings.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
Juan, opta por otro préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de tijeras, maquina de cortar pelo, espejo, papelería, tintas, para equipar la peluquería y el ciber.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar la imagen de la peluquería y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, su economía es más estable y su familia se encuentra muy bien de salud.
texts.en:
Juan has opted for another loan to invest in the purchase of scissors, hair clippers, a mirror, stationery, and dyes to equip the salon and cyber café.

The previous loan helped him to improve the salon’s image and provide good service to his customers. His finances are more stable and his family is in good health.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, hair clippers, a mirror, stationery, and dyes.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma was born in 1972 and she has three children. She married when she was 19 years old. She separated from her husband at 27 and began contending with difficulties in her life. She began to try to continue her life and stand on her own two feet, with self-confidence, and she was successful. 

Now, Fatma is 42 and she earns her living selling for a chain store. She also sells children's clothing to her friends. She's assembled a great circle of friends. 

With the loan from Maya, Fatma will have pre-funding. Her sales will rise. In the future, her dream is to expand her business with these small loans and an entrepreneur loan. 

Asked if she wants to add anything, Fatma says, "I have succeeded, and you can, too."

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fatma Hanım 1972 doğumlu 3 çocuk annesi bir bayan.  19 yaşında evlenmiş.  27 yaşında eşinden ayrılmış ve hayatın zorluklarıyla mücadele etmeye başlamış.  Özgüveni olmayan bir bayan olarak hayatına devam etmeye ve ayaklarının üstün de durmaya çalışmış ve başarmış.  Şu anda 42 yaşında ve satış zinciri olan bir firmada sağladığı siparişlerle geçimini sağlıyor.  Aynı zamanda çocuk giyimleri satıyor.  Günlere ve arkadaş çevresine satış yapıyor.  İnanılmaz bir şekilde çevreye sahip oldu.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile önsermayeye sahip oldu. Satışlarını artırıcak.  İlerleyen zamanlar da hayali ise küçük kredilerle girişimci kredisi alıp işini büyütmek.  Fatma Hanım son olarak ise ben başardım sizde başarabilrsiniz diye ekledi.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 39-year-old, married mother of two children. She has worked as a hairdresser for the last 17 years. Her long and wide experience in this domain provided her with a special reputation in her region. 

Nawal is employed in a beauty salon, but she is working hard to start her own business, which she always dreamed about. But, since she has a lack of finances, she is taking small steps forward to achieve her goals.

Today, Nawal is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy the necessary tools and machines that will help her to establish her own beauty salon and develop her living conditions.

Nawal will work hard to buy all the necessary items that will complete the establishment of her business. In the near future, she will start saving money for renting the suitable place to start-up her own business.

Nawal hopes that this step forward won't take a lot of time and she's anxious to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools and machines that will help her to establish her own beauty salon.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar cerdos y pagar la recolección de la cosecha, para fortalecer el negocio y acortar el tiempo de entrega de sus productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a cultivar sin ningún problema, teniendo como resultado una cosecha libre de plagas y de mejor calidad, su economía es mucho más estable.
texts.en:
Héctor has made the decision to take out a new loan, in order to buy pigs and pay for the gathering of the harvest. This is in order to build up his business and shorten the time for delivering his crops. 

The previous loan helped him to farm without any problem, resulting in a harvest free of pests and of better quality. His finances are much more stable.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pay for the gathering of the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning to resell.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, se dispone a adquirir más mercadería para la tienda que posee e insumos para elaborar la comida que vende, comprara carnes, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, pan, y otros productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior mejoro el inventario de la tienda lo que le dio clientes más satisfechos, ventas mayores e ingresos mejores, los cuales ha utilizado para cancelar las cuotas y mejorar la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dora is about to acquire more merchandise for the store that she owns, as well as supplies for preparing dishes that she sells. She will buy meat, vegetables, basic grains, beverages, snack foods, bread, and other products that she offers to her customers.

Her previous loan allowed her to improve the inventory in her store, which resulted in more satisfied customers. As a result, her sales and earnings improved. This enabled her to make her payments and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, basic grains, beverages, snack foods, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Petra Del Rocio

texts.es:
Petra del Rocio tiene 45 años de edad es soltera vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC 30 DE JULIO, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Petra del Rocio  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras de los productos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

Enfrenta desafíos cómo la lancha que caen en los cultivos. El sueño es tener éxito en el trabajo. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Petra del Rocio is 45 years old, single, and lives with her son in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the July 30th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Zapotal Nuevo in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farm workers.

Petra del Rocio is a farmer who grows rice and corn. She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer. Petra will purchase these products in the city of Ventanas.

The challenges she must face include dealing with fungi that could infect her crops. Her dream is to be successful in her work. In her free time, Petra enjoys going for walks with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, se decidió por otro crédito; ya que con el crédito anterior pudo tener los recursos necesarios para dar un buen tratamiento al cultivo y tener una cosecha de buena calidad, además la facilidad de pago le ayudo a invertir las ganancias en el pago de sus cuotas y muebles para el hogar.
En está ocasión lo utilizara en la compra de insumos agrícolas y pago de arrendamiento del terreno en el que cultiva.
texts.en:
Yonis decided upon another loan.  This is because with the previous loan he was able to have the necessary resources to give a good treatment to his crops and to have a good quality harvest.  Also, the ease of payment helped him to invest the profits in making his payments and in furniture for his household.

This time he will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the rent on the land that he cultivates.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the rent on the land that he cultivates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laminated zinc sheeting, purlins, and paint.

loans.name: Marly Elcira

texts.es:
Marly Elcira tiene 36 años de edad es soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto Zapotal Nuevo, pertenece al cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Marly Elcira  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas mensuaalmente. 

El sueño es tener éxito en la vida y más ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia con la familia.
texts.en:
Marly Elcira, age 36, is single and has three children.  She lives in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the 30 de Julio communal bank.  It is in the Zapotal Nuevo precinct in the Ventanas canton.  The people there are farmers.

Marly Elcira is a farmer, and she grows rice and corn.  She is requesting the loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid herbicide.  She makes her purchases and sells her products monthly in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to be successful in life and to have more income.  In her free time she likes to go to church with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maximiliano Guillermo

texts.es:
Maximiliano, está solicitando nuevamente capital para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el alquiler de las parcelas en las que realiza sus cultivos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a contar los insumos necesarios para preparar el terreno para la siembra, a pesar que la producción no fue muy abundante logro obtener los recursos necesarios  para cancelar la deuda y continuar mejorando el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is again requesting a loan, so that he can buy agricultural supplies and pay for the rent on the parcels of land where he grows his crops.

The previous loan helped him to have the supplies he needed to prepare the land for planting. In spite of the fact that production was not very abundant, he managed to obtain the necessary income to pay off the debt and continue improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and pay for the rent on his parcels of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough cosmetics to increase her sales.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 44 years old and a motorcycle operator. He has been in the transportation business for almost 20 years. 

He earns 300 PHP that is usually used for their daily needs. However, he is doing his best to produce a higher income. 

Now, Eduardo is requesting 7,000 PHP to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. The remaining money will be used to purchase motorcycle accessories.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Abelio Audelio

texts.es:
Abelio, es una persona que se dedica a la albañilería y es motorista de moto taxi, son oficios que ha aprendido por cuenta propia para sacar a delante  a su familia, él es acompañado, tiene un hijo.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar repuestos de la moto taxi y cancelar un artículo del hogar, será de gran ayuda para ofrecer un servicio más seguro y de calidad a sus clientes, con lo que seguirá trabajando sin problema alguno para continuar cubriendo los gastos familiares.
Aspira con construir su propia casa, para dar ofrecer un patrimonio mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Abelio is a person who works in construction and is also a mototaxi operator. These are occupations that he has learned on his own, in order to help his family get ahead in life. He has a partner and one child. 

He will use the loan to buy parts for his mototaxi and pay for a household item. It will be a great help, enabling him to provide quality and safer service to his customers. This way he can continue working without any problems and covering the household expenses. 

His ambition is to build his own home, in order to provide a more tangible asset for his family.

loans.use: To buy parts for his mototaxi and pay for a household item.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is single, 61 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years.

Flora has requested a loan to pay for the harvesting and threshing of 150 bags of rice. She has been a member of the group for four years. 

In the future, Flora hopes to be able to support the everyday financial needs of her family and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting and threshing of 150 bags of rice

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pollos y alimento para los mismos, así como también láminas para mejorar la infraestructura del hogar.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio para mejorar su economía y cumplir con las necesidades de su familia. Hoy cuenta con un apequeña granja la que le da ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Wilberto is requesting a new loan in order to buy chickens and feed for his birds. In addition, he will buy laminate sheets for improving the infrastructure of his home.

His previous investment helped to strengthen his business and improve his financial situation. As a result, he was able to meet his family needs. Today he has a small farm that generates extra income.

loans.use: to buy chickens, poultry feed, and laminate sheets for home improvements.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala north region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. 

For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his metal workshop which deals in welding metals. 

To help expand the business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more welding machinery and metals. This will help Joseph to generate greater profits and to build rental houses. 

Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to buy plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more welding machinery and metals

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. 

For the past four years, Billy has been working hard to manage his phone accessories store which sells all types of phones and accessories. 

To help expand the business, Billy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of phones. This will help Billy to generate greater profits and open up another branch of his phone business. 

Billy hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another piece of land.

loans.use: to buy different types of phones

loans.name: Flor Carlota

texts.es:
Flor Carlota tiene 41 años edad estado civil unión libre, vive con los hijos y su esposo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas. 

Flor Carlota se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá ser mas productiva.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas, lancha en los cultivos. El sueño es tener una buena cosecha. en el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Flor Carlota is 41 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives with her husband and her children in the city of Ventanas, in Los Rios province. She is a member of the "30 de Julio" communal bank located in Zapotal Nuevo, which is part of Ventanas canton. The members of the group are farmers.

Flor Carlota is a farmer and grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies, fertilizers, manures and liquid herbicide.

She makes her purchases and sells her crops in the city of Ventanas. This loan will help her to be more productive. She is facing challenges such as pests and crop diseases. Her dream is to have a good harvest. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: To buy crop fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, necesita un  nuevo préstamo para pagar mozos que están picando zacate para alimentar el ganado en época de verano.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el negocio, actualmente con los nuevos ingresos ella cuenta con más ganado, ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente y mejorado su estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
María needs a new loan in order to pay laborers who are picking zacate (a grass used as cattle feed), for feeding the cattle over the summer. The previous loan helped her to build up her business, and now with the new income, she has more cattle.  

She has made her installment payments on time, and is improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To pay laborers.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Vanadzor town. He does construction work and has 10 years of experience. Armen lives together with his mother, wife, and two school-age children. 

As the only breadwinner in the family, Armen works hard. He receives different orders from local people in Vanadzor town and provides both internal and external renovation of houses. 

Armen currently requests this loan in order to be able to purchase construction materials needed for his work. The only hope for him to complete current orders is this loan. Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Armen and he hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for materials for providing construction services

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is 42 years old, married and a housewife. She is married to Nalini, who is 56 years old.  Both are uneducated.  They live in their own small kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made) in East Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  They are blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  All are students. One is in college and the other two are in grade 12 and grade 7.

Jayanti's husband is associated with an agribusiness.  He is the only source of income for the family. His earnings are too low to cover all the needs of the family, especially the educational expenses of their children.

Their daughter Suparna is a very bright girl who is very sincere, studious and hardworking.  She reads in grade 7 and wants to be a teacher in the future and with that aim, she studies hard. As they are facing a financial hardship, Jayanti could not provide a private tutor to help her daughter in her studies.  Moreover her school fees are not paid on time.

Jayanti has taken a loan from BJS for her daughter's schooling expenses. She plans to use the loan to purchase Suparna's textbooks, pens and other study materials and pay her school fees and private tuition fees. Jayanti, though illiterate, is very much interested in educating her children and making  them good citizens.

Jayanti and her daughter (standing beside Jayanti in the picture) both convey their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and pay school fees and private tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the range of things she sells.

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Чурабек проживает в районе Дж.Руми со своей семьей. Ему 35 лет. У него среднее образование. Он зарабатывает на жизнь работая таксистом. Его работа приносит ему незначительный доход и не покрывают семейные расходы. Он решил параллельно начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства, а именно заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Чурабек для реализации цели просит кредит на сумму 2500 долларов США и планирует приобрести 4 голов крупнорогатого скота. На сумму своего сбережения он закупит корм для скота. Чурабеку этот кредит очень важен для открытия бизнеса и улучшения финансового положения семьи.
texts.en: Jurabek lives in the J. Rumy region together with his family. He is 35 years old. He has finished secondary school. He makes a living by working as a taxi driver. His work brings only a modest income which is insufficient to support his household. As an additional business, he decided to also raise livestock, more specifically to buy and resell cattle. Jurabek is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 USD to implement his goal. He plans to buy for heads of cattle. He will use his savings to buy cattle feed. This loan is very important for Jurabek as it will allow him to launch a new business and improve his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to buy four heads of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food containers, plates and cups to expand her business.

loans.name: Jashoda

texts.en:
Jashoda is 46 years old and lives in a remote village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married, a housewife and illiterate. She can sign only her name. Her husband Dinesh is a 50-year-old uneducated farmer.  Together they are raising only one son who is getting an education and reads in grade 12.

Jashoda's husband has been engaged in agricultural activities for many years. His earnings are hardly sufficient to cover the needs of the family as the prices of essential things are increasing gradually. So it is impossible for him to bear the educational expenses of their son.

Their son Sushanta is now studying in grade 12 and is very much serious about his studies. He will appear for his Higher Secondary Examination next year (state board examination).

Jashoda learned about BJS and applied for a loan from them for her son's uninterrupted education.  With the loan, she will pay the private tuition fees, and school fees and buy necessary articles like books, notebooks, a geometry box, uniforms and other educational supplies for her son.

Jashoda and her son, Sushanta, (in the picture) are very much happy and grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them the loan, which will help Sushanta to reach to his goal.

loans.use: To purchase study materials and pay school fees and tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María,  se siente satisfecha con el crecimiento que ha tenido el negocio de productos de loza, el crédito anterior le facilito aumentar su inventario con la materia prima que en su momento necesitaba para trabajar y cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, hoy en día su economía ha mejorado, ha cancelado sus deudas y su familia se  encuentra en perfecta condiciones, siempre brindándole su apoyo para salir adelante.
Como la demanda de sus productos es mayor solicita un  nuevo crédito para comprar nacazcol, leña y arcilla, entre otros materiales para dar un  acabado final de calidad a sus productos y seguir cumpliendo con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is satisfied with the growth of her business selling clay products. The previous loan enabled her to increase the inventory of raw material she needed at the time for her work, in order to fill customer orders. Now her finances have improved, she has paid her debts, and in her family is doing very well, always offering her the support she needs to succeed.

As the demand for her product is greater, she is requesting a new loan in order to buy nacazcol (a black dye), firewood and clay, as well as other materials needed to give a quality finish to her products and continue meeting the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy nacazcol (a black dye), firewood and clay.

loans.name: Adom Group

texts.en:
This group was created after ID-Ghana, Dansoman branch was inaugurated. The members maintain good relations among themselves. 

Monica, who is the featured borrower, is 44 years old, single, and the mother of two children (one girl and one boy). In addition to her business, she raises fowls. 

With her loan, she is going to purchase some merchandise: GHS 2,000 of second hand clothing and 4 fowls at GHS 1,000. With the profits, she is going to start her housing project and to ensure her children are supported.

Her colleagues will also use their share of the loan to purchase merchandise like foodstuff, materials, bags and wigs. They will need a total amount of GHS 7,700 to stock their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase second hand clothing and 4 fowls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Noong Luong 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. La, a 45-year-old Thai woman, is the team leader of Noong Luong 3 Group (In the picture, she is the one with blue shirt standing first from right). 

She lives with her husband in an old stilt house. Because of difficulties in life, she was not able to send her first child to college, so he joined the army. She's tried to make it up for the younger one by working hard to earn money to pay tuition fees for him. Formerly, besides cultivating rice, vegetables and rasing chickens, she collected firewood for sale. Presently, she not only expands her agriculture activities by breeding fish, pigs, but also works in a  restaurant and a store. However, she's facing difficulties because she lacks water for living and irrigation. She also encounters capital deficiencies, but because her family is no longer considered as a poor household, she doesn't get much support from the government. 

She wants a loan from ACE to buy food for fish and hope that through this loan as well as ACE training lessons, she could improve her income and have the ability to pay tuition fees for her child and rebuild the house.

loans.use: to buy food for fish.

loans.name: Maria Haidee

texts.es:
María, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar más capital para aumentar su producción pues necesita ingresos extras para comprar materia prima para los tamales y útiles escolares, con lo que podrá trabajar y tener mejores ganancias, cancelar las deudas y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, pues están iniciando su año escolar.
Con el crédito anterior María fortaleció el negocio, sus ventas aumentaron, su economía es más favorable, su núcleo familiar se mantiene y su familia cuenta con mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
María needs to request more capital to increase her production. She needs extra income to purchase raw materials for tamales, and school supplies . With these items, she will be able to work and improve her income, cancel her debts, and support her children in their studies since the school year is beginning.

With her previous loan, María strengthened her business. Her sales increased, her financial situation is better, she supported her immediate family, and her family has a better way of life.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for tamales, and school supplies.

loans.name: Fatima Julissa

texts.es:
Fátima, solicita capital para comprar maíz, harina, entre otros ingredientes necesarios para su venta de pan y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Con la inversión anterior tuvo lo necesario para dar un mejor servicio, mejorar la imagen del negocio y tener clientes nuevos. Su economía poco a poco va mejorando lo que le ha permitido cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas y dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is requesting a loan to use as working capital for buying corn, flour and other necessary ingredients for her bread-making business and to provide better service to her customers. 

With the earlier investment she had what she needed to give better service, to improve her business's appearance, and to have new customers. Little by little her finances are improving, which has allowed her to make her installment payments on time, and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corn, flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava, palm nut, potatoes and plantains to expand the range of sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr lives in Yerevan town with his mother and his 22-year-old sister. He is a young jeweler who prepares different accessories from gold, silver, and other semiprecious stones. He is enthusiastic and hardworking and that helps him to earn a good income for his family. Aleksandr has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials for polishing jewelry accessories. This is very important for Aleksandr, as the tools will give him an opportunity to receive more orders from his clients and earn more income.

Aleksandr has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist this hardworking young jeweler and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for polishing jewelry accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, cassava and sugarcane for her business.

loans.name: Paradise Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Paradise. They are originally from Dansoman, located in the coastal region of Ghana. They are known for being responsible, hard working and with a strong drive towards personal development. Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources they couldn't go far in formal education. They felt obligated from a very young age to help with household expenses.

Joyce is the group representative, who is 36 years old. She has run a business selling slippers for 12 years now. She spends 12 hours daily at her business selling her products. Her business is located in her house. The aim for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business which is buying and selling slippers so that in the near future she can gain a better income.

Afia and Hilda sell second hand clothing and wigs respectively.

loans.use: To buy slippers.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a forty-year-old business man who trades in pigs and also prepares pork which he sells at a profit. He started the business in 2003 with a purpose of earning income which he hopes to use to educate his five children who are all in school currently. He works one day in a week (Saturday) on the pork business which is located in Kabagaleme and he says he gets good profits from the business since there are many people who go there to buy the pork. 

In addition to the pork business, Vincent also does a transport business where he uses his motorcycle to transport people from one place to another at a relatively small fee and this boosts his incomes greatly. He would like to use the loan money of one million five hundred thousand shillings(1,500,000) to buy pigs for slaughtering on Saturdays so that he can make improved sales and hence earn more profits. 

His clients are people who visit the rural market on Saturdays and he believes that if he gets more money he will get more customers and hence the business will expand. Inadequate capital is the main challenge he has but with the UGAFODE loan, he believes it will be a challenge no more

loans.use: To buy pigs for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning, to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Andrea Del Pilar

texts.es:
Ella es Andrea Del Pilar  tiene 19 años vive con los padres y hermanas. Ellos son una familia muy humilde, es una joven muy  estudiosa y trabajadora, lo hace  para poder ayudar en la casa y  el estudio para ser alguien con un mejor futuro ya que la madre es cabeza de hogar, Ya que el padre padece de una enfermedad hace más de 20 años la cual le ha afectado la vista, los oídos, los riñones, por lo cual no puede trabajar. 
El es un Hombre muy tranquilo que no se deprime al ver que el entorno no es muy alentador a causa de las  enfermedades que tiene.
La madre se entero de la institución campo alto y  decidió apoyarla en la carrera que quiso emprender que es AUXILIAR DE SALUD ORAL, ingresa a segundo semestre de esta. 
Espera concluir  la carrera con muchos éxitos para triunfar y ejercer la profesión, para ella seria de mucha ayuda el convenio con kiva ya que la mama es la que cubre con todos los gastos y si tiene el convenio con kiva, las mensualidades quedarían con un valor más económico.
texts.en:
This is Andrea Del Pilar. She is 19 years old and lives with her parents and sisters. They are a very modest family. Andrea is a very studious and hardworking young woman. She helps around the house and is studying so that she can have a better future. Her mother is the head of household since her father has lived with a condition for the past 20 years that affects his vision and hearing. His kidneys are also not functioning. Her father is a peaceful man who remains upbeat since he does not want to create a depressing environment as a result of his illnesses.

Andrea’s mother told her about CampoAlto and supported her decision to enroll in the Dental Assistant Program. She is in her second semester.

Andrea hopes to complete the program successfully so that she can pursue and excel in her profession. Seeking assistance from Kiva will be a great help since her mother takes care of all of the expenses. If she were to receive a Kiva loan, her monthly tuition payments would be easier to handle financially.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Fulobala

texts.en:
Fulobala is a 32-year-old housewife who lives with her husband in a small town of Maynaguri in their own house. Her husband is a van puller. She is illiterate and just able to sign her name, while her husband is totally illiterate. They have one son who is in class IV (grade 4).

Her husband’s earning is very small, and it is difficult to maintain the family.  Fulobala came to know about BJS and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods in their locality. A cycle van is a type of carriage using a bicycle. Now her husband is using the van and earns more than previously.  

Their future dream is to buy more cycle vans, which will be used on a hired basis so that they can overcome all the financial hurdles and can also improve their financial status.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle van for carrying goods and people in her local area.

loans.name: Amparo Evelyn

texts.es:
Amparo Evelyn tiene 22 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la vrc 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en recinto zapotal nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Amparo Evelyn  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de ventanas mensualmente. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá ser más productivo.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas. El sueño es tener una buena cosecha. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Amparo Evelyn is 22 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents in the city of Ventanas, which is in the Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the "30 de Julio" (30th of July) communal bank, which is in the Zapotal Nuevo province in the Ventanas canton. Residents of this area work in agriculture.

Amparo Evelyn works in agriculture and grows corn and rice. She requests this loan to purchase supplies like fertilizer, urea, manure, and herbicide. She sells and purchases products monthly in the city of Ventanas. With the help of this loan, she will be able to be more productive.

She faces challenges like pests. Her dream is to have a good harvest. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to grow rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, biscuits and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu and palm nut for her business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 25-year-old woman who lives in her own kaccha house (made of straw and mud) and supplies firewood to the village market. Her husband has a poultry farm and sells meat and eggs of chickens to the local market. She is blessed with three children. Two of them are receiving education, and the youngest one is too small to go to school.

Her husband’s income is hardly enough to run the family. It is impossible for him to meet all the needs of the family, as the prices of essential commodities are growing. She learned that BJS (Kiva’s partner) gives loans to rural women, and so she applied for a loan to purchase firewood. 

She is a very energetic and optimistic woman. She has chosen this business, as she can get enough supplies of wood in their village. Moreover, there is less risk in this business. She hopes to earn a great profit from this business, as firewood is used as fuel in rural areas, and she can get a good price in her locality. 

She also hopes that the living standard of her family will definitely be improved, and it will add value to her business and the future education of her son.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for providing her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality firewood for selling in the local market.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is from a rural village, Bamantari, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 43 years old and educated up to grade 9. She is a housewife. Her husband Dhirendra, aged 60 years, is engaged in agriculture. He studied up to grade 10. They have two sons who are engaged in a small business. They have a small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).

Namita's husband has been associated with agricultural activities for many years. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells them in the local market. He is very hardworking and tenuous. He works from dawn to dusk on his farmland.  Namita also helps in his work, after managing her household work. But his earnings are hardly enough to cover the household expenses for their family.  

Namita has decided to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase saplings of betel leaf for cultivation. Betel leaf is locally known as pan (a kind of leaf which is used as a mouth freshener, especially in rural areas in India). They have chosen this business as betel leaf is widely used in their area.

Namita plans to utilize the profit for the betterment of their lifestyle and to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase saplings of betel leaf for cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, oil, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman; she has four children. She describes herself as honest. 

Grace operates a retail store where she sells tomatoes, bananas, mangos, cabbages and other items. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a convenient place, and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, bananas, mangos, cabbages and other items. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, bananas, mangos, cabbages and other items

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet, who lives in Vanadzor with his wife and two children, owns a small garage where he provides an auto washing service to locals. The sole provider for his family, Hamlet has applied for this loan to renovate his garage and purchase new equipment for it. The loan will be a big support for this young businessman and will help him to provide better service to his clients. 

Hamlet has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Hamlet waits for lenders' support and hopes for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his auto washing garage and new equipment for it

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María una mujer de 48 años de edad, está casada desde hace  ya 25 años, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios sin embargo culmino sus estudias primaros con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.  Por  la situación económica que no fue buena tuvo que trabajar para ser apoyo a su esposo, tiene tres hijos menores de 18 años , viven en la ciudad de Latacunga  ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador, en un departamento junto a su esposo e hijos desde hace 1 año.
María es una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su hogar, ha trabajado desde muy joven en la agricultura, ella está muy preocupada por  ser un apoyo para su esposo y ayudar en la economía de su hogar es por eso que está solicitando un crédito para la ampliación de unas chancheras y comprar más cerdos lo cual servirá para  mejorar su estilo de vida. 
María agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and has been married for 25 years. Due to lack of financial resources she was unable to finish her education, but she did complete primary school with a lot of effort and dedication. Because of her financial situation, which was not good, she had to work to help her husband out.  She has three children under 18 years old. For the past year she has been living in an apartment with her husband and children in the city of Latacunga which is located in the Province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador.

Maria is a very enterprising and hard-working woman who is very dedicated to her home.  Since she was young she has worked in agriculture and is very concerned about being a support to her husband and helping with the household finances. That is why she is asking for a loan to expand the pigpens and buy more pigs.  This will allow them to improve their lifestyle. Maria thanks Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in her working and personal life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and expand the pigpens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is a married woman. She is 24 years old and has an education up to grade 8. Her husband, Ranjit, aged 30 years, attended school up to grade 8. They have three children (one son and two daughters). Two of them are receiving education (in grade 4 and grade 1). The third one is below school-going age. They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made) in the small village, Patkidaha, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Shyamali's husband is a mason by profession. For more than ten years, he has been involved in this profession. But of late, he has had to face competitors, because of which his income is not as much as expected by him, and is not sufficient to cover all the needs of their family.  

Shyamali is also a very energetic, hardworking and optimistic woman. She wants to overcome the financial hurdles. She runs an animal husbandry.  At present, there are one milk cow and two goats. She works hard there, after managing her household work. She sells milk in her locality, yet they are unable to give the family a decent lifestyle.

Shyamali wants to expand her business to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. She heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase a dairy cow. She wants to start a dairy products business. One more cow means more milk, thus more profit. 

Her plans are to make dairy products from the milk, such as butter, cheese, paneer, etc., and to sell the products in the local market with the help of her husband. She hopes this business will help her to generate additional income, as the products are in great demand in the market. The profit will help her to improve her living conditions, and she can give her children proper education.

In the future, she aspires to purchase more cows to expand her business. She and her husband give their full thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a dairy products business.

loans.name: Muattar

texts.en: Muattar is a young woman with great new ideas. She is a very smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. She has been busy with sewing for more than 2 years. Muattar learned to sew national women's dresses from her teacher. Muattar has her own customers. She wants to offer a high quality service. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine and embroidery machine to increase her working capital. She awaits your support and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine and embroidery machine for increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Jacquelinne Antonieta

texts.es:
Jacqueline, es una persona de familia, vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos, es soltera, como una forma de tener ingresos para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares y cubrir sus gastos personales emprendió por iniciativa propia la venta de medicina natural, es un actividad que no representa ningún riesgo para ella y hasta la fecha lo ha administrado muy bien.
Con el crédito ella comprara variedad de medicina natural tales como, tés, vitaminas, laxantes, ungüentos, reconstituyentes, etc., con lo que pondrá a la disposición de sus clientes más productos de calidad y a un buen precio, espera mejorar sus ingresos para continuar apoyando a sus padres y cumplir con sus responsabilidades.
Sueña con tener un negocio más grande y más rentable para salir a delante con su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a family person who lives with her parents, has no children, and is single. At her own initiative she decided to begin selling natural medicines so that she could earn some income to contribute to household expenses and cover her personal expenses. This activity represents no risk to her, and up to now she has managed it very well. 

With the loan she will buy a variety of natural medicines such as teas, vitamins, laxatives, ointments, restoratives, etc. and will provide her clients with quality products at good prices. She hopes to increase her income and continue to support her parents and fulfill her responsibilities. She dreams of having a larger and more profitable business to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baby cream, baby oil and baby clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 42-year-old businesswoman dealing in secondhand clothes, a business she has done since 2004. She is a widow and a mother of four children, aged 22, 20, 18, and 13, all of whom are in school. 

The secondhand clothes business is her sole source of income. She works four days a week and twelve hours per day. The business is located in a rural area in Ward 11 - Mitooma sub-county. 

She hopes to use the loan of two million shillings only to buy bales of clothes, which she will sell at a profit. Local people and traders are her main clients. She hopes to serve them with a variety of clothes if she gets the loan, and she has hopes that this will increase her profits, which will help her to educate her children. 

Lack of enough capital is what challenges her most, but she hopes that it will cease to be a challenge if the loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 49-year-old married woman. Six years ago she started selling beverages to support her husband who is a pastor and his income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone. Now she has a good number of customers and earns enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

Rebecca wants to grow her business so she requested a loan amount of GHS 2700 to buy biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future

loans.use: To buy biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: God's Hand Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called 'God's Hand'.  The group is made up of three women, all of whom are married, and who on average are 30 years old and have two children. They live in traditional families in the Dansoman neighborhood in the city of Accra. They know one another through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better run their businesses, they joined ID-Ghana, a micro finance institution, with whom they are on their eighth loan. The previous two loans were repaid back properly. This group of women sells wigs, rice and groceries. 

Beauty is the wig-selling young lady who will use her loan to buy GHS 3,000 worth of wigs to sell to her customers. 

She will buy from the wholesalers in Accra. She makes her sales in a container close to her house. 

She plans to make a very big profit from this loan cycle, which will be reinvested in the businesses and used to repay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy wigs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 40-year-old housewife. She is from a remote village, Masterpara, in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She received education up to grade 8. Her husband, Ajoy, aged 44 years, has an education of primary standard. They are blessed with two daughters who are in college.

Gita's husband is associated with a business of making clay idols (idols of gods and goddesses made of clay). He has been associated with this business for the last ten years. It is the main source of income for the family. Since it is a seasonal business, it is very difficult for him to run the family with his small income. They lack the capital to invest in the expansion of the existing business.

Gita heard about BJS and has taken a loan to help her husband. She plans to purchase more clay, colors, brushes and other necessary things to expand their business.

She hopes that this will give them additional profit to overcome the financial hurdles that they are facing at present. The profit from the business will help them to give their children proper education, and also helps her to go ahead with their business.

They are grateful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase more clay, colors and brushes for her existing clay idols-making business.

loans.name: Pilu

texts.en:
Pilu is a 34-year-old woman from a remote village in Moynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She studied up to grade 7.  Due to poor financial conditions, her parents could not provide her further education.  After marriage to Amol, aged 41 years, she is now a homemaker and looks after her children and husband.  She has three school-going children (two sons and one daughter).  They are in grade 8, 5 and 1 respectively. They have a small kachha house  (made of straw, bamboo and mud).

Pilu's husband is associated with a small business. Pilu raises livestock. She started one year ago, with the purchase of one cow. The monthly income from the sale of milk is very little. In spite of all these efforts, they are unable to give financial sustenance to their family. Now, they want to grow their business, but they lack capital.

Pilu has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS, which she wants to use to purchase a cow.  She wants to start a milk products business selling milk, butter, paneer (fresh cheese), curd, etc.  She will sell the products in the local market in order to generate more profit. She plans to invest the loan income in further increasing her business and intends to purchase more livestock for her business.

She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Mamusu from Jui Eastern area in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. 

In 2003, Mamusu established her retail business. She began her business because she did not go to school, so she was trained in business. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil and general stock for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Masusu plans to open a big store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a twenty eight year old farmer in Kyeibanga –Kitagata in Sheema district. He has practiced farming since 2004 with the hope of getting income to provide for his family and pay school fees for his siblings and the other two dependants he has in his home. He works seven days in a week and six hours per day. Emmanuel also has a  hardware shop in Kashenshero, which is attended to by a different person and the shop gives him additional income. He would like to use the money to buy mulche for the farm using the two million five hundred thousand shillings so that he can have better yields. His clients are mainly coffee traders in the area and he hopes to serve them better if the loan is granted. Emmanuel is mainly challenged by competition from other farmers, but he hopes to give good quality coffee to the trader so that he can out compete the other farmers.

loans.use: To buy mulche

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax, cotton and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a greater stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, biscuits and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Sonia Matilde

texts.es:
La Señora. Sonia está realizando su primer crédito en el grupo Pauteñitas, vive en el cantón de Paute, lugar que goza de un clima templado y tierras fértiles donde se cosechan las más hermosas flores y una gran variedad de frutas, su gente es amable y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Sonia tiene 31 años de edad, está casada en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 11 y 4 años que estudian en una escuelita del cantón, su esposo labora como carpintero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Sonia desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, esta actividad la realiza en todo momento que se le presente la oportunidad, también aprendió de sus padres la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar cosméticos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is taking out her first loan with the Communal Bank “Pauteñitas”. She lives in the canton of Paute, a place that experiences a mild climate and has fertile land for growing the most beautiful flowers and a wide variety of fruits. The people are friendly and hardworking. They have also been able to maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Sonia is 31 years old, married, and has two children (ages 11 and 4) who attend a school in the canton. Her husband works as a carpenter. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

For the past two years, Doña Sonia has been selling cosmetics. She always engages in her business whenever an opportunity presents itself. In addition, her parents taught her how to make Panama hats. The money from this loan will be used to buy cosmetics. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón ha sido caficultor desde hace 35 años y esta en el proceso de conversión de café convencional a café orgánico, Simón ya tiene un gran avance en la transición con recursos propios y el apoyo de su familia, pero necesita un  préstamo de $5.600.000 para sembrar 1.000 arboles mas de café y fortalecer la finca orgánica integral, Simón quiere implementar otros cultivos como el aguacate, cría de ganado vacuno y otras especies menores para mejorar la alimentación de su familia y producir abonos orgánicos. A nivel familiar le gustaría poder terminar sus estudios y continuar apoyando a sus 3 hijas en sus estudios superiores.

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Simon ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La FCC están convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Simón has been a coffee grower for 35 years and is in the process of converting conventional coffee to organic coffee. Simon already has great progress in the transition with his own resources and support of his family, but he needs a loan of 5,600,000 pesos to plant 1,000 more coffee trees and strengthen the comprehensive organic farm. Simon wants to implement other crops like avocado, raise calves and other small species and continue supporting his 3 daughters in their higher studies. 

The conversion and production of organic coffee is a whole long-term process; independent, healthy, balanced and friendly to the environment. This represents a challenge by the rural farmers of Colombia and Simón has decided not to risk his health, that of his family, nor that of the consumers by continuing to use chemicals. The Federación Campesina del Cauca is convinced that it's worth it to support and strengthen these alternative initiatives. A loan with with Kiva represents a sustainable future for his production, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to produce organic coffee.

loans.name: Jose Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes es un productor orgánico certificado en FCC, el ha sido caficultor desde hace 23 años, es un joven emprendedor comprometido con la agricultura orgánica, es un productor modelo por su consistencia en el proceso orgánico y compromiso con la agricultura limpia. Hermes quiere mejorar la calidad y aumentar la producción del café mediante una inversión en el  mejoramiento del beneficiadero seco de café para mejorar la calidad y aumentar su producción con la siembra de 2.000 arboles mas, esta inversión le costara $5.600.000. Hermes sueña con terminar sus estudios secundarios y estudiar un carrera relacionada con la producción orgánica de café y otros cultivos para ampliar y tecnificar sus conocimientos sobre agricultura orgánica, también le gustaría construir una vivienda digna.

La conversión y producción de café orgánico es un proceso integral al largo plazo independiente, saludable, balanceado y amigable con el medio ambiente lo que representa un desafío para los campesinos de Colombia y Hermes ha decidido no arriesgar su salud; la de su familia ni la de los consumidores, al seguir usando químicos. La FCC están convencida que vale la pena apoyar y fortalecer estas iniciativas alternas. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su producción, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Hermes is an organic coffee producer certified by FCC [see explanation below].  He has been growing coffee for 23 years.  He is a young entrepreneur who is committed to organic farming.  He is a model producers of organic coffee because of his consistency in the organic process and his commitment to clean farming.

Hermes wants to improve the quality and increase his coffee production.  He wants to do this through an investment to improve the dry processing of the coffee in order to improve the quality and increase his production by planting 2,000 more trees.  This investment will cost 5,600,000 COP.  Hermes dreams of completing his secondary education and studying a field related to the production of organic coffee and other crops.  He wants to do this to increase and modernize his knowledge about organic farming.  He would also like to build a decent house.

The conversion and production of organic coffee is an integral process that in the long term is independent, healthy, balanced, and friendly to the environment.  This is a challenge for the farmers in Colombia. 

Hermes has decided not to risk his health, that of his family, nor that of the consumers by continuing to use chemicals.  The FCC is convinced that it is worthwhile to support and strengthen these alternative initiatives.  A Kiva loan represents a sustainable future for his production, his land, and his family.

loans.use: to improve the organic production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 51-year-old married woman. Eight years ago she started operating as food vendor (chop bar) where she sells local dishes like 'fufu' (pounded cassava and plantain together) soup, rice and stew, and cooked plantain and stew to support her husband since his income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. Rebecca wants to grow her business so she requested a loan amount of GHS 2000 to buy vegetables, cassava, plantain and kontomere (nutritious leaf), to cook them to meet the increasing demand at her customers. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future

loans.use: To buy vegetables, cassava, plantain and kontomere (nutritious leaf), and cook them to meet the increasing demand at her customers.

loans.name: Sara Pilar

texts.es:
Sara Pilar tiene 53 años de edad es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, vive en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC 30 de julio, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Zapotal Nuevo, pertenece al cantón ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas.

Sara Pilar  se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos, líquido mata monte.

Las compras y las ventas de los productos las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

Enfrenta desafíos cómo las plagas en los cultivos. El sueño es tener más ingresos para cambiar el estilo de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear.
texts.en:
Sara Pilar is 53 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the July 30th Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of Zapotal Nuevo in the canton of Ventanas. The members are farm workers.

Sara Pilar is a farmer who grows rice and corn. She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer. Her purchases and the sale of her products are conducted in the city of Ventanas. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy supplies. Sara faces challenges, such as dealing with pests that affect her crops.

Her dream is to have more income so that she can improve her lifestyle. In her free time, Sara Pilar enjoys going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers, urea, compost, and liquid weed killer.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un nuevo crédito para realizar la comprará de lociones, cepillos para ropa, baterías, calzado, cremas, etc., con ello tendrá una variedad de productos para que sus clientes se mantengan satisfechos y fieles a su negocio, espera mejorar los ingresos para salir a delante.
Con la inversión anterior Juan pudo tener una variedad de productos a la disposición de sus clientes, o que le facilito la aumentar sus ventas, tener mejores ganancias, con las que ha cancelado sus cuotas y mejorado el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan in order to buy lotions, lint brushes, batteries, shoes, crèmes, and other products. This will enable him to have a variety of products in order to keep his customers satisfied so that they will remain loyal to his business. He hopes to improve his earnings so that he can get ahead.

With his previous investment, Juan was able to have a wide variety of products available for his customers. This facilitated an increase in his sales and more income. As a result, he was able to repay his debts and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy lotions, lint brushes, batteries, shoes, crèmes, and other products.

loans.name: Kimiyokhon

texts.en:
Kimiyokhon is widowed. She has four children. Kimiyokhon is the only bread winner of her four children. She has been busy sewing and selling national hats for men, for more than 20 years. She buys raw materials from Uzbekistan. She sews hats at her home, and sells them in a local market. She has her own regular customers. She manages the business successfully, because she has a great experience and knows her field well.

She is going to develop the business and maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni. She will use the loan to buy thread and fabrics, for increasing her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabrics, for making men's hats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a  Kiva borrower. He has one child who is 4 years old. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a big boutique. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a tea farmer in Nyakazinga in Mashonga-Kyamuhunga and he started tea farming in 2004 with a an objective of getting a clear source of income which he would use to cater for his family members. He works six days per week and works eight hours per day. Tea farming is his major source of income and he hopes to expand it so that it gives him enough profits which he would use to pay school fees for his three children who are all in school. He would like to use the money (eight hundred thousand shillings) to buy fertilizers for the tea garden so that he harvests much more thereby out-competing his competitors in the business. His clients are the tea traders in the same region and he hopes to serve them better which will boost his clientele greatly. Moses is very hopeful that he will be financially stable in the near future especially after getting support from UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Wael

texts.en: Wael is a 45-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city. He lives with his wife and four kids; two sons and two daughters. Wael works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He also has a small library and gifts store; it is a good business and helps him in part of the family expenses. Wael took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products; gifts and stationary, for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Wael will be able to increase his sales and also his income. Wael appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products; gifts and stationary, for his store to resell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fraud. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to add M-pesa float ( money for customers to withdraw). Her business goal is to own an agency bank within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will economically sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her business.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float (money) for customers to withdraw.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 
Faten is a 30-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. Her husband has a home appliance store. It is a good business and the only one in his village. Faten and her husband would like to improve the store and buy all the needed products. 
Faten took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy more products for the home appliance store to resell. By taking this loan, the sales will be increased and also the family income.

loans.use: to buy more products for the home appliance store.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo.

Salam is a 45-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother with three sons and one daughter. All of her children are under 18 years old. Salam's husband works selling used things in the city. It is a good business but the income is not stable. 

Salam's husband was wounded due to the unstable political situation few years ago. He needs to do a surgery in his neck. 

Salam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to do an urgent surgery in his neck. By taking this loan, Salam's husband will be able  recover and go back to work.

loans.use: to help her husband to do an urgent surgery in his neck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his cafeteria and add more products and machines to it.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. For the past two years, Ahmad has been working in making and applying gypsum for home decoration. It is a good business. He learned to do this from his previous job. 
 
Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more gypsum templates for his business. Ahamd would like to improve his business. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. 

Ahmad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more gypsum templates for his business.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 27-year-old single lady from Jenin city. She lives with her parents in an old house in the city. Alaa works as an employee in a local firm where she gets a low income. Her father has a store for selling car parts. It is a good business and he earns a good income. 

Alaa would like to help her father to improve his store. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her father to buy more car repair parts to resell. By taking this loan, the store will be improved and so will the family income.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to help her father to buy more car repair parts to resell.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Vanadzor town. He has been providing vehicle repair service for 7 years. He receives orders from locals and provides different types of vehicle repair service for them. Artur rents a small garage in the center of the town. He lives together with his wife and two little children ages 6 and 4 years old. Because of financial difficulties that Artur faces, it is very difficult for him to save money for his business. He has applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools needed for his work.

Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artur to continue providing his business and he will be very grateful for their support.

loans.use: to pay for tools for providing vehicle repair service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Marian    T

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Marian from Tombo Western rural in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. One of her children is currently going to school. At the age of 17 years Marian established her retails business. She began her business because her parents could not afford to educate her so she started the business to bring in income for her family. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the profit she is able to take care of her family.

Marian requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking season to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, Marian plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking season to expand her business.

loans.name: Gloria Soledad

texts.es:
Gloria nació en la ciudad de Latacunga en la parroquia Mulaló de la provincia de Cotoapxi perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, esta zona se caracteriza por sus habitantes que se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores y ganado de leche y de carne. Gloria tiene 23 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra casada, vive solo con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casita propia desde hace ya algunos años.
Ha sido para ellal muy satisfactorio para  el poder ayudar a su esposo  en todos los gastos de la casa y ser un gran apoyo en las actividades del hogar como en el negocio, aprendió desde muy chica esta actividad y desde ahí se dedica a la producción de leche y crianza de animales, pues a pesar de todas las necesidades ha salido adelante y ahora quiere tener sus propios ganados.
Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la primaria y la secundaria, por la difícil situación económica de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeña y así poder ser un gran apoyo para ella y su familia.
Aprendió de esta actividad ya que es muy común en la zona, por ser un sector rural, trabaja de 6 a 8 horas diarias en el cuidado de los animales.
Se le hace un poco difícil el cuidar de sus  animales (pollo) ya que no cuenta con un lugar grande para guardarlos, pero pese a esto no se ha hecho mayor problema, al contrario le ha motivado para salir adelante por el bien de ella y el de su familia.
Por el momento solicita un crédito  para poder realizar los tramites de escrituras de un terreno que adquirió y la compra  una vaca lechera, la misma que servirá para obtener mas rentabilidad utilidad con la venta de la leche.
Gloria y su esposo quieren extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Latacunga in Mulaló parish, Cotopaxi province in the Republic of Ecuador. The people of this area raise and sell both young animals and cattle for meat and milk.
