Благодаря упорному труду Шахадат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 бычок, 1 овца. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Шахадат также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 0,70 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает картофель и морковь для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. С марта по ноябрь месяцы Шахадат продает молочные продукты, такие как: топленое масло, курут, кефир. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шахадат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Шахадат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства в помощь сыну при строительстве дома.
texts.en: Shakhadat is 45 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband.  Their daughter is married and the two older sons work as loaders at a restaurant in Russia and send part of their salary to the parents in Kyrgyzstan, and the youngest son is a school student.  Her husband Abylkasym is a farmer with a lot of experience. Shakhadat has a secondary education.  To provide the primary income for her family, Shakhadat is involved in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 bull and 1 sheep. She has all of the conditions for keeping livestock.  Feed and hay have been stocked up.  Shakhadat also has a small 0.70 hectare land plot, where she annually grows potatoes and carrots for use within the business and sale.  From March through November, Shakhadat sells milk products, such as butter, kurut and kefir.  The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Shakhadat requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount and increase the monthly income from selling milk products. Shakhadat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to help her son build a house.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mairamkul

texts.ru: Майрамкул 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. Сын-школьник, дочери - 4 года.Супруг преподаватель в местной школе. У Майрамкул - высшее образование, работает преподавателем, но к сожалению зарплаты не хватает на содержание семьи, и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Майрамкул занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 7,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамкул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Майрамкул также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 0,90 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает ячмень и картофель для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Майрамкул реализует молоко, и имеет дополнительный доход. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Майрамкул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Майрамкул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en: Mairamkul is 33 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband. The son is a school student and daughter is 4 years old. Her husband is a teacher at a local school. Mairamkul has a higher education and works as a teacher, but unfortunately her salary is not enough to support the family. To provide an additional income for her family, Mairamkul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 9 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows. She has all of the conditions for keeping livestock. Feed and hay have been stocked up. Mairamkul also has a small 0.90 hectare land plot, where she annually grows barley and potatoes for use within the business and sale. Mairamkul sells milk and has an additional income. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Mairamkul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow in order to increase livestock headcount and increase the monthly income from selling milk products. Mairamkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy a family car.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Aygul

texts.ru: Айгуль 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 7 детей. Айгуль и ее супруг многодетные и счастливые родители. Все дети самостоятельные, проживают самостоятельно, самый младший сын живет с родителями и помогает им по хозяйству. Старшая дочь находится на заработках в Турции, помогает родителям материально, часть своей зарплаты высылает родителям в Кыргызстан. Супруг-фермер с большим опытом. У Айгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айгуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Айгуль также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивает многолетние травы для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Айгуль имеет доход от продажи молока. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на установку ворот в доме и ограждения дома.
texts.en: Aygul is 49 years old, married and raising 7 children together with her husband. Aygul and her husband have many children and are happy parents.  All of their children are independent, and the youngest son lives with the parents and helps them with the household.  The oldest daughter is working is Turkey and helps the parents financially by sending part of her salary to the parents in Kyrgyzstan.  Her husband is a farmer with a lot of experience.  Aygul has a secondary education.  To provide the primary income for her family, Aygul is involved in animal husbandry, having started 13 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 1 horse. She has all of the conditions for keeping livestock. Feed and hay have been stocked up. Aygul also has a small 1.0 hectare land plot, where she annually grows perennial herbs for use within the business and sale. Aygul has an additional income from selling milk. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Aygul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount and increase the monthly income from selling milk products. Mairamkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to install gates for the house and fence around the house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Ella se llama Lilian, es una persona  agradable y soñadora, un día soleado , más exactamente un  miércoles soñó entrar a estudiar administración en salud, en CAMPO ALTO lucho mucho para hacer realidad este sueño, pero ella trabajaba toda la semana y el estudio era los sábados, tuvo dificultades, llamados de atención, obstáculos económicos, tanto que tomo un préstamo para poder iniciar clases, pero por fin logro el permiso y la estabilidad económica para ir al instituto que ella había buscado, logro que al fin le otorgaran los días sábados para iniciar con el proyecto de vida, con el estudio que ella tanto había anhelado, pero que por motivos ajenos no había sido posible. Al terminar el semestre paso con muy buenas notas, pero al iniciar el nuevo año,  Lilian se encuentra sin trabajo, pero decide seguir cambiando la vida ya que este nuevo aprendizaje le genero nuevas oportunidades profesionales y existe la opción de renacer y emprender un nuevo sueño al lado de las personas que ama, en días anteriores Lilian decide por todos los medios conseguir lo de la cuota inicial con un nuevo descuento, sin contar con las demás cuotas decide iniciar ya que no va a dejar pasar la oportunidad de iniciar como independiente y crear una nueva oportunidad de servicios y calidad de vida para los usuarios y para sí misma. Sin trabajo y aun sin dinero decide ir CAMPO ALTO y matricularse, con este convenio de Kiva le quedaría mejor y sería posible iniciar porque lo que se ahorra en la cuota es tomado para los pasajes ya que vive un poco retirada, la  expectativa futura consiste en seguir estudiando para emprender el proyecto de la vida al lado de la pareja el cual tiene muy buenos conocimientos, y  lo más importante, ser Exitosa y futura Administradora en salud. 
Muchas gracias por la oportunidad, necesita el convenio porque espera hacer este gran sueño realidad. y requiere por favor proveer y aportar esta gran meta, como persona para crecer profesionalmente, y lo más importante para ofrecer calidad de vida y satisfacción del gran aprendizaje, sembrando en cada uno por medio de clases.
texts.en:
This is Lilian, a pleasant individual who is a dreamer. One sunny day, which was on a Wednesday to be exact, she enrolled in the Health Administration program at CampoAlto with great determination to make her dream a reality. Lilian worked all week and studying would have to take place on Saturdays. She was also experiencing difficulties, receiving words of caution, and overcoming financial obstacles. Lilian applied for a loan so that she could begin her classes. Once she was approved, she was able to achieve the financial stability required to attend the institute of her choice. She was able to make her Saturdays available so that she could embark on this phase of her life and pursue the field that she wanted to study. Reasons beyond her control had prevented this from happening in the past. Lilian finished the semester with very good grades.

At the beginning of the following year, Lilian became unemployed. However, she decided to continue down this new path in her life and start an apprenticeship that would provide new professional opportunities and give her the chance to reinvent herself. She could pursue a new dream with the support of the people she loves. Days before, Lilian decided to do whatever it took to get her initial payment reduced. Not taking into account her other fees, she did not want to pass up the opportunity to become independent and create new opportunities to serve others and improve the quality of life for them as well as herself.

Unemployed and without any money, she decided to enroll at CampoAlto with the help of a Kiva loan. This would make it possible for her to start the semester with a reduced payment, which means she would only have to withdraw a small amount of her own funds. Going forward, Lilian expects to continue her studies and embark on this phase of her life alongside her partner. She hopes to gain a great deal of knowledge and, most importantly, become a successful health administrator in the future.

Lilian is extremely grateful for this opportunity. She needs this loan because she hopes to make this great dream a reality. Lilian asks for assistance and support as she pursues this great goal of becoming a person who can grow professionally. Most importantly, she hopes to achieve a better quality of life and the great satisfaction of learning through each of her classes.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Rosa Guillermina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa esta realizando su segundo crédito en el grupo de crédito La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de montañas gracias a su geografía accidentada, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con bellos lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, es cuna de grandes artistas, escritores y deportistas, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Rosa tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 6 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, está muy emocionada ya que se encuentra embarazada de 2 meses, su esposo labora como mecánico, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Rosa labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo en la venta de granos cocinados, este empezando con este negocio ya que lleva recién 3 meses y poco a poco va tenido clientela. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de granos para continuar con el negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is requesting her second loan through the communal bank La Paz.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is surrounded by mountains and was declared a World Heritage Site in December, 1999.  It has beautiful places to visit and to enjoy nature.  It is also the birthplace of great artists, writers and athletes.  The local people are kind and gentle and maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

Rosa, 24, is married and has a six-year-old daughter who goes to the little school in the city.  She is very excited about the fact that she is two months pregnant.  Her husband is a mechanic and they live in a rented home.

Rosa works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She sells cooked grain and has been in business for only three months, little by little attracting customers.  The loan will be used to buy grain to continue with her business.  Her goal is to have her own home one day.

loans.use: To buy grain.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de montañas gracias a su geografía accidentada, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con bellos lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, es cuna de grandes artistas, escritores y deportistas, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta ambulante de varios artículos como ropa interior, lasos, vinchas para el cabello y más productos, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su casa también se dedica a la crianza de animales, estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de ser una mujer con solvencia económica a la vez que tiene tiempo para dedicarle a sus hijos y ofrecerles un mejor futuro.
 Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa interior y otros productos. Esta solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior y vinchas para continuar creciendo en este negocio. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad y compañerismo, también porque en cada reunión sale de su rutina y comparte gratos momentos con sus amigas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank La Paz.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is surrounded by mountains and was declared a World Heritage Site in December, 1999. It has beautiful places to visit and to enjoy nature. It is also the birthplace of great artists, writers and athletes. The local people are kind and gentle and maintain the culture and traditions of the villages. 

Rosa, 50, is a single mother and has three adult children, two of whom are married and live independently.  Her single son works and helps out economically.  She owns her home.

Rosa works as a street vendor selling various items such as underwear, hair accessories and other products.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  At home she also raises animals.  Both businesses allow her to have her own income and have time to take care of her children and offer them a better future.

She used the previous loan to buy underwear and other products.  The new loan will be used to buy underwear and hair accessories so she can continue expanding her business.  She likes her communal bank group because of the solidarity and fellowship, and also because each meeting is about sharing special moments with friends and getting away from her routine.

loans.use: To buy underwear and hair accessories.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2007.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture et le petit commerce.

Coumba qui est à l'extrême droite de la photo,est la responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 46 ans,elle est veuve et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité est la production et la vente de céréales tels que le mil et le maïs.

Avec le prêt,elle compte acheter des semences pour une valeur de 100000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was set up in June 2007 and is made up of members who live in the same village. They practise farming and run small trading businesses.

Coumba who is on the far right of the photo is the leader of the group. She is a 46-year old widow who is mother to seven children.

She grows and sells cereals such as millet and corn, and with this loan she is planning to buy 100,000 francs worth of cereals.

Her aim is to increase her savings and provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Don Julian de 54 años de edad, agricultor, casado, con 7 hijos quienes tres de ellos de sexo masculino y 4 de sexo femenino, dos ya casados y de los 5 que viven con el 1 es estudiante, vive en Sololá cultivando y cosechando verduras como cebolla, papa y maíz para luego venderlos en el mercado de su pueblo, lleva realizando esta actividad desde hace 35 años la cual fue el trabajo que le enseño su padre para sostener a su familia, y sigue haciéndolo ya que es la primer fuente de ingresos económicos para toda su familia donde lo ayudan sus hijos e hijas, por tal razón se ve en la necesidad de seguir cultivando este tipo de verduras ya que próximos a entrar en otra temporada del año donde la cosecha es de mayor calidad y rentabilidad, donde el solicita un préstamo de   Q 2,200.00 para comprar semillas de papa y cebolla así como demás insumos agrícolas que el necesita, el quiere seguir apoyando a su único hijo que sigue estudiando y su mayo sueño es verlo graduarse de una carrera académica
texts.en:
Julian, 54, is a farmer who is married and has seven children, three sons and four daughters.  Two of them are married and of the five still at home one is in school.  Julian lives in Sololá where he grows vegetables such as onions, potatoes and corn which he sells at the village market.  He has been in business for 35 years and was taught the trade by his father so he could support his family.  Farming continues to be the main source of income for the entire family since his children help in the business.  

It is the time of year when another planting season, yielding a better harvest and more profitability, is about to begin; and Julian must continue cultivating this type of vegetables.  He is requesting a loan of 2,200 GTQ to buy potato and onion seeds and the necessary farm supplies.  He wants to continue supporting his son who is studying since his greatest desire is to see him graduate with a university degree.

loans.use: To buy potato and onion seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 30 años, madre de familia, bachiller, soñadora, trabajadora, pero también  con bajos ingresos, ella  quiere darle  a los hijos estabilidad económica, es consciente que para lograrlo debe capacitarse para ser más competitiva en el campo laboral, y de esta manera mejorar los ingresos y la calidad de vida de la familia.
Por este motivo quiere estudiar en un lugar de buena calidad, reconocido y con garantías, en la búsqueda de este lugar, encontró un instituto donde no solo están respaldados por el Ministerio de Educación Nacional, sino que también  piensan en la mejor manera para ayudar a las personas que tienen ganas de estudiar pero que desafortunadamente no cuentan con los recursos económicos suficientes para hacerlo, LA INSTITUCIÓN DE EDUCACIÓN SUPERIOR LAS MERCEDES.
Sandra va a iniciar en esta institución la carrera y el sueño de ser profesional en el área de TÉCNICO PROFESIONAL EN CONTABILIDAD FINANCIERA, ella  sueña con encontrar en esta institución, el respaldo que anhela para que el nivel profesional mejore y de esta manera tener una mejor fuente de ingreso para dar a los hijos una casa propia, estudios universitarios y todo lo que una madre quiere dar a los hijos como respaldo para que los sueños se hagan realidad.
Sandra a mediano plazo sueña con ser profesional, tener la casa propia, crecer laboralmente, dentro de la empresa donde en el momento trabaja, tener un moto para que se amas fácil movilizarse en la ciudad. 
Gracias a Dios existen lugares como LA INSTITUCIÓN DE EDUCACIÓN SUPERIOR LAS MERCEDES, y KIVA  ya que gracias a este gran equipo Sandra puede iniciar el camino a hacer realidad el sueño.
texts.en:
Sandra is 30 years old. She is a mother, a high school graduate, a dreamer, hard-working, but also has a low income. She wants to give her children economic stability, and she is conscious that to achieve this she must train to be more competitive in the job market. This will mean she can increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.

For this reason she wants to study at a good quality institution, recognized and with guarantees. In searching for a place, she found an institution which is not only supported by the Colombian Ministry of National Education, but also considers the best way to help people who want to study but unfortunately do not have the financial means to do so - The Las Mercedes Institution of Higher Education.

Sandra is going to start her career at this institution and her dream of being a professional as a Technical Professional in Financial Accounting. At the institution she dreams of finding the support she needs to improve her professional level, and so in this way she will have a better source of income so that they can have their own house, she can send her children to study at university and everything else a mother wants to give her children to support them and help their dreams come true.

In the medium term Sandra's dream is to become a professional, have their own house, develop professionally in the company she is currently working for, and to have a motorbike so that she can get around the city easier.

Thanks to God that places exist like the Las Mercedes Institution of Higher Educatio and Kiva, since thanks to this great team Sandra can start on her path to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to pay her registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis mai 2010.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture.

Soda qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 50 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité est l'agriculture.En outre elle pratique aussi l'élevage.

Elle compte acheter 200 kg d'arachide à 250f le kg et une brebis pour une valeur de 25000f.

Avec son bénéfice,elle compte subvenir aux besoins de la famille,de renforcer son activité et d'aider son fils qui est en classe de terminale.
texts.en:
This group was set up in May 2010 and is made up of members who live in the same village. They all practise farming. 

Soda, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 50 years old, married and mother to five children.

She practises farming and also raises animals. She is planning on buying 200kg of groundnuts at 250 francs a kilo as well as a sheep for 25,000 francs.

With her profits she plans to provide for her family's needs, to boost her business and to help her son who is his last year at school.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds.

loans.name: Mame Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis novembre 2012.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Coumba qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.

Elle a comme activité le commerce de poissons fumés,d'un bidon de 20 litres d'huile de palme et 05kg de poissons "yett"

Ainsi elle compte acheter 50000f de poissons fumés,un bidon de 20 litres d'huile de palme à 20000f et 05 kg de poissons"yett" pour une valeur de 5000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was set up in November 2012 and is made up of members who live in the same district. They all have trading activities.

Coumba, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is married and mother to four children.

Her main activity is selling smoked fish and she is planning to buy 50,000 francs worth of smoked fish as well as a 20 liter container of palm oil for 20,000 francs and five kilos of "yett" fish for 5,000 francs.

Her aim is to increase her savings and to be able to provide for her needs.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Coiffeur Chretien Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est une commerçante et membre d’une association d’affaires « Coiffeur Chrétien »,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 28 ans et mère de 2 enfants, qui  sont encore gamins. Elle est vendeuse  des articles divers et sociétaire d’une alimentation dans le centre ville. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son ancien employeur. Son conjoint est un coiffeur. Elle va acheter 20 litres huiles, 1carton de jus, 1 carton de lotion,1 sac de sucre, 10 boites de lait, 1 sac de farine formant, les allumettes, 1 carton de savons, un sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits et d’autres produits cosmétiques. Dans l’avenir, Elle souhaite accroitre ses business, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux hommes et femmes  entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The customer, Furaha, is a trader and a member of the "Coiffeur Chrétiené ("Christian hairdresser") business association. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, who is 28 years old and mother to two children who are still very young. She sells a variety of products and is a shareholder/member of a grocery store in the centre of town. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She began this business from funds she got from her former employer. Her husband is a hairdresser. She is going to buy 20 liters of oils, a carton of juice, a carton of lotion, a sack of sugar, ten boxes of milk, a sack of wheatflour, matches, a carton of soaps, candies, biscuits and other cosmetic products. In the future she would like to expand her business, as well as to educate and feed her children. She is thus thankful to Hekima for its support for male and female entrepreneurs who do not have access to classic banks.

loans.use: to buy 20 liters of oils, one carton of juice, one carton of lotion, one sack of sugar, 10 boxes of milk, one sack of wheatflour, matches, one carton of soaps, candies, biscuits and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Fama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village,elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.

Fama en position assise sur la droite et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 50 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité consiste à acheter des semences,les stocker pour les utiliser en vue de l'hivernage.
Ainsi,avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des semences de mil pour 25000 f et des graines d'arachide pour 25000f.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille,augmenter son épargne et aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. It's members are women coming from the same village. Their main business is farming.

Fama is responsible for the group. She's the woman sitting towards the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's 50 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.

Her business consists in buying seeds, in order to stock them and use them during the rainy season. Thus, with this loan, she intends to buy millet seeds for XOF 25'000, and peanut seeds for XOF 25'000.

Her goal is to provide for her family's needs, increase her savings, and help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet and peanut seeds

loans.name: Jessica Lorena

texts.es:
Ella es Jessica Lorena una pequeña niña que Siempre soñaba y quería ser una gran enfermera desde el principio. 
Ella jugaba con las compañeras del colegio y ella siempre era la enfermera y las compañeras eran los pacientes, para ella jugar eso era divertido y le encantaba, ella un dia tuvo un caso en la familia, el abuelo se le enfermo y ella le decía tranquilo abuelo yo te voy a sanar por que voy hacer enfermera, El abuelo conmovido le dijo gracias y ella todos los días se la Pasaba angustiada por el abuelo, ella lo quería aliviar rápido pero ella pensó que como al abuelo se lo llevaron al hospital ella empezaría con los estudios para poder ayudar más adelante al abuelo. 

La niña fue creciendo hasta que termino los estudios y decidió estudiar, Aux de enfermería, ella quería cumplir las metas que desde pequeña soñaba y así ella empezó a estudiar enfermería, pero ella siendo enfermera podrá curar a los familiares pero no solo tiene que ayudar a la familia, también hay personas que necesitan de ella, otras familias .

Fue pasando el tiempo ella sigue estudiando la enfermería muy juiciosa porque es la carrera que le gusta y la cual quería estudiar y hoy día ejerce.  
Ella también pensaba que en la parte laboral era algo que la podía  ayudar y que iba hacer de gran facilidad conseguir un buen empleo.

Solicita el convenio de KIVA, porque Principalmente le pareció algo muy bueno en cuanto a ella por el pago y que nada más para conseguir la plata es un poco difícil ya que la mama no trabaja y tiene que acudir a los tíos para que le colaboren y lo otro que le falte para pagar la mensualidad le toca a ella misma por medio de trabajos, si sale favorecida le quedara aun mas fácil estudiar y poder pagar.
texts.en:
Jessica Lorena is a small girl who always dreamed about becoming a nurse, and wanted this from the very beginning.

She played with her school friends and she was always the nurse while her school friends were the patients. For her, this game was fun and she enjoyed it. One day she has a case in the family. Her grandfather became ill and she said to him "Don't worry Grandfather, I'm going to make you better because I'm going to be the nurse." Her grandfather, touched, thanked her, and every day she was anxious about him. She wanted to get him better quickly but she thought of how they took her grandfather to hospital and she started her studies to be able to help her grandfather in the future.

The girl grew up until she finished school and decided to continue her studies. As an assistant nurse, she wanted to reach the goals she had dreamed of since she was small and so she started to study nursing. As a nurse she would be able to help her family, but there are also people who need her, other families.

Time passed and she is sensibly continuing to study nursing, because it is the career that she likes and wants to study, and which today she practices. She also thought that it was something that could help her in the job market and that it it would make it easy for her to find a good job.

She is asking for a Kiva loan mainly because the repayments seemed very good for her. Getting money is just a little difficult as her mother doesn't work and she has to turn to her uncles for help. Also, she does not earn enough from her jobs to cover the monthly bills. If she gets this loan it will be even easier for her to study and pay her bills.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Ms. Yamileth is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all of whom are already professional due to the support they received from the husband of Dona Yamileth to finish their studies. As a client with good standing in Fuducion Mujer, Dona Yamileth is dedicated to student transportation and the sale of appliances, as well as other personal items that we ask of her.  She wants this credit so she can purchase merchandise that customers have ordered for this month of love and friendship, as she brings them the orders requested from Golfito. 
She has initiated transportation of students for 15 years, and has three employees who help her manage the three vans that are used for transportation. Trade began to implement it for eight years as the mothers and teachers of the children she transports would wonder where to purchase the clothes and the appliances, and it was here that she began to bring her items to sell, and she has managed to extend her portfolio of clients, all with good pay. 
Fundicion Mujer chose her for ease of paperwork and low interest rate. We want to take on her business to financially support her home and her economic independence.
texts.en:
Ms. Yamileth is 46 years old and married. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are already professional due to the support they received from Yamileth's husband to finish their studies. 

As a client in good standing in Fuducion Mujer, Dona Yamileth is dedicated to student transportation and the sale of appliances, as well as other personal items that we ask of her. She wants this credit so she can purchase merchandise that customers have ordered for this month of love and friendship, as she brings them the orders requested from Golfito. 

Yamileth has initiated transportation of students for 15 years and has three employees who help her manage the three vans that are used for transportation. 

Fundicion Mujer chose her for ease of paperwork and a low interest rate. We want to take on her business to financially support her home and her economic independence.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es:
Ella es Sonia Carolina, nació el 7 de Noviembre, actualmente vive solo con la mama y tiene una hermana la cual ya tiene esposo y vive lejos de ella.
Actualmente estudia cosmetología y estética integral en Campo alto y  entró a tercer semestre de prácticas. Trabaja solo dando clases de aeróbicos en diferentes gimnasios ya que toda la vida ha practicado bastante deporte y esto se le ha facilitado.
El objetivo a corto plazo es poder realizar las prácticas de forma satisfactoria obteniendo así más conocimientos y la experiencia necesaria para poder  culminar los estudios. A mediano plazo desea poder trabajar en el campo de la estética y seguir obteniendo más experiencia para que a largo plazo pueda cumplir el sueño que es crear la propia empresa (spa).
Para ella el estar estudiando estética ha sido muy satisfactorio ya que  ha aprendido muchas cosas que siempre quiso aprender y considera que puede brindarle a ella misma y a la madre un mejor estilo y calidad de vida. 
Así mismo siente que al culminar los estudios se realizará mas como persona y puede obtener un mejor futuro, la mamá se siente orgullosa de ella por poder estudiar y ya casi culminar los estudios. 
Por todo lo anterior ella necesita el convenio de kiva,  porque quiere seguir y poder culminar los estudios, ya que no tiene un trabajo estable, pues el trabajar por horas en lo que hace no es suficiente para  poder colaborar en la casa y pagar los estudios, así que  le seria de bastante ayuda este convenio. 
Cuando Finalice la carrera quiere seguir especializándose en el área ya que hay mucho por aprender, esta es una carrera que constantemente esta en progreso e innovación y quiere ayudarle a muchas personas a mejorar la salud física y sobre todo mental.
texts.en:
This is Sonia Carolina. She was born on November 7. Right now, she lives alone with her mother. She has a sister who has a husband and lives far away.  Right now, she is studying cosmetology and aesthetics in Campo Alto and she started her third semester of training.  She works giving aerobics classes in different gyms because her whole life she has played sports and that facilitated it for her.  

The short term purpose is being able to do her trainings in a satisfactory way, obtaining more knowledge and experience she needs to finish her schooling. In the medium term, she wants to be able to work in the field of aesthetics and keep getting more experience so that in the long term she can make her dream come true, which is opening her own business, a spa. 

For her, studying aesthetics has been very satisfactory because she has learned a lot of things that she always wanted to learn and she thinks that she can offer herself and her mother a better style and quality of life. 

Because of all of this, she needs the Kiva contract. She wants to continue and be able to finish her schooling. She doesn't have a stable job and working the hours she does is not enough to be able to help out in the home and pay for her schooling. That is why the Kiva contract will help a lot. When she finishes her degree she wants to specialize, because there is a lot to learn. This is a major that is always progressing and innovating and she wants to help a lot of people to improve their physical and especially mental health.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's enrollment.

loans.name: Alex Ramiro

texts.es:
Alex tiene 23 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con su madre, Vive en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.
Pertenece a La ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Alex se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace tres años y a la cría de animales. Compra sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos  para la siembra de maíz, como semillas y fertilizantes. El préstamo le ayudado a invertir y mejorar su economía. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida.
Le gusta jugar  futbol.
texts.en:
Alex is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He lives in the San Miguel canton in the Bolivar province. He belongs to the San José de las Orquídeas credit group. It is located in San Pablo, which belongs to the San Miguel canton and is dedicated to farming and ranching activities.  

Alex works in agriculture. He has grown corn and raised animals for three years. He buys his materials in San Miguel and sells his products in the market of the same place. 

The loan he asked for is to buy materials to plant corn, such as seeds and fertilizers. The loan has helped him to invest and improve his finances. His dream is to improve his quality of life. He likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural materials.

loans.name: Angela Maida

texts.es:
Angela tiene 35 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con su hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
 
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Julio que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal Nuevo, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Angela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticidas,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. Las compras realiza en Ventanas.

El sueño es tener un negocio productivo. El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar mucho más. En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
Angela, 35, is single and has a son. She lives in the Ventanas canton, De los Ríos province.

Angela has been a member of this communal bank since July 30th. The bank is located in a village called Zapotal Nuevo, in Ventanas. People there work in agriculture and farming.

Angela works in agriculture; she grows corn. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as compost, instecticides, fertilizers, urea and fungicides. She will buy them in Ventanas.

Her dream is to have a productive business. Her challenge is to work even more. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and a mother of seven children. She and her family live in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life among which are the death of her father, the death of her sister, her husband's job loss. Due to these challenges, there was no way for them to earn a living. They had inadequate finances to start a business of their own or pay for their children's education. They were not even able to provide a square meal for their children.

With the loan requested, Grace will buy fuel wood in trucks. She will also buy flour and oil for the frying of her cakes. Part of the loan will be invested in poultry farming and crop farming. She will also buy feed for her poultry and the rest of the loan will be used to buy medicine for the fowl. 

Grace holds a positive view for her business success because she has been doing this for so long and has much experience in the business. She has customers who buy from her at regular intervals and her business is situated at a good site were the demand for food is high. With this activity, the community will benefit in that fuel wood will always be in supply and the people of the community will not travel long distances to buy necessary items. With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children, expand her business and support her family. GHAPE loans are preferable to her business because the interest rates are low and there are also convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy firewood, flour and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail esta soltera, vive en casa de los padres en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la confeccion de centros de pollera (son faldas interiores que usan las mujeres) los cuales los comercializa en las ferias y en algunos casos elabora a pedido.

El credito que solicita es para la conclusion de una habitacion, la misma que le servira de taller ya que actualmente ella costura en su dormitorio. Necesita comprar estuco, cemento, enchufes.
 
El sueño de Abigail es poder tener su taller y contratar empleados y elaborar en mas cantidad para que en un futuro poder independizarce comprando su propia casa.
texts.en:
Abigail is single She lives in her parents' house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She works making skirt centers (the interior skirts used by women). She sells them in markets and sometimes she makes them to order. 

The loan she is asking for is to finish a room. It will be used as her workshop, since right now she is sewing in her bedroom. She needs to buy plaster, cement and sockets.
 
Abigail's dream is to have her workshop and hire employees and make more so that in the future she can become independent and buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy plaster, cement, and sockets to finish a room she will use as a workshop for her business growing skirt centers.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años de edad estado civil casada vive con el esposo y sus dos hijos, Vive en el  Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Marìa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de animales  desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en San Miguel en Agripac  y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y para comprar animales. El préstamo le ayudado a invertir para mejorar la producción de la siembra y mejorar el estilo de vida. Su sueño es construir su casa.
Le gusta reunirse con su familia y arreglar la casa.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children. She lives in the San Miguel canton, Bolívar province.

She is a member of the communal bank San José de las Orquídeas, located in San Pablo, San Miguel canton. Locals work in agriculture and farming.

María works in agriculture. She has been growing corn and raising different animals for a few years. She buys the supplies in San Miguel, in a store called Agripac, and then she sells them at the local marketplace.

She is requesting a loan to buy compost, urea and liquid fertilizers to grow corn and also to buy some animals. The loan has helped her to invest in her business and improve her production and her quality of life. Her dream is to build a house. She likes to spend time with her family and do the household chores.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 21 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolivar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en el mercado del mismo lugar. 
El crédito solicito para invertir en la agricultura y  comprar fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado a cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rosa is 21 years old and single. She lives with her parents in the San Miguel canton, in the Bolivar province. 

Rosa is a member of the San José de las Orquídeas communal bank, in San Pablo, in the San Miguel canton. Here the people work in farming and raising livestock.

Rosa makes a living in farming and has been sowing corn for some years. She buys her products in San Miguel, and sell her own products in the market there too.

Rosa has applied for this loan in order to invest in her farming work and to buy fertilisers to sow the corn. This loan will help her to change her family's lifestyle. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Rosa likes to play sports

loans.use: to buy fertilisers to grow corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy consumable goods such as rice, sugar, bread, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Miguel Wilfrido

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 70 años de edad estado civil casado,  vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de animales. Compra sus productos en San Pablo en el Comercial Prado y las venden en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado a fomentar la economía. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida.
Le gusta la lectura y viajar con su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 70 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in the San Miguel canton, in the Bolivar province. 

Miguel is a member of the San José de las Orquídeas communal bank, in San Pablo, in the San Miguel canton. Here the people work in farming and raising livestock.

Miguel works in farming, growing corn and raising animals. He buys his products in Prado, in San Pablo and sell his own in the market in the same place.

Miguel has applied for this loan in order to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilisers in order to sow corn. The loan will help him to support his household finances.

Miguel dreams of improving his quality of life. He likes reading and travelling with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers to sow corn.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
She is married with four children, two of whom are below the ages of fifteen. They live in a two bedroom apartment in Bamenda Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to properly manage her business and pay for her children's education, the inability to provide a square meal to her family and also the death of her family members.

With the new loan requested, she will buy food from bush markets such as plantations, potatoes and fruits. She holds a positive outlook for her business success because she has been doing it for a long time and as such has experience in the field. She has customers who buy from her at regular intervals, and her business is situated at a site were the demand for food is high. With this activity, the community will benefit by a reduction in prices, because the community members will not need to travel long distances to buy food.

With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children, provide three square meals to her family, expand her business and support all family developments. GHAPE loans are preferable for her business because the interest rates are low and there are convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy food items such as plantains and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, vita, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is 28-years-old man, who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  He has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. He has a grocery store and it is his main source of income.  He started his business three years ago.  His business was initially started with limited capital and didn't run well enough to make much profit. 

His dream is to see his store flourish.  Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise.  So, he took a loan of 200,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB to stock his business with grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.  In the future, he hopes to be able to get his family ahead and give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to stock his business with grocery products so that his customers will always find what they need .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry-bush-meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Al-Manafl Group

texts.en:
This group of four hard-working women is called Al-Manafl. The members live in Taiz, Yemen. They have applied for a loan in the amount of 280,000 YER from AMB. 

Safia is a 37-year-old married woman living with her family in a poor area in Taiz. She exhibits good moral values and is concerned for the well-being of her family, which is now living in a partially-finished house that needs essential construction work to be completed. She has therefore requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house. 

She states that she feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that she is being provided, because this way she will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like wood and cement in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Hostensia

texts.en:
She is single with five children, and they live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life such as the death of her father and sister, sickness amongst the family members, and inadequate capital to properly manage her business.

With the new loan requested, she will buy seedlings, piglets, bags of feed for her pigs, and pay for labor; she will also invest in glass work that is a more lucrative business in town. She holds a positive view for her business's success because she has been doing it for a long time and as such has experience in the business. Also she has customers who buy from her regularly and her business is situated in a good location where the demand for farm products and pork meat is high due to the ever increasing population. With this business activity, the community will benefit from a reduction in prices, and an increase in food supply; the community will not have to travel long distances to buy food.

With the profit from this loan, she will increase her business, educate her children, pay all her hospital bills, provide three square meals to her family, expand her business and support all the village developments. She preferred GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and training for members before the loans are disbursed.  Additionally, the social needs of members is a concern to GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy seeds, piglets and feed, and to pay for farm work and glass work.

loans.name: Abdulaziz Al- Amiry Group

texts.en:
Abdulaziz Al- Amiry is a four-member group. All the members of the group are poor ladies from Sana`a, Yemen. Together they applied for a 100,000 YER loan from AMB.

Khiria is a 35-year-old married woman who has some children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated and living in a poor area in Sana`a. Her house is very old and in miserable condition. The house is vulnerable to fall down at any time. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she needs more money in order to complete the renovation. She asked for a loan of 25,000 YER to buy cement and bricks. She hopes that after the completion of her house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve the living conditions of her family and open a savings account.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to use for renovating her house.

loans.name: La Buena Vecina 2 Group

texts.en:
Juliana is one of the members of the group La Buena Vecina 2; this group is made up of five micro-entrepreuners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. This is Juliana's 11th loan from Esperanza International, having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step towards business growth. 

Juliana runs a clothing store where she sells different products in small quantities, like shoes, cosmetics, body lotion, etc. She started the business with her savings, and then she found the way to invest by joining a group from Esperanza International. 

She is planning to use her new loan to buy clothes (for kids, men and women), different cosmetic products, and different styles of shoes. 

She is going to use her earnings to continue saving, and to increase her inventory. 

She dreams of having a large general store to provide as many products as she can or that her customers need. 

She is a single mother with two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenges have been to provide for her family and give then a better future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other things to sell

loans.name: Ya Alimamy

texts.en:
This is 58-year-old Ya Alimamy.  She is married and has three children ages 27, 30, and 22. 

In 2008, Ya Alimamy established her business selling biscuits, provisions, drinks, and bread. She began her business because she never went to school and her parents decided that she would become a businesswoman to help support her family. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Ya Alimamy needs the loan to buy more provisions for her business such as sardines, margarine, biscuits, bread and soft drinks. 

With the help of the last loan, she was able to increase her monthly profit by approximately SLL 400,000. Part of the profit was used for savings in her ARD account.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions such as sardines, margarine, biscuits, bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Fatmata. She is single and has no children.  In 2007, Fatmata established her business selling cups, plates, sets of dishes, and lunch bowls. She started her business because she wanted to be gainfully employed as she does go to school. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are the general public. Her business operates six days a week, ten hours a day, and she earns SLL 1,500,000 every month.

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy sets of dishes, plates, and lunch packs. She increased her profits by SLL 500,000 so that she had paid part of her rent for the big shop to start selling wholesale.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for plates, dishes, and lunch bowls

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Fanta. She is married and has four children, ages 25, 17, 15, and 8 years. 

In 1995 she established her garri [cassava flakes], beans, groundnut [peanuts], and bennie seed [sesame seed] business. She began her business because she wants to fight poverty and also to help her husband run the home and adequately care for the children. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,400,000 (leones) every month from this business. 

Fanta would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more bags of garri (cassava flakes), 5 bags of groundnut (peanuts) and bags of bennie seed (sesame seed) for her business.  Her sales were not favorable, but she tried her best with the little she made to increase her monthly profit by SLL 200,000.  She prays that this time she will get more sales and more profit to put in to her savings account.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy garri, beans, groundnuts, and bennie seed for her business.

loans.name: Alkamar Group

texts.en:
The Alkamar Group is made up of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They know each other through family, friendship, and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 240,000 Yemeni Rial (YER).  

Najwa is a 34-year-old married woman with children. She has managed to get a loan from her work, and started to sell some womens' and kids' clothes to her co-workers and neighborhood. Since she has professional experience in this field, she has attracted more clients who have helped her business continue running successfully and more profitably.  

She has applied for a loan from AMB to buy clothes to fulfill extra demand. 

She thanks Kiva lenders for funding the first loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 53 years old and lives in Magsaysay Street, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with 2 children.

Arlene has a fruit stand business and earns approximately PHP 6,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to buy fruits such as bananas, mangoes, avocado, etc.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future,Arlene hopes to improves her business and engage in other businesses someday.

loans.use: to pay for fruits such as bananas, avocados, mangoes, etc

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with 2 children . Mercy is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Mercy is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan  to buy pigs. Mercy has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mercy hopes to have a piggery someday.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is married with 1 child . Severina is 44 years old and lives in Pagadian.
Severina is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer for her gardening activities. Severina has been a member Of PMPC for 2 years. In the future she hopes to become a vegetable supplier in their place.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her gardening

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en: Dioscoro is widowed with 4 children. Dioscoro is 64 years old and lives in Dumalinao. Dioscoro sells beverages  and other merchandise.He has had this business for 2 years. Each month, he earns Php 10,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stock for his sari-sari. He has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Dioscoro hopes to have  a grocery store someday.

loans.use: To buy stock for his sari-sari

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is married with 3 children. She is 62 years old and lives in Pagadian. This sari-sari is how she earns a living and she has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks for her sari-sari like rice, oil, spices and other items. Filomena has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. in the future, Filomena hopes to have a grocery store in her place.

loans.use: to buy items like rice, oil, and spices for her sari-sari.

loans.name: Jeny

texts.en:
Jeny is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. For three years now Jeny raise hogs and operates a store to earn an income. Jeny would like to expand her business to earn more. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets, noodles, coffee, soap, seasoning and toiletries. In the future Jeny hopes to make her business larger and to increase her inventory to attract more loyal customers and increase profitability. 

The income generated provides food and pay for bills for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy feed,  piglets, noodles, coffee, soap, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fabric and thread for dressmaking.

loans.name: 01.02.4 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bê operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup and rolling cake. She is requesting a loan to purchase material and eels to make eel soup and rolling cake.

Bê is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Bê is the group leader of the 04.01.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
One of her children is grown so Bê has 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Bê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bê has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Bê has been involved in this business for 5 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future Bê hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase material and eels to make eel soup and rolling cake.

loans.name: 01.01.1Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân has a retail business selling general items and dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase general items and dry food to resell .

Xuân is 62 years old and she is married with 2 children..
Xuân is the group leader of the 01.01.01 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2008, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Xuân has been involved in this business for 5 years.
The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase general items and dry food to resell .

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años de edad estado civil soltero vive con su padre en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.

Pertenece a la Ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz . Compra sus productos en San Miguel en el Dr. Agro y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes y alquiler del terreno. El préstamo le ayudado para cambiar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es estudiar y mejorar.
Le gusta viajar con su familia y jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Luis, 27, is single and lives with his father in San Miguel Canton in Bolívar Province.  He belongs to San José de las Orquídeas Communal Bank in San Pablo, where the people work in agriculture and ranching.

Luis makes his living in agriculture growing corn.  He buys his products in the Dr. Agro store in San Miguel and sells them in the market there.

Luis requested the loan to buy soil amendments, urea, and liquid fertilizer, and to pay the rent on his plot of land.  The loan has helped him change his family's lifestyle.

His dream is to go to school and to improve.  He likes to travel with his family and play soccer.

loans.use: to buy inputs for growing corn

loans.name: 01.05.7 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Thanh is the group leader of the 01.05.07 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Thanh is applying for a loan to purchase bean to make tofu. She operates a business making tofu. Thanh has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. In 2010, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thanh has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thanh is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase bean to make tofu

loans.name: 11-04-04 Trường Thi Group

texts.en:
Thúy is the group leader of the 11-04-04 Trường Thi solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Thúy has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry food to resell. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thúy is 40 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works with 3 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase dry food to resell

loans.name: Jorge Holmer

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 33 años de edad estado civil Divorciado vive con sus familia en el  Cantón San Miguel provincia de Bolívar.
Pertenece a la Ventanilla San José de las Orquídeas, se encuentra ubicada en San Pablo, pertenece al cantón San 
Miguel se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de animales desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Agripac y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y balanceado para los animales. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos y mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia. Su sueño es seguir en la agricultura y cumplir con los proyectos que se propone.
Le gusta hacer deporte, y mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Jorge is 33 years old, and he is divorced.  He lives with his family in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province.  He belongs to the San José de las Orquídes communal bank.  It is located in San Pablo in the San Miguel canton.  The members work in agriculture and with livestock.  Jorge has been growing corn and raising animals for some years now.  He buys his products at Agripac, and he sells them at the same place.

He requested the loan to buy compost and fertilizers for planting corn.  He will also buy balanced feed for the animals.  The loan helped him to increase his income and to improve his family’s lifestyle.  His dream is to continue farming and to complete the projects he has planned.

He likes to play sports and watch television.

loans.use: to buy supplies like compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 57, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Conrado, a mason, and they have children. Mercedes, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Mercedes operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef meat and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Mercedes is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business. 

Mercedes hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, 46, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gloria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling items individually. She also sells rice for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to help continue operating the business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Gloria hopes that her business will grow bigger and that she will be successful in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, as well as where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wholesale cosmetics and a spare part for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria, quien labora como conserje en un colegio, actualmente tiene bajo su cargo a un hijo que cursa el tercer año de la escuela secundaria, Gloria tiene la necesidad de mejorar las paredes del cuarto de su hijo ya que el material que tiene dio su vida útil, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar material de plycen, marcos de madera, clavos entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria works as a school custodian.  Currently she's responsible for one child, who's in his third year of secondary school.

Gloria needs to improve the walls of her son's bedroom because the material is decomposing.  She's requesting the loan to buy fiber cement, wood frames, nails, and other materials.

loans.use: to buy fiber cement, wood frames, nails, and other materials

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita, 49, is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She has children and they manage their household while operating the business. Mercedita works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedita is a street vendor. She earns an income by getting different products at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Mercedita earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

Mercedita is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy supplies such as candies, cigarettes, snacks and soft drinks.

Mercedita hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies such as candies, cigarettes, snacks and soft drinks for her street vending.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 65, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Jesus and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Maria operates the buy and sell business for her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and then sells them with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like towels, blankets, slippers and other products.

Maria hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that all her children will be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like towels, blankets, slippers and other products.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
This is Annaliza, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Aluel, a factory worker and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annaliza is a street vendor. She sells different products at retail. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Annaliza dreams that her store will become a grocery store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 54 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. To make a living, Analyn sells blankets and pillowcases in her village, which she has been doing for almost three years. She earns about 300-500 PHP a day. 

Analyn wants to improve her business, but she lacks the necessary capital. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more blankets and pillowcases to sell. She hopes to expand her business as well as her family status.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and pillowcases

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan , age 22, is single and lives with his parents and brothers and sister in a village about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His mother stays at home and does housework and his father is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, three wheeled motorcycle taxis were commonly known as "tuk tuks" but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

Sovan works at a call center for a mobile operations company in Phnom Pen. He wants to continue studying at the university in Phnom Penh, majoring in accounting. Hence he decided to apply for a loan to pay for his schooling.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia, 58, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Marcelino, a security guard, and they have children. Eufemia and her husband manage their own household. She works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Eufemia owns and oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers, usually from the local community, to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Eufemia. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Eufemia is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain their motorcycle.

Eufemia hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.
